neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a hot up-and-coming neighborhood that is a short T-ride away from downtown Boston.    There are many shops and restaurants within walking distance in JP (please ask me if you'd like a recommendation.)  The apartment is also right on the edge of the Arboretum and the Forest Hills Cemetery for nature walks, and a 30 minute walk to Jamaica Pond.
notes: Street parking in front of the house requires resident permit Monday-Friday 8 am-6 pm but is free at other times. During weekday 8 am-6 pm, you can park nearby on the main street using meter, 2 hr max.  Another parking option is LAZ parking lot two blocks away.  There is plenty of free street parking without permit needed in JP, so you may need to search a bit further afield.
transit: The apartment is about a 2 minute walk from the Forest Hills subway and bus station.  It's a quick ride to downtown Boston with easy (and free) transfer to other subway lines connecting to other parts of the city (Cambridge, etc.)
access: The whole apartment is available for your enjoyment: you can relax in the living room with Smart TV, books, and board games, get work done at the desk, cook in the kitchen, or hang out on the back porch!  Laundry is also available for free in the apartment. Not all bedrooms are available for guest use.
interaction: I will try to meet you when you check in, but if not, I will be available by phone.  I want you to have a great stay so I will help as much as possible with recommendations and tips.
house_rules: - It is a shared building, please be conscious of your noise level. - Treat the place as you would your own home. - Contact me with any questions, anytime.
host_about: I'm a Jewish, queer, social-justice oriented, 30-something infectious disease epidemiologist who loves to travel, explore new places/meet new people, spend time in nature (swimming, hiking, etc.), dance, cook (and eat!), and read.

name: Convenient Location Private 1 Bdr 1st Floor Apt
summary: This 1st floor home is located in a very quiet, urban neighborhood and is accessible to public transportation, stores, restaurants within a convenient 0.6 mile radius. This is an Old Victorian home built in 1875 and was completely renovated in 2016 combining the old New England charm with modern amenities. Fully-equipped kitchen and back porch. We accessorized this apartment for your short/long-term stay. Cozy living room and a bedroom with a Quinn size bed, 2 people accommodation. Central Air.
space: Keeping our home organized and clean is our first priority. The location of this home is prime to guests that are seeking a quiet, peaceful time while still able to explore the popular areas of Boston that are less than 30 minutes away via train or car. Enjoy a beverage at the back porch while listening to beautiful sounds of nature. Neighbors usually play the piano and the beautiful sound of a flute in the air can be heard. You may even see a few turkeys roaming around! *Please be mindful that check out time is strict at 11am or before. Our cleaning crew arrives at 11am sharp to prepare home for next guest arriving shortly after.  *Check in time is only after 3pm. We cannot accept guests prior to 3pm due to required preparation time for cleaning. We apologize but due to the high volume of visitors per week, no exceptions can be made for check in or out times.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a very vibrant and a lively section of Boston. You can have a morning walk at Jamaica Pond, Arboretum park, Mike's Gym or grab a fresh coffee from City Feeds, Nero Cafe or J.P licks. This home is an approximate 5-7 minute walking distance to Whole Foods Market, Stop & Shop, CVS, 7-11, Same Old Place Pizza and only a 4 minute walk to the Stony Brook (Orange Line Train Station) and bus route #39 which connect you anywhere in Boston and the surrounding cities at ease! We are a 15 minute drive (30-minute train ride) to Longwood Medical, Copley Square Place, Downtown Boston, the famous North End, Symphony Hall, Berkeley School of Music, Fenway Park (RedSox Stadium), etc. Please read street signs to avoid tickets for resident-only parking and street cleaning.
notes: There are other visitors that come and go on the 2nd floor. We try our very best to ensure everyone understands to keep medium-high noise levels to a minimum. Our cleaning crew arrives at 11am sharp to prepare home for next guest arriving shortly after.  *Check in time is only after 3pm. We cannot accept guests prior to 3pm due to required preparation time for cleaning. We apologize but due to the high volume of visitors per week, no exceptions can be made for check in or out times.
transit: • Street-parking is available on our street as well as surrounding streets. It may be tough to find parking after 6pm. Please read street signs to avoid tickets for resident-only parking and street cleaning. • MBTA, Stony Brook train station is a 5 minute walk from our home. Take a left out of our home, take a right on to Boylston St, walk 5 minutes down and cross Lamartine St, where you will find Stony Brook T station on your  left hand side. This train connects you to all areas in Boston and further out in Massachusetts.
access: The entire first floor is yours! Back-porch and yard is accessible via the sliding kitchen door. Cups, wine/drinking glasses are available in the top-right cabinet above the stove. Please see notes posted on cabinets. *Please be mindful that check out time is strict at 11am or before. We cannot accept guests prior to 3pm due to required preparation time for cleaning. We apologize but due to the high volume of visitors per week, no exceptions can be made for check in or out times.
interaction: We are available on an urgent-need basis. Upon your arrival, please let us know if there is anything you require prior to continuing your stay. This is a self-sufficient AirBnB unit and stay. We do not offer additional amenities or services other than what is posted in our listing. Cleaning services during your stay are not provided. If there is an urgent situation, please let us know and we will arrive to inspect. Additional charges may apply.

Thank you for your cooperation  :-)

name: Welcoming 2 Bedroom Apt - Close proximity to MBTA
summary: If you're looking to just enjoy all that Boston has to offer or are here to celebrate a graduation, attend a sporting event, milestone birthday or anything else, we promise you this apartment will suit all of your needs. You can access the entire city while feeling cozy and content sipping your coffee or tea on the front porch deck.  This second floor walk up is a 4 minute walk to the Forest Hill's Train Station and is minutes from a variety of restaurants and coffee shops.
space: This apartment offers a fully equipped kitchen, a separate dinning area, a living room, 2 bedrooms along with a washer and dryer.  Guest have access to their own private decks (one on the front porch along with one on the back).  We also provide air conditioning in the summer months.
description: If you're looking to just enjoy all that Boston has to offer or are here to celebrate a graduation, attend a sporting event, milestone birthday or anything else, we promise you this apartment will suit all of your needs. You can access the entire city while feeling cozy and content sipping your coffee or tea on the front porch deck.  This second floor walk up is a 4 minute walk to the Forest Hill's Train Station and is minutes from a variety of restaurants and coffee shops. This apartment offers a fully equipped kitchen, a separate dinning area, a living room, 2 bedrooms along with a washer and dryer.  Guest have access to their own private decks (one on the front porch along with one on the back).  We also provide air conditioning in the summer months. The entire 2nd floor apartment along with the 2nd floor apartment's front and back porches. During your stay, we will be there to answer any questions you may have about the apartment as well as things to do in Boston. We also live on t
neighborhood_overview: If you are up to exploring our neighborhood, we have several green areas that we highly recommend if you have the time.  The Arnold Arboretum is a lovely space to walk, exercise or just be one with nature.  The Arnold Arboretum is part of Boston’s Emerald Necklace and it is a true gem.  It has an outstanding collection of Bonsai trees.  We also have the ability to walk up our street (which is a dead end) and it leads to the historic Forest Hills Cemetery (FHC).  This is another great place to take a walk or jog.  There is a lovely small lake (Lake Hibiscus) located in the middle of FHC where you can sit and take in the scenery.  You may also run into a pack of wild turkeys or just take in some incredible bird watching.  Back in the Victorian era, families would enjoy picnics at FHC.  It is one of the oldest cemeteries in the country and it is also part of Boston's Emerald Necklace.
notes: There are many places to catch a bite to eat in our immediate neighborhood e.g. The Dogwood Restaurant, Brassica Cafe, Forest Hills Pizza, East Ocean, Tikki Masala, and the Forest Hills Dinner.  Of course, Boston has so many amazing restaurants choose from.
transit: We are so fortunate to have the Forest Hill's Orange Line Train/Bus Station located in such close proximity to our home.  It is approximately a 2 to 5 minute walk to the station, which can take you to any location in Boston.  It is so nice to be able to take the train into town and not have to deal with the expense of parking or the hassle of finding a parking space.  Taking an Uber is also another inexpensive way to travel downtown, Fenway Park or to one of our many museums.
access: The entire 2nd floor apartment along with the 2nd floor apartment's front and back porches.
interaction: During your stay, we will be there to answer any questions you may have about the apartment as well as things to do in Boston. We also live on the first floor, so we are very accessible.  We can be reached by phone and email as well.
house_rules: - Quiet hours: 10pm-6am - Not suitable for individuals allergic to cats - Smoking and vaping are not allowed
host_about: I have lived in Boston for most of my life and I absolutely love this city.  I am a sports enthusiast (devoted Bruins fan) and love to travel via my Harley, by plane or train.   My wife and I have been married for over twenty years and I hope to have twenty more.  As a cancer survivor, I truly believe that you need to find the joy in your journey.

name: 3rd Floor Master Suite in desirable Jamaica Plain
summary: My urban oasis is close to Jamaica Pond, Longwood Medical area, Fenway Park, Franklin Park Zoo.  The large, sunny and clean 3rd floor master suite has a queen  bed, private bath with walk-in shower, and plenty of dresser and closet space, a desk and a mini-fridge.  A continental breakfast is included.   Close to public transportation:  Green Line, Orange line and bus are close by.  1 off-street parking space is available. I have 3 cats, so the house is not amenable to those with cat allergies.
space: A special home in a perfect neighborhood!  And I am sure you will love it.  Although located in the city of Boston (Jamaica Plain), the house is private and feels as though you are in the suburbs.  A large private side garden is the perfect place for breakfast or a glass of wine.  The house is off of the Jamaicaway, so there is some noise from traffic, and there are also regular ambulances taking patients to the nearby Longwood Medical Area hospitals.  I've added a "white noise" machine in the bedroom.  The rooms are well proportioned, nicely decorated, clean and inviting.  It is a short 7 minute walk to the Jamaica Pond.  If you are a walker, you will love it here.  It is a 25 minute walk to the Longwood Medical Area, 35 minutes to Fenway Park, and 40 minutes to the Museum of Fine Arts.  Since the Master Suite is on the 3rd floor, a mini-fridge has been provided and stocked with water and beverages (so that you don't have to make the trek to the kitchen for a glass of water!)

A continental breakfast is included.   Close to public transportation:  Green Line, Orange line and bus are close by.  1 off-street parking space is available. neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is (in my humble opinion) the best neighborhood in Boston.  Within walking distance (10 minutes) of my house is:  Whole Foods, CVS Pharmacy, Canary Square restaurant and lounge, Brendan Behan Irish Pub, Blue Nile Ethiopian Cuisine, Tres Gatos Spanish tapas.  A short 7 minute walk brings you to the Jamaica Pond.  A wonderful place to stroll.  Bike trails begin across the street from my house, and bring you to downtown Boston.  Everything that you need is basically within walking distance.
notes: NA
transit: 10 minute walk to the Heath Street Green Line Station. 15-20 minutes walk to either Stony Brook or Jackson Square Orange Line Stations. Bus 39 to Copley Square is a short 5 minute walk away. 1 off-street parking space is available.
access: You are welcome to share the kitchen - just let us know in advance.  And of course you will want to sit and enjoy the beautiful garden. A parking space is available off-street.
interaction: I love meeting new people and will greet you if possible when you arrive and be available to answer questions and assist as needed.    I will provide a continental breakfast each morning, although I will probably have left for work by the time you wake and are ready to eat.   I really look forward to hosting you in the beautiful city of Boston.
house_rules: - I have 3 cats, so the home is not amenable to those with cat allergies - I have an second bedroom with a full bed and private bath across the hall.  Perfect for a teenager accompanying parents to Boston.
host_about: I am so looking forward to hosting you in my home!  I love being home, but also travel frequently for both business and pleasure.  As a seasoned traveler, I know what I need and love in a lodging.  I will do my best to bring that experience to you.  Adventure travel is my favorite, and I have been to many incredible destinations -- Antarctica, Galapagos Islands, Safaris in Zambia, Botswana and Namibia -- are highlights.  I've worked and lived for 1 year in Lusaka, Zambia.  I also love travelling to US cities to visit family -  Cincinnati, Pittsburgh, Omaha - all great to visit because of the friends and family that live there.  But there is no place like home, and I love coming home every time!

space: This room is on the second floor of a big old house, with lots of charm. It has high ceilings and all wood floors,. This is not a hotel, it is my home. The room itself is freshly painted. It is cleaned thoroughly for each and every guest, and all linens are washed prior to your stay. You will be provided with a set of clean towels, (a wash clothe, a hand towel, and a large bath towel). More clean towels can be provided, just ask. There are hooks in your room for you to hang up towels.  The shared bathroom is cleaned daily. The common space is cleaned weekly. The shared kitchen is cleaned daily. There are nice spaces to sit outside in the garden as well.  The host is a professional gardener, and has created a lovely garden for guests to enjoy.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of the most authentic and unique parts of Boston. Home to the politically active, lots of young families,  and a vibrant art community. It very diverse here. Lots of great restaurants, and home of the largest outdoor spaces. The Arnold Arboretum, and the Jamaica Pond are both about a 20 minute walk from my house, they are the best places for walking or running. The Sam Adams Brewery is just a 4 minute walk form my place. People love this tour.
notes: If you will be upset about some peeling paint or a few cracks in these old walls, please look for other accommodations. This is not a hotel. Otherwise most people find my place to be clean and charming and in a great location.
transit: My place is just a 5 minute walk to the Stony Brook T station, on the Orange line. From Stony brook to the city center is about a 20 minute ride. Copley Square is about 10-15 minutes away. For the Hospitals, you will need to go to Copley and switch to the Green line, or take a shuttle bus from Ruggles station. Or walk to Center Street, and take the #39 Bus straight to the Hospitals.  There is plenty of free, on-street parking in front of my house, or very close on the same block.
access: My house is a 5 minute walk to the T station in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood near the Stony Brook stop on the Orangeline.
interaction: I am always just a text or a phone call away, and I am often home when I am not at work. I am happy to help my guests with any questions and I enjoy talking about politics if you are so inclined! Let's have coffee! Please let me know if any issues come up, I would rather you tell me, so I can try to resolve and make your stay as good as I can.
house_rules: - The maximum for this room is 1 guest. -Do not invite other people into my home.   If you misrepresent the number of guests you will be declined or cancelled. -Remove shoes, leave them on plastic trays in front hallway. -You must manually lock the front door each time you come in or go out. - Clean up after yourself in shared common areas. -Good communication is key, please use the airbnb app for all communications. -There may be other guests staying and you will be sharing the bathroom with the host and one other guest. -We expect guests to be reasonably quiet coming in and out before (9AM and after 10PM.  We have one cat who lives in this house. Thank you :-)
host_about:
I have worked as a professional photographer for the past 25 years. My favorite type of photography is documentary and photo journalism. You might see some images of my work around my home.
I know my city well, and I love giving my guests tips and ideas for fun things to do. So please tell me a little bit about you and why you are coming to Boston. 
I also consider myself an urban gardener. I started a small gardening business a few years ago, and I participate in a community garden down the street from my place. 
I especially love meeting new people and hearing their stories. I have travelled around the world and I love staying in peoples homes.
My friends say my home is very welcoming and friendly. Currently, I have three listings in my home, Charming Room in Hip JP near the T #1, Charming Room in Hip JP near the T, #2, and Charming Apartment, Jamaica Plain.
If it is available, I am open to sharing all three listings to one party. 
I believe in sharing good food with the people you love, exploring the world, and treating others the way you want them to treat you.

space: This room is on the second floor of a big old house that has  a lot of charm. It has high ceilings and all wood floors, which gives it a very warm feeling. This is not a hotel, it is my home. The room itself is freshly painted. It is cleaned thoroughly for each and every guest, and all linens are washed prior to your stay. You will be provided with a set of clean towels, (a wash clothe, a hand towel, and a large bath towel). More clean towels can be provided, just ask. There are hooks in your room for you to hang up towels. There is a luggage rack for your suitcase, (please do not put your suitcase on the bed). The shared bathroom is cleaned daily. I don't mind if you use my kitchen lightly, as long as you clean up after yourself. I prefer that you eat in the kitchen or dining room, rather than in the bedroom. There are nice spaces to sit outside in the garden as well.  The host is a professional gardener, and has created a lovely garden for guests to enjoy.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is home to some of Boston's premier parks (Jamaica Pond and Franklin Park), as well as a greenway that leads downtown. In addition, it is home to large array of restaurants and cafes, all within a few minute walk of our house. See Guidebook section for more detail.
notes: Please read our House Rules in the "Basics" section on this page. There may be other guests staying in another room down the hall, so respecting quiet hours and cleaning up after yourself in the common spaces is much appreciated! Please no shoes on second floor and please use doors softly at night to avoid waking up others. We do not have any pets, but our daughter, who lives on our third floor, sometimes visits with her dog -- a rescued greyhound. Please let us know if dogs make you nervous. We can sometimes offer you off-street parking but with the caveat that juggling of vehicles would be required, as we have a plug-in car that needs to end up in the driveway every night. Best is to run it by us before booking so we have a chance to consider it with you.
transit: Three minutes from the Green St. "T" station on the Orange line, you can easily get downtown. The #39 bus is about 8 minutes walk, and it takes you directly by the Longwood medical area and into Copley Square. We are also close enough to downtown that an Uber or Lyft is usually only minutes away. For the very adventurous, there is a bike-share station at Green Street "T" stop.
access: Our kitchen is not available for cooking. Guests are free to use the kitchen to eat food they have brought from outside, and to use refrigerator to store food. They are free to use either of our porches in nice weather.
interaction: Interactions are up to you--we take your lead. We are always available by cell phone to answer any questions, or guide you through Boston to enhance your stay.

Jamaica Plain, or more commonly, JP, is one of Boston’s most diverse neighborhoods. You won’t find chain stores here. neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain, or more commonly, JP, is one of Boston’s most diverse neighborhoods. You won’t find chain stores here. What you will find is a community committed to the environment, fair-trade commerce, and sustainable agriculture, a place that’s hip and way left-of-center when it comes to politics. Once described as the “Eden of America,” JP evolved after the Civil War from a series of large farms to one of the country’s first streetcar suburbs. The neighborhood includes a key part of the city’s famed Emerald Necklace Conservancy, a seven-mile series of contiguous parks designed by renowned landscape architect Frederick Law Olmsted in the late 19th century. Main Attractions: Universities: located close by, or easy access to, many world-renowned universities such as Boston University (go Terriers!) and Tufts University. Hospitals: Hospitals such as Boston Children's Hospital, Brigham and Women's and Beth Israel are only a few located in the Longwood Medical Center, only 30 minute walk.
notes: Key code to access apartment will be provided on the day of arrival.
transit: Close to Orange Line (Stony Brook T stop), Green line (E), and bus to Copley Square.

name: Victorian Treetop Apartment - Close to Everything!
summary: My home is perfect for Business / Medical professionals, or those travelers looking for a comfortably furnished pied-a-terre for an extended stay while working or discovering New England. We are close to public transportation, Whole Foods Market, local restaurants/pubs, hospitals, universities and schools. You’ll love my place because of the friendly neighborhood filled with Victorian homes, the public parks, the light open loft-like rooms, the comfy beds.
space: A fully furnished 2 bedroom apartment with designer furniture, lighting and accessories.  A real gem of a home in the heart of a very walkable, friendly neighborhood. The apartment is approximately 1600 sq/ft. on one full floor.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant, artistic, ethnically mixed neighborhood of Boston. Perfectly situated and accessible to all of downtown Boston without the hassle of driving or parking. It is also a very walkable neighborhood, close to local restaurants, pubs, shops, and services.
notes: Local services and shops include: Two CVS stores, a Whole Foods Market, Stop & Shop Grocery Store, dry cleaners, craft shops, a new public library, a community gym/pool. numerous local restaurants and pubs, coffee shops and historical sites, as well as running, hiking and biking trails. For those guests wishing to stay longer than 7 days or longer than 28 days there will be discounted rates as listed when you inquire with your dates. I also offer general cleaning services for those guests with extended stays upon request. A wonderful maid service to clean the kitchen, bathroom and vacuum the entire apartment on a scheduled basis can be offered to you at a minimal extra fee, just ask!
transit: We are two blocks from the Stoney Brooke T Station on the Orange line, and one block from Centre Street with its numerous public bus lines in and out of town. Via the train, Copley Square is a 15 minuet direct ride. The airport is 30 -45 mins depending on the time of day.
access: Full 3rd floor of my single family home, you have your own access off main front and rear stairwells, plus access to a beautifully landscaped backyard for relaxing and enjoying the ever changing seasons.
interaction: Im available via cell as are my two assistants who work on the property M-F 8am till 4pm.  If you have a question or a concern after hours or during the weekend, please reach out to me directly. Ken: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Eleni or Katherine: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) M-F, 8am -4pm)

name: Private room 4 minute walk to Stony Brook T stop
summary: Guests will have a private room with a queen sized bed with a memory foam mattress and are welcome to use the spacious kitchen, living room, and dining room. Guests are invited to hang out and watch movies (we have HBO, Netflix, Showtime and Hulu) or venture out and see the local scenery.    We are a quick 4 minute walk from the Orange line Stony Brook T stop (what we in Boston call the subway) and an 8 minute walk to the famous Sam Adams Brewery. Trips to downtown take under 20 minutes!
space: Our place is nestled in a quiet neighborhood next to the Southwest Corridor Park which runs straight into the heart of Boston. Our apartment is equipped with washer, dryer, dishwasher, toaster oven, microwave and all of the necessary tools for anyone wanting to cook a nice meal. We have two comfortable couches and all of the streaming services one could want for a lazy day. We have free street parking and wifi for all of our guests.

neighborhood_overview: We live right by Jamaica Plain, one of Boston's hip and diverse neighborhoods. JP, as we call it, is a paradise for foodies and those who are looking for some of Boston's most hidden treasures. Local attractions include the Jamaica Pond, Centre Street (home to the best Cuban food you will find in Boston and some of the cutest local stores and bars), the Arnold Aboretum as well as the Franklin Park Zoo - not to forget about the Samuel Adams brewery that is just around the corner from our house.
notes: NA
transit: Our place is a 4 minute walk to the Orange Line T stop (Boston's subway) which will get guests downtown in less than 20 minutes and to Cambridge in 35 minutes. Guests are also seconds away from the Southwest Corridor Park which runs straight into the heart of Boston and boasts the city's best bike paths. Guests are a quick walk from the next Hub station where bicycles can be rented as a part of Boston's bicycle sharing service. For guests that are driving, we have free parking on our street and we are a quick 15 minute drive to the heart of downtown including the MFA, Prudential Tower and the Seaport District.
access: Guests will have their own quiet private room and will have access to the living room, dining room and kitchen. This listing has only one guest room so guests will never have to share the space with other guests.
interaction: Sonja (my girlfriend) and I our both in our mid 20's and are well traveled. Sonja is German and works downtown and I am finishing up law school. We are happy to give directions, tips and pointers to all of our guests. We are also happy to interact and show our guests around the neighborhood but of course make our guests' privacy and comfort our first priority.
house_rules: NA
host_about: I am a third year law student studying in Boston. I love to travel and meet new people and feel strongly that you get out of this world whatever you put in. Before starting law school I lived in Europe and traveled extensively. Even though I don't get the chance these days to fly around the world I hope to meet the same kinds of amazing people right here in Boston.

name: Cozy 2 bd Duplex w/ Porch in Jamaica Plain, Boston
summary: Sunny, cozy, & clean renovated family friendly 2 bedroom bi-level apartment in 1860s 2 family house in the popular Jamaica Plain ('JP') section of Boston. Located in the convenient JP South area and adjacent to the beautiful Sumner Hill area of JP.  Open layout with kitchen, bathroom, and living room/dining on the first floor and 2 bedrooms on the 2nd floor.  Sleeps 4-5 comfortably, but can sleep up to 6.  Parking on street.  Walking distance to public transportation, restaurants, parks.
space: The rental is an entire apartment in a 2 family house.  Floor to ceiling windows in living room on the first floor allow for natural light and flow out to the mahogany porch and small yard.  Granite counters in the well appointed kitchen, hardwood floors in living room and bedrooms.  Front load washer and dryer conveniently in unit for your use.  Window air conditioning units in each room.  Great heat (you are free to adjust for your own comfort). Sleeps 4-5 comfortably, but can sleep up to 6.  The 2 bedrooms are on the 2nd floor of the apartment.  Queen sleigh bed, desk, rocking chair, bureau, and small closet in the master bedroom.  Bunk bed and twin bed (total 3 twins) in 2nd bedroom, along with bureau and large closet.  Fold up small cot with memory foam mattress if needed for 6th person.  Also pack and play, high chair, child dishware, child bathroom stool, umbrella stroller, and child safety gate for stairs available.  Linens, coffee beans, tea, creamers, spices, condiments, soap

summary: This modern custom townhouse is on a quiet cul-de sac in beautiful Jamaica Plain. Within a five minute walk from the house is Harvard's 268 acre Arnold Arboretum. The Orange Line Subway (T) station at Forest Hills is also five minutes away. Downtown Boston is 5 stops away. The 39 bus is two blocks away and is a twenty minute ride from The Longwood Medical Area, The Museum of Fine Arts and Copley Square. JP is a vibrant neighborhood with an abundance of fine restaurants coffee shops and boutiques
space: This is a very well equipped house. It is my house, not a rental property. I will be traveling around the world and the house will be professionally managed while I am away. It has 100% Egyptian Cotton Sheets and a mixture of goose down and synthetic pillows. There are table settings for fifteen. The house has all hardwood floors and a central sound system. Central Air and Insulated shades keep the house cool in the summer.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is an artistic, diverse, progressive, family oriented neighborhood with a majority population of highly educated people. It is surrounded by two large parks and Jamaica Pond. Centre Street has an abundance of cafes. restaurants, boutiques and antique and thrift shops. Hampstead Rd is a very friendly cul-de-sac where everyone know one another. Every Thursday evening the main street, Centre Street, hosts food trucks and live music.
notes: The house is available April 1 through September 30.  There is two month minimum for rentals.
transit: The house has two private off street parking places. Forest Hill Station is a five minute walk to the house. From Forest Hills the Orange Line Train is a twenty minute ride downtown or a ten minute ride to South Station. The 39 bus is also a five minute walk. The 39 bus is a twenty minute ride from the Longwood Medical Area and The Museum of Fine Arts and a thirty minute ride from Copley Place. Bike rentals are at Forest Hills Station and two bike paths lead downtown.
access: Guests have access to all spaces accept for garage (except for bike storage)
interaction: The house will be professionally managed. My cleaning lady, Rosa, is available weekly if you would like the home professionally cleaned.

space: Hi, My name is Maverick, I'm a Berklee College of Music grad and touring musician. When my band is on tour, my house is yours! It is located in the Jamaica Plain section of Boston next to beautiful Franklin Park. The space is fully furnished and the bedroom has a brand new pillowtop queen size bed! There's also a full size high-quality no-leaks self-inflating air mattress available for the living room if you're bringing more than 2 people. The wifi is included, and you can use our Netflix account. We also have an N64, 4 controllers and a whole lot of games if you're feeling nostaligic =). We will have towels and linens and shampoo included as well. The apartment is a garden level unit with two small windows.  Kitchen comes with pots, pans and dishes, seasonings and dishwashing soap. The apartment has a large bedroom, a living room/kitchen area and full bath with a large shower. description: Our unit is a private small one bedroom apartment with a kitchen, bathroom and private entrance. The listing comes with a living room area complete with Netflix (Wii) and WiFi. The apartment has central air and heat adjustable by thermostat in living room area. The apartment has a small kitchen complete with pots and pans and dishes (please wash when finished!). Off-street parking is included for one vehicle.  Video walkthrough available on request (Airbnb does not permit links in descriptions) Hi, My name is Maverick, I'm a Berklee College of Music grad and touring musician. When my band is on tour, my house is yours! It is located in the Jamaica Plain section of Boston next to beautiful Franklin Park. The space is fully furnished and the bedroom has a brand new pillowtop queen size bed! There's also a full size high-quality no-leaks self-inflating air mattress available for the living room if you're bringing more than 2 people. The wifi is included, and you can use our Netflix accoun
neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: NA
transit: We're 8-10 min walking distance from the nearest subway stop (depending on your walking speed), which is Stonybrook on the orange line MBTA, and very close to many bus lines! We live up a steep hill from the subway, so if you have bags, we recommend taking a Lyft/Uber when you first arrive.  If you're traveling to tourist areas or downtown, a 10-15 Lyft/Uber will get you there, or you can take the MBTA (20-40 min, depending on destination). I am also a Lyft and Uber driver, so if you haven't used one or both of them before, you can use my personal code for ride credits up to $50 (new Lyft/Uber customers only)!  Lyft: DORIAN262 Uber: EOEBP
access: My apartment is the garden level floor of a house. There are tenants above my place, but they have no access to the apartment and there is a private entrance for my unit. You'll have free access to the 1st floor and the huge deck out back (for smoking or hanging out). There is tons of street parking (no permit required) and a driveway right next to the apartment entrance, where you can park one vehicle.
interaction: We don't stay in the apartment while guests are there as we're usually on tour, but we're very available via text or phone and we're usually not too far away if there's an emergency, so please let us know if you need anything and we'll be happy to help!

name: 3 Bedroom Apartment by the Park
summary: Great place with 3 bedrooms near public transportation with easy access to downtown and South Station.  Directly across the street from Franklin Park with a golf course and Franklin Park Zoo.  An urban apartment for people who want to be near green space and parks (Franklin Park, Forest Hills Cemetery, South West Corridor Park, and Arnold Arboretum).  Close to some great restaurants and tourist attractions like Brassica, Doyle's Cafe, and the Dogwood Cafe and the Sam Adams Brewery.
space: We are using smart locks to make it easy to be very flexible for your arrival time.  We also have a Roku TV to help you stream any programming you may want to watch.

notes: Our goal is to provide you a clean and comfortable place to stay.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make things easier for you or improve the quality of your trip.
transit: We are close to the Forest Hills Station serving the Orange Subway line, the Needham line of the Commuter Rail, and several bus lines.  Uber in and out of the city is generally rather reasonable.  We are also close to Green Street Station.

host_about:
I'm a small business owner with an engineering background.  My partner and I have lived in JP for 8 years and know the area pretty well.  We like to eat at great restaurants and enjoy the tremendous parks and green space in JP.

We love to travel.  After we had an amazing experience with AirBnB in Bali, Indonesia, we decided that we should become hosts.  We want to provide a great place for you to stay and a great experience visiting Boston.

name: Beautifully renovated apartment in the trees
summary: This sun filled, spacious apartment is located very close to public transportation, both the T (metro) and bus to Boston, the beautiful Arnold Arboretum, shopping and Jamaica Pond, a historic park designed by Olmsted. You’ll love the location, the views, the new kitchen and bath. The three bedrooms are perfect for couples and business travelers.
space: The apartment is in a lovely Victorian house in a quiet neighborhood.  It has a separate entrance.  There is a spacious open plan living room, dining room and kitchen, newly decorated and a brand new tile bath.  There are three spacious, sun-filled bedrooms: a very large room with a queen bed, a large room with two twins and a twin bedroom, all freshly painted and decorated.

Our neighborhood has lovely old trees, beautifully restored Victorian homes.  It
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has lovely old trees, beautifully restored Victorian homes.  It is a very attractive and easy walk to shops.
notes: It is a 5 minute walk to the T, and an approximately 15 - 20 minute ride to downtown Boston, museums, Fenway Park and local attractions.  Central Jamaica Plain, just a shady and pleasant block away, has many great coffee shops, small cafes, and shopping.
transit: The Green Street T station is just three blocks away, taking you to downtown Boston.  The bus is one block away and stops directly in front of the Museum of Fine Arts.
access: There is a lovely garden and plenty of parking.
interaction: We have lived in the Boston area for over 30 years and are happy to point give advice about local attractions but never intrude on your privacy.

No feminine products, paper towels, tissues, or anything else please. Clogs that require a plumber are at the cost of the guest.

name: South Room in Friendly House
summary: My place is good for solo adventurers, business travelers or couples.  Room on top floor, bathroom shared with only one other person on the floor.  Full kitchen on first floor.  Quiet residential street offers enough parking for visitors. Just during summer watch out for cleaning days!
space: Front door is using August Smart Lock. You should receive a "key" as soon as you book the room.  The room is on third floor, straight up facing stairs, key is left in door lock for you to take. Bathroom on third floor is on your right as you face your room.  On left you can admire ‘antique’ collection on my CDs :) Shared kitchen is on first floor. As well as an extra half bathroom.

There you switch last time on to Orange line going to Jackson Square.  From Jackson Square stop you walk up the hill, turning Right out the station till you get to Sunnyside Street. It is a L shaped street. House is on third right after you turn left following Sunnyside.  Once you here, there is a drive share car from Getaround.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Private & serene getaway w/ driveway parking!
summary: Quiet, private & serene 3rd floor apt. Separate entrance, full bath & kitchenette. 650 sq. feet! Bright and spacious, yet cozy. 3 blocks from the center of JP. 5 min. walk to the 39 bus to Longwood Med. Area and Back Bay. 15 min. walk to the Orange Line T (subway); ten minutes to Back Bay Station on the T.  1/2 block from Jamaica Pond. 5 min. walk to the Arboretum. In spring, summer and fall there's driveway parking. Not good for people with huge luggage!
space: This is a private and serene space away from (but close to) the hustle and bustle of city life. Jamaica Plain, where we live, is one of the many smaller towns/areas that make up the city of Boston. Look it up on the map and make sure it's what you want! We are three miles from downtown Boston. Our newly renovated attic space is completely separate from our 2nd floor condo.  The large open living area is both cozy and spacious at the same time. There are six skylights which let in fresh air and lots of light. There are plenty of comfortable places to lounge: a deep, low sofa; a daybed and chairs.  The kitchenette contains just enough to make a small simple meal: utensils, microwave, and mini fridge as well as a coffee maker and an electric tea kettle. There is a large utility sink too. There's a sharp knife for cutting fruit or vegetables.  Brand new central air conditioning and very effective heating system! The skylights look out onto rooftops and trees and even give a glimpse of the
description: Quiet, private & serene 3rd floor apt. Separate entrance, full bath & kitchenette. 650 sq. feet! Bright and spacious, yet cozy. 3 blocks from the center of JP. 5 min. walk to the 39 bus to Longwood Med. Area and Back Bay. 15 min. walk to the Orange Line T (subway); ten minutes to Back Bay Station on the T.  1/2 block from Jamaica Pond. 5 min. walk to the Arboretum. In spring, summer and fall there's driveway parking. Not good for people with huge luggage! This is a private and serene space away from (but close to) the hustle and bustle of city life. Jamaica Plain, where we live, is one of the many smaller towns/areas that make up the city of Boston. Look it up on the map and make sure it's what you want! We are three miles from downtown Boston. Our newly renovated attic space is completely separate from our 2nd floor condo.  The large open living area is both cozy and spacious at the same time. There are six skylights which let in fresh air and lots of light. There are plenty of comfor
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of the many smaller towns/areas that make up the City of Boston. Look it up on the map and make sure it's what you want! We are three miles from downtown Boston.  This is a lovely, pretty and safe neighborhood. It's a diverse and welcoming  part of town with a great and unexpected combination of city life and green space. Jamaica Pond is just down the street and it's a great place for a stroll or run or you can head to the Arnold Arboretum for a longer walk. Herons, hawks and other birds abound and we have a neighborhood screech owl you might hear at dusk. During the temperate months there's a Hubway (look them up) bicycle rental station a few blocks away. We will lend you helmets if you need them. There are dozens of great restaurants in Jamaica Plain and lots of fun shopping -- everything from thrift stores to specialty boutiques. Delicious coffee can be found in a number of different places where you can lounge comfortably and people watch or work. JP is a speci
notes: This is on the third floor so not a great choice for people with enormous luggage! Please ask if you intend to have anyone visit while you stay with us. Please go easy on the heat! We have a very economical ductless mini-split heat/ac system for the large space but there's electric baseboard in the bedroom and bathroom which is very expensive to run. We like to be kind to the environment and we ask you to do the same and be mindful of the extra expense to us if you don't use it sparingly. The small print: the bathroom is large but there isn't a lot of headroom in the center of the room. The strategically placed skylight insures that those who stand to go to the bathroom can do so without crouching but the headroom over the tiny sink is not great. Anyone over 6' will have to bend a bit in that one area. We lifted the roof for the oversize shower so that's not a problem.
transit: You can park in our driveway except in the winter but there's always plenty of free parking on our street: no need for a sticker or permit. We are a few blocks from the bus to the medical area and Back Bay Station. We're a 15 minute walk to the Orange Line T (Forest Hills or Green Street) which will connect you with all of Boston and/or Cambridge. It's also a very walkable part of town! We're close to the Longwood Medical area; some of our neighbors who work there walk or bike to work.
access: You have the entire 3rd floor to yourselves! We renovated the attic following all the City of Boston Building Codes. You have a separate entrance from the back porch and do not have to go through our living space to get to yours. You can park in our driveway in every season but winter when we use the parking space. There are always many parking spaces open on our street which is completely uncharacteristic for most of Jamaica Plain and Boston. No permit required.
interaction: We'll be around a lot of the time to help with recommendations or anything else you might need and I'm always reachable by phone. I'm friendly and helpful by nature but will respect your need for privacy and space if you so desire.
house_rules: - No shoes in the apartment. - No candles, smoking or open flames. - Eat only at the kitchen table. - No drugs or heavy drinking. - Please check with us if you plan on having guests. - Clean up after yourself: do your dishes and wipe the table and countertops after you cook or eat. Please be respectful of our things. We renovated this space especially for Airbnb guests but we love it up there. We put some of our nicest furniture and rugs in it. We live in the apartment on the 2nd floor and go to bed by 9:30. Please be mindful that this is a pretty quiet house and we'd like to keep it that way. We have a poodle who sometimes barks when people walk by.
host_about:
I'm a photographer specializing in portraits. I love meeting people from all walks of life and any and all countries. I'm interested in people and their stories. My 13 year old twins and I love our house and our town. We like meeting new people, trying new foods (well, I do) and hanging our with our dogs Lily and Stormy. We are friendly and outgoing and relatively quiet. We like to travel and have adventures but so far that's mostly done close to home. 

Now that I've been an Airbnb host for 2 years I can safely say I love it! I'm so proud of our beautiful space and I love it when others like it as much as we do. It's incredibly gratifying! It's nice to be able to provide a comfortable, clean and calm spot for travelers.

name: Beautiful Private Studio in Jamaica Plain near T
summary: Release your inner bohemian and stay in this beautiful, spacious garret. Bright and airy, this studio on the top floor affords you tranquility amongst the tree tops and has a private entrance. *Please note that it being on the top floor requires climbing four flights of stairs and that as an attic studio, the sloping ceilings could be challenging for very tall individuals. Check out the photos!
space: With rich wood beams and details everywhere, the spacious room (900 square feet!) features a king-sized bed, a cozy conversation area with a love seat and chair, and a private bathroom with a claw footed tub and Parisian-style hand shower. There's also a sunlit reading nook on the landing, perfect for your morning tea. A small fridge, coffee maker, and microwave are also included in the room as a part of the amenities. The house sits on a quiet street loaded with lush gardens and trees. It is conveniently located a few minutes walk away from Whole Foods, some of the best bars and restaurants in JP, as well as convenient to Jamaica Pond, and the Arnold Arboretum. A short walk gets you to the Stoneybrook stop on Orange Line and regularly scheduled buses which can whisk you into the Longwood Medical area or downtown Boston in the blink of an eye. This place makes for the perfect destination for your short stay or Boston vacation!

transit: The studio is super convenient to the MBTA orange line stop Stoneybrook and also to the #39 MBTA bus. The walk to the T stop is 5 minutes and 7 minutes to the bus stop.
access: You access the space by a private entrance. Once inside the room, it is like having your own studio apartment. The room has a sleeping area, sitting area, kitchenette area, clothing rack/mirror/ironing board area, and full bath.
interaction: This property is in a three family building (owned by me). There is a lovely woman who takes care of the property as well as a tenant on premises who can also help with any issues that arise.
house_rules: - Quiet Hours between 10 pm - 7 am
host_about: I have lived in the Boston neighborhood of Jamaica Plain for over 25 years with my husband and two (now grown) children. We have been hosting on Airbnb for almost a year now and really enjoy it! Our funky home is 120+ years old and has been slowly restored by my husband over time. I love to forage, cook, and share food with our friends and family. Travel, nature, books, music, being near the ocean, people, and happiness are my main interests in life (not necessarily in that order).

name: Sunny, convenient Boston condominium with parking
summary: Sunny 2 bedroom condo in Boston's charming Jamaica Plain! You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the light, minimalist feel, the art, the comfy beds, the kitchen and the modern bathroom. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers or a small group.
space: Modern, 2 bedroom, airy and well lit condominium on the top floor of a triple decker home.  A ~5 minute walk to Jamaica Plain's center, the Arnold Arboretum and the Jamaica Pond and the bus. The Green Street and Forest Hills subway (T) stops are a 12-14 minute walk.  You can park for free in the driveway.

name: Great location, comfortable, convenient, room tv
summary: Best Location *Spacious apartment three rooms, one bathroom with back porch. Located in the heart of JP next to numerous restaurants/cafes. I can be flexible about check in and check out hours.   5 minutes to Jackson Square Station..6 minutes’ walk to Samuel Adams brewery. 10 minutes in train to Downtown, 20 from the airport. Near Northeastern U, Harvard Med School, Boston Convention Center, Angel Animal Hospital, Brigham Hospital, Fenway Park. Lots of restaurants and interesting places around.
space: This is a great location, our apartment is close to two trains stations (stony Brook and Jackon Square) and buses. It’s really easy to get around, this area  of Jamaica Plain has some fun shops and restaurants as well, so there are things to do right around the corner, you will love it.

There is access to a full bathroom, clean towels, have acess to the kitchen and a wonderful back porch available for relaxing whe
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of the most authentic and unique parts of Boston. Home to the politically active, lots of young families, and a vibrant art community. It is very diverse here. Lots of great restaurants, and home of the largest outdoor spaces. The Arnold Arboretum, and the Jamaica Pond are both about a 20 minute walk from my house, they are the best places for walking or running. The Sam Adams Brewery is just a 7 minute walk from my place. People love the Brewery tour. Community activities often going on; depending on when you visit, you may cross paths with our May Day / Wake Up the Earth festival or maybe our annual Lantern Parade around Jamaica Pond, in mid/late October; fun events for all ages. Free street parking: please be aware about street cleaning days schedule (usually Tuesdays).
notes: Everything easily accessible, NO car needed. 3 blocks to Jackson Square subway & bus station (Orange Line)!  -$15 Uber / 7 miles from airport.  My place is just a 5 minute walk to the Stony Brook T station and Jackson square on the Orange line. From Stony brook to the city center is about a 20 minute ride. Copley Square is about 10-15 minutes away. For the Hospitals, you will need to go to Copley and switch to the Green line, or take a shuttle bus from Ruggles station. Or walk to Center Street, and take the #39 Bus straight to the Hospitals.  There is plenty of free, on-street parking in front of my house, or very close on the same block. - Stop & Shop Grocery Store located directly across the street. Dry cleaning, salon, clothing stores, Bank of America, Dunkin Donuts all located near apartment.  - Dominican, Cuban, Chinese, and American restaurants all located on our street.

access: This is a lovely, large room  plenty of light, a closet, dresser, table and chair. There is access to a full bathroom, clean towels, have acess to the kitchen and a wonderful back porch available for relaxing when weather permits. Basic amenities have been provided including Essentials, TV, Air Conditioning, Heatin, Wi-Fi. There is coffee and tea available at the kitchen.   I offer coffee and tea to all of my guest. Please clean after yourself in kitchen. Free street parking: please be aware about street cleaning days schedule (usually Tuesdays).   Our home is a non-smoking environment. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and dispose of your cigarettes afterward.
interaction: We are friendly but not intrusive, easy-going and welcoming. We do not interfere very much but I am available if you need information. Please let me know how I can help.  Boston traveling guides books are available for each guest! :)
house_rules: Generals •	Do not invite other people into home. No unregistered guest or visitors to appear at check-in or anytime during your stay. •	The maximum of guest per room is two. •	Be sure to lock the front door when entering or leaving the house •	Turn off AC and lights before leaving the house •	No candles, space heaters or open flames may be used in the house. •	No mail may be received by guests at my home •	To keep the house neat and free of clutter, please store your items only in your room or in the kitchen storage  *      My home is a non-smoking environment. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and dispose of your cigarettes afterward. Significant violation of house rules may result in immediate termination of the reservation
host_about: Hi I'm Emelyn, I do social work for a nonprofit organization and I speaks English and Spanish, leaving with my boyfriend Scott.  We are friendly but not intrusive, easy-going, do not interfere very much.  I am available if you need information.

name: Spacious, cozy apartment in Jamaica Plain
summary: Come stay in our spacious, conveniently located apartment! The apartment is across the road from Forest Hills station (a 15 min train ride to downtown Boston) and is a short walk (10 min) from vibrant Centre Street in downtown Jamaica Plain which is chock-full of dining and shopping options. Across the street is also the Arnold Arboretum, North America's oldest (and in our opinion the prettiest) collection of trees, a great spot for nature lovers and joggers alike.

name: Sunny, quiet & private suite in JP w/ parking
summary: Quiet, sunny and very private suite (bedroom and bathroom) available. Private garage/parking space available if needed. 15-min walk to T station, 20-minute bus to Back Bay. Close to both urban amenities (cafes & restaurants) and also the beautiful scenes of Jamaica Pond and the Arboretum. We are a married couple in our 30s and love meeting new people - but we will give you your privacy and space! Coffee (regular and espresso), tea and breakfast available. Full kitchen available for guest use.
space: This suite contains a closet and additional storage space. The bathroom is private and only accessible through the room. The room is on the south side of the building so receives a fair amount of sunlight during the day but is very quiet at night. The condo contains a shared full kitchen and shared living/dining room area with  TV. The building has a gym that is accessible by all guests. Dedicated parking spot available.

neighborhood_overview: Our unit is located near many restaurants, cafes and shops on Centre Street on Jamaica Plain. There are are also supermarkets, pharmacies, beauty salons and dry cleaners close by. Our neighborhood also offers easy access to downtown Boston and the Copley/Prudential centers of Back Bay. We are also next to the Jamaica Pond, whose Boat House offers sailing, kayaking and rowing lessons during the open season, and the Arnold Arboretum.
notes: No pets in the household.
transit: The 39 bus is a 5-minute walk away and will transport to the MFA and the Prudential/Copley/Newbury Street Back Bay areas in about 25 minutes. StoneyBrook T-stop (orange line) is a 15-minute walk and within 30 minutes will take you to downtown Boston.
access: Guests may access the kitchen, additional office, and living room for relaxation. In addition, they may use the building's gym. Laundry is available in the basement of the building. The building has 2 elevators and an accessible ramp.
interaction: My husband and I will be available as needed and are happy to help  offer suggestions for Boston trips. The condo is large enough that our master bedroom is on the opposite end, which should offer the guest enough privacy and space should they prefer it.
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 11 pm to 7 am.
host_about: We are a married couple in our 30s. We love traveling, music and sharing our Jamaica Plain home with new friends.

name: Private bed and bath in sunny, modern home
summary: (See below reviews from our other Airbnbs!) In our beautiful 3 story townhouse in Boston's charming Jamaica Plain neighborhood, you will have a large private bedroom and bathroom on the 2nd floor. The bedroom has a queen bed, the bathroom has a full tub and shower, and there is also an outdoor porch. Parking is free, Franklin Park is practically in our back yard, and the subway into the city center is just a quick walk away!
space: This is our third Airbnb. Our first two welcomed 28 visitors from 23 cities and achieved SUPERHOST status. We enjoy both hosting and traveling with Airbnb, and we look forward to having you as our guest! Here are some more details on the space: In addition to the bedroom and bathroom on the 2nd floor, you may use the kitchen on the 1st floor, which has modern appliances including a gas stove, microwave, and refrigerator. Our bedroom and bathroom are on the 3rd floor, so we will share the 2nd floor hallway to reach our rooms.

Our bedroom and bathroom are on the 3rd floor, so we will share the 2nd floor hallway to reach our rooms. You will have access to your own bedroom
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of Boston’s most diverse and happening neighborhoods. Locally called “JP,” the neighborhood is full of terrific restaurants, quirky shops, and beautiful green spaces. Surrounded by the Emerald Necklace, Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park and Jamaica Pond, it is a beautiful place to visit any time of year.
notes: Check in and check out times are flexible - just coordinate timing with us. Well behaved dogs are welcome for an additional $10. Dogs are not allowed on the furniture and may not be left alone in the home. We can offer a bed and bowls, and we have a small grassy side yard for short bathroom trips. Franklin Park, which is just across the street, is a great place to walk your dog. Our Carolina Dog gets along well with other dogs.
transit: There is plenty of free street parking in front of the house if you have a car.  Public transportation is just a 10 minute walk from the house - the Orange Line subway takes you straight into downtown Boston in about 30 minutes. If you enjoy biking, there is a public bike share station right by the same subway stop, and we have some free day passes to share with guests - just ask!
access: You will have access to your own bedroom and bathroom on the 2nd floor, as well as an outdoor porch. The 1st floor kitchen is shared space.
interaction: We both work typical office hours (9-6) but always enjoy meeting our guests when they arrive to orient them to the house and neighborhood. Brandon works from home most days so will likely be the person to greet you. Beyond that, we will interact with you only as much as you would like - some guests are more private while others like to socialize with hosts.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
We live in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston with our sweet Carolina dog, Addy. Jen is the director of research and opportunities at an industrial design firm, and she spends her spare time drawing cartoons and baking pastries. Brandon is the founder and principal consultant of Particle LLC - branding and digital strategy for mission-driven organizations. In his spare time he plays guitar in an indie pop/rock/Americana band and manages a local record label. Together, we love to travel, hike, bike, cook, stroll around Boston, and go out to eat in our awesome neighborhood.

We love using Airbnb to both find interesting and affordable accommodations when we travel, and share our home with guests from out of town.

name: Family Friendly Colorful Home - close to Subway!
summary: Very kid friendly home. Two blocks to the T (subway) and near Sam Adams brewery, cafes and playgrounds. Free on street parking! A sunny and cozy apartment, with a full kitchen, dining room, two bedrooms, 4 comfy beds, bins of toys, books, movies, and more. We want you to enjoy our home while we're traveling! Feel free to pick from the field of fresh mint in the garden! Friendly neighbors! Easy to get downtown. Kids love it here!
space: 3 couples can fit here easily, we have an air mattress if you want to squeeze in one more! if you're traveling with friends and want a home base while discovering Boston, this is a great home for that. This is a relaxed, spacious apartment, beds are comfy! There are books and toys, a piano you can use gently, a beautiful garden outside! We are walking distance to parks, cafes, sam adams brewery tour, the Franklin park zoo, a beautiful pond, Arnold arboretum, the subway and so much more!

Guests are welcome to do laundry, we have a front loader and dryer in the b
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant, green, artistic area, and the designated Latin Quarter of Boston. The neighborhood is culturally diverse and filled with all ages and types of people, Dominican, Puerto Rican, Caribbean, Irish, Black and White all fill up our neighborhood. We have wonderful playgrounds near by, a zoo in walking distance, a near by gym, coffee shops and the best taco place in Massachusetts around the corner. Harvards arboretum is just two stops away on the train. The Jamaica Pond is a great place for a run or a walk.  Lots of wonderful places to get great food (all kinds!)
notes: Bonnie and John are almost always around, if you have any problems please call and let them fix it right away!
transit: The subway is around the corner! If you're seeing games at fenway we recommend either the subway or using Uber or Lyft which both work very well here.
access: Guests are welcome to do laundry, we have a front loader and dryer in the basement. We do ask guests to let us know, so we can show you the laundry room and to try and limit to one load a day (unless otherwise requested in advance)
interaction: Our Co-host, Bonnie, lives right upstairs and is happy to come chat, give you directions, tell you about the neighborhood, or answer questions. She has been running her own AirBnB space for a few years and is a Superhost. She will tend to check in briefly and let guests have their space unless they want to meet up!
house_rules: - No candles or open flames in the house - Quiet hours from 10pm on unless otherwise requested and approved - -Please keep food mess put away. - -Please remove muddy, snowy or shoes with anything on them that could track a mess or damage floor and rugs.  - -All overnight guests must be booked through Airbnb. If you plan to have visitors during your stay, please check with us beforehand.  - -NOTHING but toilet paper and human waste in the toilet. - Guests are responsible to keep hot tub clean,  tie up long hair, rinse off soaps before going in the hot tub and be quiet and respectful of neighbors. No glass or food are allowed near the hot tub. max # of people 4 adults and 1 child.
host_about:
I am a photographer, artist, yoga teacher, my husband is a choral conductor, and our kids are (depending on the day) astronaut-farmers, doctors dressed like tigers, or flying unicorns "without wings" that like to practice jumping on the trampoline. 

We love creativity, and our home is a space that encourages it! We have both lived in Jamaica Plain/ Boston for 15-20 years and know the area well; as does our dear friend Bonnie who co-hosts, as well as hosts "the city cabin" and lives upstairs.

name: Comfortable, family-friendly spot near T and cafes
summary: Enjoy this inviting 3 bedroom 1st floor apartment with farmhouse features;  Beds for 8; eat-in kitchen; living room with wood burning stove; front and side porches; wi-fi, off-street parking; 5 minute walk to the train taking you downtown in 20 minutes.  10 minute walk to #39 bus taking you to Longwood medical area in 20 minutes.  Minutes to playground, green space and public tennis courts.  10 minute walk to Centre St. with cafes and restaurants.   Comfortable and convenient!
space: This private apartment includes three bedrooms: one has a queen and 2 twins; the second has a queen, and the third has a double bed, all with room-darkening shades.  Two of the bedrooms and the living room have air-conditioning; the third bedroom and all the other rooms have good fans. Living room has wood burning stove, cable TV and internet access; kitchen has a dining table that comfortably seats eight (8), microwave, dishwasher, oven, coffee maker and rice cooker. Wide pine and new wood floors throughout.  Washer/dryer access for stays longer than one week.  Side porch with outdoor furniture.  Apartment has a fenced in side yard and is quiet.

name: Bright & Breezy Room in Jamaica Plain
summary: This nice 2-bdrm apartment has a Boston charm with wood trim and a built in hutch. There is free laundry in basement, dishwasher, easy street parking, front and back porches, large backyard, and firepit. It's near Franklin Park, Arnold Arboretum and an 8-minute walk to the Orange line. You will be living with a sweet, respectable female in her 30's and two lovable, chill older cats.  My room is ideal, with 3 windows, two looking out to the yard, for nice light and breeze.

name: Cozy Relaxing 2 Bed 2.5 Bath Townhouse
summary: (See below reviews from our other Airbnbs!) Our beautiful 3 story townhouse is situated in Boston's charming Jamaica Plain neighborhood. The 1st floor is an open layout with a modern kitchen, spacious living room with a gas fireplace, and outdoor patio. The 2nd and 3rd floors have bedrooms (1 queen and 1 king), full bathrooms with rain shower heads, and outdoor porches. Parking is free, Franklin Park is practically in our backyard, and the subway into the city center is just a quick walk away!
space: This is our third Airbnb. Our first two welcomed 28 visitors from 23 cities and achieved SUPERHOST status. We enjoy both hosting and traveling with Airbnb, and we and we look forward to having you as our guest! Here are some more details on the space, floor by floor: 1st floor: The kitchen has modern appliances including a gas stove. The TV in the living room is set up with cable, an AppleTV and a Roku for network television, Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime content. There is also a half bath on the 1st floor.  2nd floor: In addition to the comfortable queen bedroom, bathroom with full shower, and outdoor porch, the 2nd floor also has an office with a desk, couch, and another monitor set up with Apple TV. 3rd floor: The master bedroom with a new king sized bed is on the 3rd floor, along with a full bathroom with a shower stall and dual sinks, an outdoor patio, and a small exercise room.

The 1st floor is an open layout with a modern kitchen, spacious living room with a gas fireplace, and outdoor patio. The 2nd and 3rd floors have bedrooms (1 queen and 1 king), full bathrooms with rain shower heads, and outdoor porches. Parking is free, Franklin Park is practically in our backyard, and the subway into the city center is just a quick walk away! This is our third Airbnb. The TV in the living room is set up with cable, an AppleTV and a Roku for network television, Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime content. There is also a half bath on t
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of Boston’s most diverse and happening neighborhoods. Locally called “JP,” the neighborhood is full of terrific restaurants, quirky shops, and beautiful green spaces. Surrounded by the Emerald Necklace, Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park and Jamaica Pond, it is a beautiful place to visit any time of year.
notes: Check in is flexible on weekends - just coordinate timing with us. On weekdays, check in is between 6-9pm as we are both at work during the day. Check out time is flexible.
transit: There is plenty of free street parking in front of the house if you have a car. Public transportation is just a 7 minute walk away - the Orange Line subway takes you straight into downtown Boston in about 30 minutes. If you enjoy biking, there is a public bike share station right by the same subway stop, and we have some free day passes to share with guests - just ask!
access: You have access to all 3 floors. Our walk-in closet on the 3rd floor is the only space we ask guests not to use.
interaction: We always enjoy meeting our guests when they arrive to orient them to the house and neighborhood. Beyond that, we will be happy to offer recommendations for places to eat in the neighborhood or answer any questions during your stay.
house_rules: We ask that guests do not use the outdoor grill for safety reasons. If you use the whirlpool tub on the 3rd floor, just note that it uses the entire water tank! Thank you.
host_about:
We live in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston with our sweet Carolina dog, Addy. Jen is the director of research and opportunities at an industrial design firm, and she spends her spare time drawing cartoons and baking pastries. Brandon is the founder and principal consultant of Particle LLC - branding and digital strategy for mission-driven organizations. In his spare time he plays guitar in an indie pop/rock/Americana band and manages a local record label. Together, we love to travel, hike, bike, cook, stroll around Boston, and go out to eat in our awesome neighborhood.

We love using Airbnb to both find interesting and affordable accommodations when we travel, and share our home with guests from out of town.

name: BnT- BnB
summary: Clean, new private space with private entrance and bathroom, set in a beautiful, quiet portion of Boston's Jamaica Plain neighborhood.  Easy access  to the center of JP, Jamaica Pond, the Arboretum and downtown.
space: Need an escape?  Need refreshment for your soul?  Touring Boston?  Settling a college student?  Visiting someone in the hospital?  Here for business?  This could be your peaceful base.  The area is beautiful and provides much to do with quick and easy access to both bus and MBTA services.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a wonderful green and diverse neighborhood in Boston.  There are restaurants, coffee shops, a Whole Foods Market and CVS within easy walking distance.  Jamaica Pond (1.5 mile walk around the pond) and the Emerald Necklace are one block away.
notes: We have a Labrador Retriever , a cat and a fish - none of which have access to the space. PLEASE- no unannounced overnight guests.  If you have special needs/requests, please speak with us before booking.  We may, or may not, be able to accommodate you.  Thanks!
transit: We are very near the 39 Bus line, and the Orange Line is 1/2 mile away.  Bike rentals are a few blocks away.
access: The unit offers a wetbar complete with mini fridge, microwave,  Keurig coffee maker, toaster and sink. There is a desk work space and internet, as well as a cable TV.
interaction: The hosts live on the premises.  They will generally be available for greeting, information and some conversation - if desired.
house_rules: - Quiet after Midnight -No more than 2 guests without prior conversation with us!
host_about: My husband an I have lived in our Jamaica Plain home since 1985., and have raised our four children here. We love Boston and are grateful to be located in such a beautiful portion of the city.  We enjoy meeting people and have often hosted students for varying lengths of time.  One of my greatest joys is creating pleasant peaceful space where people feel welcome and can relax.

name: Large, sunny hilltop home, nature lovers' paradise
summary: Spectacular, sunny, 2,300 square foot house situated on half an acre of wooded land. Located in Boston's prized town of Jamaica Plain on a quiet street. Expansive lawn, fire pit and large outdoor deck with grill, make this a nature lovers' paradise.   Modern three story addition with 12 feet of windows across back of house allowing for incredible views of sky and tree tops. This property is like no other!
space: Beautiful, large, modern kitchen with Thermador stove and wok burner, stone countertops, 2 large sinks and a built-in butcher block cutting board. Cozy office with desk and couch. Large, comfortable living room with fireplace. Master bedroom has king size bed with spacious 2 sink bathroom and modern Italian tiling. Guest room suite has a queen size bed, its own charming bathroom and gorgeous views of the woods and lawn. Carpeted kids playroom on lower floor. Located just 10-15 minutes from downtown Boston, Newbury Street, the Chestnut Hill shopping area, Symphony Hall, Museum of Fine Arts and Longwood Medical Center. The 260 acre Arnold Arboreteum is located at the bottom of the hill. Allandale Farm, Jamaica Pond, Franklin Park Zoo and Larz Anderson Park are all just minutes from our house.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of Boston's greatest neighborhoods with excellent restaurants, including Japanese, Italian, Mexican and Indian, among others.  Wonderful Yoga and Taekwondo studios in the center of JP and two great community coffee shops.
notes: The TV is in the basement in the guest bedroom. It is not centrally located.
transit: Our house is not easily accessible by public transportation. It is possible, but difficult and inconvenient. It is best to have a car (we have plenty of free street parking) or use taxis or Uber.
access: Guests have access to our entire house and land (1/2 acre).
interaction: NA
house_rules: - No cats, please.  Dogs OK.
host_about:
My husband and I are both violinists and have three beautiful, young children.  We love music, art, food and nature and feel so grateful to live in such a special house, on such a large, beautiful piece of land right in the middle of Boston. 

We are happy to now share our home with others when we are gone for the summers. We have worked hard to make our home comfortable and provide you with everything you might need during your stay. We hope you enjoy our home!

summary: ☀︎Your lovely home away from home!  ☀︎Sunny, airy living room, two bedrooms each with a queen size bed. ☀︎Bright sunroom can accommodate a twin size fold out bed with memory foam mattress.  ☀︎Fully applianced kitchen and full bathroom with tub/shower.  ☀︎Outstanding central location close to subway, restaurants, cafes, shops, and Whole Foods. ☀︎Cable TV, high speed WiFi.  Before you request to book, please make sure your profile is complete with a photo and your ID.
space: Stylish, hip, newly renovated apartment centrally located in cool Jamaica Plain, minutes from Downtown Boston. Escape the bustle of the busy downtown in this lovely apartment on a quiet, tree lined street. There is ample free street parking on our street and the subway is an 8 minute walk away. There are 4 window A/C units to keep you cool during the warmer months, and you're minutes away from a Whole Foods.   "Loved the artist's stylish decor with a mix of original artworks & unexpected visually interesting touches!"  - is a quote that we hear so often! WASHER/DRYER:   Please note that while there is a coin operated washer / dryer on site for your shared  use with other guests in other apartments in this large house as well as the owner, it is in the unfinished basement.  Please note that the unfinished basement is a true basement, not nearly as pretty as the decorator lovely apartments.  There is also a laundromat 1 block away if spiffier, finished space is more preferred. Please als
