"Loved the artist's stylish decor with a mix of original artworks & unexpected visually interesting touches!"  - is
neighborhood_overview: Oodles of charm and an approachable, cheerful neighborhood vibe. JP is a medley of many inspiring cultures and gorgeous natural amenities.  From Olmsted's enchanted Emerald Necklace with its 19th century walking & biking paths to Harvard's 265 Acre arboretum and the enormous Franklin Park and its restored zoo, you can spend days immersed in forests, gardens, intimate meandering paths and wide open vast green spaces as if you have stepped back in time to a slower quieter agrarian time. Stroll back into urbane vibe influenced by the pondside mansions built in the Victorian era to the Edwardian period by Boston's early wealthy merchants and  explore the adjacent multi-family homes built for later musicians, artists and brewery workers that are now becoming homes to young families, biotech entrepreneurs and a variety of caring professionals who work in the medical support home care, non-profit and social justice communities.  The rich mosaic of antique architecture and conserved green spac
notes: When booking please tell us about yourselves and what brings you to the area. Please finish your profile by visiting www.airbnb.com/verify and follow the steps until you get the "verified" icon. Be sure to add a profile photo! This is a charming  apartment house in a quiet family neighborhood.  Quiet hours begin at 10:00pm. When entering/exiting the house, please hold the main entry door so that is closes quietly, otherwise it slams and rattles 3 bedrooms.  House rules listed below.  Slippers provided for guests in the hall closet; we ask you to remove shoes when in the apartment but not store them in the common hall. On occasion, an antique house needs routine maintenance, landscaping equipment or a repair, so there could be noise from a service professional. KEYS ! Lost keys ! The house has a sophisticated ‘total security’ lock & key system that requires a custom cut key by our professional locksmith. If a key is not returned to the lockbox, cutting a new replacement key requires a s
transit: Although the area can easily be seen by foot or by bike, we are also a quick 8 minute walk to the Stony Brook T stop off the orange line subway and also walkable to many bus lines. Free street parking makes traveling by car easy.  Taxi/Uber/Lyft widely available and picks up quickly.
access: Guests will have full access to the 2+ bedroom apartment including an eat in kitchen, living room and bathroom. The apartment is stocked with many chef's cooking supplies, coffee maker, coffee bean grinder, French press, European 'instant boil' tea kettle, essential toiletries and towels and linens.  An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for your use.
interaction: I live in the building so may say hello if I see you. My co-hosts Drew and Liesl will be your main contacts. They are always available through the Airbnb app and by cell phone for emergencies. They are great at giving local directions and suggestions on things to do in the area.
house_rules: Babies / Children: well behaved, very quiet children are welcome since there are several doctors and nurses in the building who sleep during the day for night shifts.  This is a quiet, small apartment house of working professionals.  Quiet hours are 9pm - 8am. Owner lives upstairs, ensuring your quiet, peaceful enjoyment of this architectural gem.  Since we have long term residents in this home that are doctors or nurses in the Harvard Medical Longwood complex, they often work any of the three 24 hour shifts and thus need quiet for their sleep during the day. Please respect their needs for quiet. Please carry your luggage up the stairs as there is a bedroom right below the staircase !  -Leave the apartment as you found it.  -Please respect us and our neighbors by not having any additional guests without host approval.  -No parties. -Smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside, including the front and back gardens.  -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the
host_about: I'm a pragmatic creative I'd say.  I am both a recognized artist as well as an entrepreneur with an MBA from Duke.  In addition to managing a beautifully restored victorian apartment house , I have a promotional products business.  I love to travel to interesting places that are either beautiful and relaxing and / or steeped in  a rich mosaic of history.

name: Clean spacious modern 2BR JP condo
summary: Hello and welcome to our clean, well-cared for and spacious 1,100 square feet condo. We're looking forward to hosting you in our recently updated 1st floor unit of our two-family house in eclectic and fun Jamaica Plain. We're long time JP residents, recent Airbnb hosts with over 47 five star reviews.  We love JP, hosting friends & family, and welcoming guests to JP. Great space if you're exploring Boston, catching a Sox game or visiting friends and family in town
space: Prepare breakfast or your best dinner dish in our updated kitchen with granite countertops and stainless appliances. Relax afterwards in the tv room with the 4K 50" TV. There's hardwood floors throughout.
description: Hello and welcome to our clean, well-cared for and spacious 1,100 square feet condo. We're looking forward to hosting you in our recently updated 1st floor unit of our two-family house in eclectic and fun Jamaica Plain. We're long time JP residents, recent Airbnb hosts with over 47 five star reviews.  We love JP, hosting friends & family, and welcoming guests to JP. Great space if you're exploring Boston, catching a Sox game or visiting friends and family in town Prepare breakfast or your best dinner dish in our updated kitchen with granite countertops and stainless appliances. Relax afterwards in the tv room with the 4K 50" TV. There's hardwood floors throughout. Feel free to enjoy your coffee and meals on the back porch and drinks in comfy adironack chairs in the back yard, soaking up the sun. The hammock is fun too We live on the 2nd floor and enjoy greeting our guests in person if we're not working or traveling. Also like chatting over a drink the backyard JP is a cool, hip and div
neighborhood_overview: JP is a cool, hip and diverse neighborhood in Boston. It boasts the most green space in Boston with great spots like the Harvard Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park, Jamaica Plain Pond and the Emerald Necklace.  It's only a 10 minute T (subway) ride to Back Bay Boston or 15 mins to downtown Boston. Closeby to Longwood Medical hospitals, Sam Adams Brewery and colleges:  Northeastern University, Fenway Colleges and BC, BU and across the river from Harvard. There's great local shops, and eats from fine dining to solid bar food on Centre Street.
notes: NA
transit: Easy to drive and park free on McBride or nearby Hall, Boynton, Child or Lee streets. Quick walk to Forest Hills and Green T stops half mile away or easy to jump on the 39 bus that takes you by Fenway, colleges / medical centers and to Boston and Back Bay station
access: Feel free to enjoy your coffee and meals on the back porch and drinks in comfy adironack chairs in the back yard, soaking up the sun. The hammock is fun too
interaction: We live on the 2nd floor and enjoy greeting our guests in person if we're not working or traveling. Also like chatting over a drink the backyard

2 Running enthusiasts from Boston with our little bundle of joy, Sophia, looking to be safely ensconced in a cozy, quiet rental, suitable for experiencing all the finer things the world has to offer. 

From morning runs to 7pm dinners, we keep a respectable schedule, void of late night noise and messy bathrooms. 

We love 
The beach

You won't be disappointed. We are amazing guests and renters. 

Cheers
Chris, Jin and Sophia

Our guest manager is happy to answer any questions you might have and provide recommendations for you. Jamaica Plain combines green spaces and with super easy access to downtown Boston by public transit. There is the 365 acre Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park (Golf Course & Franklin Park Zoo!), and the Jamaica Pond (they offer boat rentals!). Great for runners, gofers, pet owners, bird watchers, and anyone who love the outdoors. JP is one of Boston's most vibrant neighborhoods and has fabulous restaurant
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain combines green spaces and with super easy access to downtown Boston by public transit. There is the 365 acre Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park (Golf Course & Franklin Park Zoo!), and the Jamaica Pond (they offer boat rentals!). Great for runners, gofers, pet owners, bird watchers, and anyone who love the outdoors. JP is one of Boston's most vibrant neighborhoods and has fabulous restaurants, bars, shops, festivals, and more.
notes: We ask for a small supplemental pet cleaning fee ($25).
transit: The home is a short walk (about 7 minutes) to the Green Street Orange Line subway, Chilacates Mexican Street Food, The Gate Restaurant and Bar, Doyles (classic) bar, Ula Cafe, and Sam Adams brewery, plus many more restaurants and shops. Another Orange Line stop (Stony Brook) is also under a ten minute walk. There is also the bus, Zipcar and Hubway rental bikes. Lots of non-resident street parking as well. Not terribly far away (about a 12 minute walk) is the Forest Hills Station station is the end of the Orange subway line, but also meets the commuter rail train and numerous bus lines. Also near the Forrest Hills Station you'll find a diner and several other bars and restaurants.  Only two blocks to the new Turtle Swamp Brewery!

house_rules: - No shoes in house! - Smoking (including e-cigs) is not allowed on the patio, in the unit, or in front of the building. There is a park across the street if you must smoke. No feminine products, paper towels, tissues, or anything else please. Clogs that require a plumber are at the cost of the guest. - Quiet hours outside (patio and in front of building) after 9pm. Please respect the  neighbors and do not go outside with music or loud voices after 9pm any day of the week. - Parties (any number of unannounced guests causing noise disturbances and ruining the apartment) - will be immediately shut down and your security deposit will be fully forfeited at minimum plus damages. neighborhood_overview: Apartment is located in Jamaica Plain (JP). Jamaica Plain is an open, artsy, hip neighborhood with lots of green space, old homes, creative types, different cultures and small shops. It's about 15mins from the center of Boston. It has a great, laid-back vibe. We recommend walking through the neighborhood and up to Centre Street for pastries, lunch, dinner, a drink and more. You can continue on to Jamaica Pond from there, or the Arnold Arboretum where you can get a 360 degree view of the Boston.
notes: My goal is to assure that you feel at home and if there is anything that you need I am more than willing to assist. I also open to suggestions on how I can improve. There is always room for improvement!
transit: Walking distance to major grocery store (whole foods & stop & shop). Corner mini market, mins away from top restaurants, bars, Jamaica Pond and the Arnold Arboretum.  Easily accessible by MBTA (train, trolley & bus).Bus-39 & 41 (many more bus connection at Jackson station),  Trolley- Heath Street (green line)  Train- Jackson Station and Stony Brook Station (orange line).  Bike Rental- Hubway is available (6min walk) in front of Whole Foods. Frequently Asked Questions: * Fenway Park- 2.5 miles away  * Logan Airport- 6.5 miles away *Brighams and Women's Hospital- 1.2 miles away * Closest Mall (Copley Square)- 2.5 miles away * Downtown Boston is 4.0 miles away
access: The entire apartment!
interaction: If you prefer to meet me at check in, please give me a 24hr notice and I can make the proper arrangements to meet you.
house_rules: -NO smoking inside. You are welcome to smoke outside. -We ask guests to maintain a low noise level after 10pm and be respectful of noise levels during the day. You are welcome to have a few friends over for dinner but no loud music. -NOTHING but toilet paper and human waste in the toilet.  -Hair dyeing are not allowed in the apartment as the wood, furniture and bathroom sink can stain very easily. -Please treat our listing like it was your own. -All overnight guests must be booked through Airbnb.
host_about: I am committed to providing you exceptional services. My goal is to offer a place you can truly feel comfortable, secure to call home.

name: Chic and bright 1 bedroom near Harvard University
summary: At the intersection of the charming Leather District, bustling Chinatown, and the Theater District’s entertainment hub, this apartment offers countless opportunities to fully immerse yourself in Boston city life. Upscale amenities throughout include, fully equipped kitchens, open floor plans, oversized windows, spacious walk-in closets, as well as a  pool, fitness center, & clubhouse for your entertainment.
space: Experience Luxury living in the heart of Boston in these premium residences that will provide you with an uplifting lifestyle and comfortable stay. With a contemporary design throughout this high-rise has cutting-edge finishes and amenities including: fully a private courtyard with stunning landscaping, and an elevated amenity deck with swimming pool, fireplace & BBQ grills. The building’s heir of sophistication is substantiated in everything from the original works of art throughout the amenity spaces to the beautifully designed Resident’s Lounge.  And the units themselves are beyond compare. Light-filled, airy, and modern, each comes fully equipped with professional grade kitchens, spacious bathrooms, oversized windows, sleek finishes, and wood flooring. The unmatched Concierge program, our 24 hour customer service guarantee, the unparalleled amenities, and prime location makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

And the units themselves are beyo
neighborhood_overview: This spectacular location is home to many major attractions. From Fenway Park, to the Institute of Contemporary Arts, The Faneuil Hall Marketplace, and the magnificent Trinity church. Also, do not miss a wonderful shopping experience on Boston’s famous Newbury Street. This is the central location for all major shopping stores, boutiques and art galleries. Major Attractions: •	Fenway Park- 1.7mi  •	Faneuil Hall Marketplace (a.k.a Quincy Market)- 5.6 mi •	New England Aquarium- 5.5 mi •	Boston Opera House- 3.7 mi •	Trinity Church- 3.1 mi •	Museum of Science- 4.5 mi •	ICA Museum- 4.7 mi •	Bunker Hill Monument- 5.2 mi Restaurants: •	Brookline Family Restaurant- 0.6 mi o	Unpretentious storefront dishes out hearty portions of Turkish & Mediterranean eats •	La Morra- 0.5 mi o	Busy, cozy restaurant serving homemade pasta & Tuscan-style wood-grilled entrees in a compact space •	Brigham Circle- 0.6 mi o	A mix of standard Chinese dishes, from chop suey to kung pao chicken, with weekday lunch deals
notes: Unit Amenities •	Fully furnished – bedding, table linens, dinnerware, flatware, glassware, bathroom accessories and towels, basic kitchen electronics, and basic cleaning supplies •	Oversized windows  •	Dishwasher •	Fully equipped, chef-style kitchen with modern cabinetry, Silestone quartz countertops, and top-of-the-line appliances •	Wood flooring  •	Spacious bathrooms with spacious vanities, chrome fixtures, tile flooring •	Front loading washer/dryer •	Digital cable TV, local phone service, and wireless internet included •	Complimentary Welcome Package featuring local area information, toiletries, and everyday home necessities
transit: The property is conveniently located about 10 minutes from General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport. Boston is America’s Walking City so public transportation is also easily accessible – just a short walk to Chinatown, Boylston, and Downtown Crossing T-stops, as well as South Station. Transportation/Taxi: •	The T Light Rail and Buses- Metro- Riverway- 0.2 mi •	Enterprise Rent-A-Car- 2.1 mi Airports: •	Boston International Airport-6.6 mi

space: Experience Luxury living in the heart of Boston in these premium residences that will provide you with an uplifting lifestyle and comfortable stay. With a contemporary design throughout this high-rise has cutting-edge finishes and amenities including: fully a private courtyard with stunning landscaping, and an elevated amenity deck with swimming pool, fireplace & BBQ grills. The building’s heir of sophistication is substantiated in everything from the original works of art throughout the amenity spaces to the beautifully designed Resident’s Lounge.  And the units themselves are beyond compare. Light-filled, airy, and modern, each comes fully equipped with professional grade kitchens, spacious bathrooms, oversized windows, sleek finishes, and wood flooring. The unmatched Concierge program, our 24 hour customer service guarantee, the unparalleled amenities, and prime location makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

And the units themselves are beyo
neighborhood_overview: This spectacular location is home to many major attractions. From Fenway Park, to the Institute of Contemporary Arts, The Faneuil Hall Marketplace, and the magnificent Trinity church. Also, do not miss a wonderful shopping experience on Boston’s famous Newbury Street. This is the central location for all major shopping stores, boutiques and art galleries. Major Attractions: •	Fenway Park- 1.7mi  •	Faneuil Hall Marketplace (a.k.a Quincy Market)- 5.6 mi •	New England Aquarium- 5.5 mi •	Boston Opera House- 3.7 mi •	Trinity Church- 3.1 mi •	Museum of Science- 4.5 mi •	ICA Museum- 4.7 mi •	Bunker Hill Monument- 5.2 mi Restaurants: •	Brookline Family Restaurant- 0.6 mi o	Unpretentious storefront dishes out hearty portions of Turkish & Mediterranean eats •	La Morra- 0.5 mi o	Busy, cozy restaurant serving homemade pasta & Tuscan-style wood-grilled entrees in a compact space •	Brigham Circle- 0.6 mi o	A mix of standard Chinese dishes, from chop suey to kung pao chicken, with weekday lunch deals
notes: Unit Amenities •	Fully furnished – bedding, table linens, dinnerware, flatware, glassware, bathroom accessories and towels, basic kitchen electronics, and basic cleaning supplies •	Oversized windows  •	Dishwasher •	Fully equipped, chef-style kitchen with modern cabinetry, Silestone quartz countertops, and top-of-the-line appliances •	Wood flooring  •	Spacious bathrooms with spacious vanities, chrome fixtures, tile flooring •	Front loading washer/dryer •	Digital cable TV, local phone service, and wireless internet included •	Complimentary Welcome Package featuring local area information, toiletries, and everyday home necessities
transit: The property is conveniently located about 10 minutes from General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport. Boston is America’s Walking City so public transportation is also easily accessible – just a short walk to Chinatown, Boylston, and Downtown Crossing T-stops, as well as South Station. Transportation/Taxi: •	The T Light Rail and Buses- Metro- Riverway- 0.2 mi •	Enterprise Rent-A-Car- 2.1 mi Airports: •	Boston International Airport-6.6 mi

name: Spacious Private Oasis on Quiet Street in JP
summary: Private 2 Bedroom Apartment with a full kitchen (dishwasher & disposal) and in-unit laundry. A unique property on a quiet street in a hip neighborhood. While you feel like living in the country on the enclosed back porch, you will experience the conveniences of a vibrant city. Walk to restaurants, shops, or hike on Olmstead's Emerald Necklace. Get to Faneuil Hall (Downtown Boston) in under 30 minutes by subway, or take a bus from our corner to Museums, Fenway Park, Hospital area or the Back Bay.
space: The spacious private apartment is on the first floor of our Multi-Family home. We live on the second and third floors.  There is on street parking but we can provide off street parking for one car for an additional $25/night.
description: Private 2 Bedroom Apartment with a full kitchen (dishwasher & disposal) and in-unit laundry. A unique property on a quiet street in a hip neighborhood. While you feel like living in the country on the enclosed back porch, you will experience the conveniences of a vibrant city. Walk to restaurants, shops, or hike on Olmstead's Emerald Necklace. The spacious private apartment is on the first floor of our Multi-Family home. We live on the second and third floors.  There is on street parking but we can provide off street parking for one car for an additional $25/night. Feel free to relax on our front porch. We respect your privacy but if you would like recommendations on places to visit, eat out etc we are more than happy to do so and help acquaint you with the Boston area. We are always available via text. Jamaica Plain is a diverse, ec
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a diverse, eclectic and green neighborhood of Boston. The Olmstead-designed Emerald Necklace traverses Jamaica Pond, Arnold Arboretum  and Franklin Park providing plenty of opportunities to run, bike, walk and explore. There are many highly rated restaurants (Tres Gatos, Ten Tables, Canary Square) and popular pubs (The Haven, Brendan Behan) right around the corner. Take a free tour at the Samuel Adams Brewery, a block from the Stony Brook T station. There are many local independent shops on Centre Street to explore. Whole Foods and CVS are within 2 blocks of the apartment.
notes: NA
transit: The Orange Line Stony Brook T stop is an 8 minute walk, and will take you to Downtown Crossing in 15 minutes. The 39 Bus is a 2 minute walk, goes to Back Bay, with stops along the way to Museum of Fine Arts, Fenway Colleges (Northeastern, Simmons, Wentworth, Emmanuel, MassArt etc) and Longwood Medical Area. Fenway Park is about a 40 minute walk from here (or about 20-25 minutes if you take the bus part way) The Hubway (Boston's Bike Share program) is a quick walk down the street with a station across from Whole Foods.
access: Feel free to relax on our front porch.
interaction: We respect your privacy but if you would like recommendations on places to visit, eat out etc we are more than happy to do so and help acquaint you with the Boston area. We are always available via text.

host_about: I've lived in the Boston area for most of my adult life, after growing up in Philadelphia and spending my childhood in Cape Town.  I enjoy a wide variety of outdoor activitiies.  Generally, I'm a quiet, professional person, but I thoroughly enjoy socialization through beer and board games.

house_rules: NA
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

summary: *WINTER SPECIAL  Spacious apartment three rooms, one bathroom with back porch. Located in the heart of JP next to numerous restaurants/cafes. space: This is a great location, our apartment is close to two trains stations (stony Brook and Jackon Square) and buses. It’s really easy to get around, this area  of Jamaica Plain has some fun shops and restaurants as well, so there are things to do right around the corner, you will love it.

This is a lovely room  plenty of light, a closet, dresser, table and chair. There is access to a full bathroom, clean towels, have acess to the kitchen and a wonderful back porch available for relaxing when weat
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of the most authentic and unique parts of Boston. Home to the politically active, lots of young families, and a vibrant art community. It is very diverse here. Lots of great restaurants, and home of the largest outdoor spaces. The Arnold Arboretum, and the Jamaica Pond are both about a 20 minute walk from my house, they are the best places for walking or running. The Sam Adams Brewery is just a 7 minute walk from my place. People love the Brewery tour. Community activities often going on; depending on when you visit, you may cross paths with our May Day / Wake Up the Earth festival or maybe our annual Lantern Parade around Jamaica Pond, in mid/late October; fun events for all ages.
notes: Everything easily accessible, NO car needed. 3 blocks to Jackson Square subway & bus station (Orange Line)!  -$15 Uber / 7 miles from airport.  My place is just a 5 minute walk to the Stony Brook T station and Jackson square on the Orange line. From Stony brook to the city center is about a 20 minute ride. Copley Square is about 10-15 minutes away. For the Hospitals, you will need to go to Copley and switch to the Green line, or take a shuttle bus from Ruggles station. Or walk to Center Street, and take the #39 Bus straight to the Hospitals.  There is plenty of free, on-street parking in front of my house, or very close on the same block. - Stop & Shop Grocery Store located directly across the street. Dry cleaning, salon, clothing stores, Bank of America, Dunkin Donuts all located near apartment.  - Dominican, Cuban, Chinese, and American restaurants all located on our street.
transit: Everything easily accessible, NO car needed. 3 blocks to Jackson Square subway & bus station (Orange Line)!  -$15 Uber / 7 miles from airport.  My place is just a 5 minute walk to the Stony Brook T station and Jackson square on the Orange line. From Stony brook to the city center is about a 20 minute ride. Copley Square is about 10-15 minutes away. For the Hospitals, you will need to go to Copley and switch to the Green line, or take a shuttle bus from Ruggles station. Or walk to Center Street, and take the #39 Bus straight to the Hospitals.  There is plenty of free, on-street parking in front of my house, or very close on the same block. - Stop & Shop Grocery Store located directly across the street. Dry cleaning, salon, clothing stores, Bank of America, Dunkin Donuts all located near apartment.  - Dominican, Cuban, Chinese, and American restaurants all located on our street.
access: This is a lovely room  plenty of light, a closet, dresser, table and chair. There is access to a full bathroom, clean towels, have acess to the kitchen and a wonderful back porch available for relaxing when weather permits. Basic amenities have been provided including Essentials, TV, Air Conditioning, Heatin, Wi-Fi. There is coffee and tea available at the kitchen.   I offer coffee and tea to all of my guest. Please clean after yourself in kitchen. Free street parking: please be aware about street cleaning days schedule (usually Tuesdays).   Our home is a non-smoking environment. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and dispose of your cigarettes afterward.
interaction: We are friendly but not intrusive, easy-going and welcoming. We do not interfere very much but I am available if you need information. Please let me know how I can help.  Boston traveling guides books are available for each guest! :)
house_rules: Generals •	Do not invite other people into the home. No unregistered guest or visitors to appear at check-in or anytime during your stay. •	Be sure to lock the front door when entering or leaving the house •	Turn off AC and lights before leaving the house •	No candles, space heaters or open flames may be used in the house. •	No mail may be received by guests at my home •	To keep the house neat and free of clutter, please store your items only in your room or in the kitchen storage for groceries. •	My home is a non-smoking environment. If you need to smoke, please do so outside and dispose of your cigarettes afterward. Significant violation of house rules may result in immediate termination of the reservation

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a family friendly, safe location in one of the most desirable neighborhoods within the city of Boston. Residents and visitors can enjoy a jog around Jamaica Pond, a visit to the Arnold Arboretum or stroll through Franklin Park.  Favorite restaurants include Tres Gatos, Ten Tables, Canary Square; popular pubs are The Haven and Brendan Behan. Guests may also enjoy a tour at the Sam Adams Brewery, one block from the Stony Brook T Station. Shopping along “Centre” street. Whole Foods market and CVS store are 2 short blocks from the apartment. I hope you enjoy your stay in beautiful Boston & New England.
notes: Bike rentals are available at the Jamaica Plain Library. Only a 15mns walk from the apartment.
transit: By train, the “Stony Brook” T Station (Orange Line) is just 2 blocks from the apartment(5mns walk) and it will take you to the center of Boston in 15 minutes(back bay T station). If you are driving, there is a parking spot available for you next to the building.
access: Guests may enjoy a balcony at their leisure at the back of the apartment.
interaction: Hosts may be contacted via text message to answer questions or make recommendations to ensure you have the most comfortable stay while in Boston. We are at your entire disposal for any support or assistance you may require during your stay.  Your satisfaction is our success!  We warmly welcome you to Boston!
house_rules: The apartment is cleaned professionally. Be safe and protect yourself by not leaning or seating over windows, balconies or handrails. All windows and doors must be closed when you are not in the apartment or when raining occurs. No smoking allowed inside the property. Keep building door and apartment door closed and locked when away from the apartment. The property owners cannot be held accountable for the consequences of misuse of electrical equipment, cooking, balconies, windows, handrail, stairs and any other hazardous areas.
host_about:
I am a real estate professional with an extensive background in interior design.
Boston has been home for the past 5 years, but I am originally from France and have also lived in NYC, LA, DC and Philadelphia. Along the way I have enjoyed meeting people from all parts of the US and abroad and sharing life stories and cultural experiences. Food, wine, time with friends are among my passion points. I have been told that I have a keen eye for detail and a perfectionist at heart. As a host of Airbnb, I will make sure your stay meets your every expectation.

name: Garden Oasis #2
summary: Comfortable, cozy bedroom in 2-bedroom condo near JP Pond. Short walk to market,  pharmacy and several good restaurants. Easy transit to the hospitals and downtown. This second room (of Garden Oasis #1) is flooded with light. I open this room when I travel, so you either share this room with a family member (if the other room is not taken) or a fellow air bnber. This household enthusiastically welcomes international guests and critical thinkers.
space: Relaxing decor. Chill Vibe. This is the bedroom I make available to guests periodically when I travel. You will share with the other guest in Garden Oasis #1. The backyard urban oasis includes deck, patio, garden (which is great in the summer, and some warm fall nights). Front porch is also a nice hang out as the season gets colder). Kitchen with room to cook, sitting/screening room where book lovers can read, and movie lovers are welcome to borrow or bring their own DVDS or log into Netflix.

neighborhood_overview: Short walk to market, cafes, restaurants, bars, and JP Pond.  Easy transport to Longwood Medical Center, Brigham Woman, Museum of Fine Arts, Mass College of Art, Northeastern University, Newberry Street and Copley Plaza.) Street parking is fairly easy.
notes: NA
transit: Stonybrook Subway/"T" stop/Orange Line is ten minute walk. Transport from Logan Airport (1hr), South End (25 min), New England Medical Center, Theatre District, Downtown Crossing (30min). 39 Bus Stop is around the corner, with buses every 10-15 mins going to Medical Center and final stop at Copley Plaza
access: House is kind of old fashioned, but we like it that way :) You are invited to share my home. Mi casa es su casa - everything from kitchen to sitting room to garden to washer and dryer in basement, to, of course, wifi. All I ask is that you are considerate, conscientious, and clean up after yourself.
interaction: This is my room and I only rent it periodically when I travel. So when this is room is available, you share the space with the other air bnb guest. I still coordinate and work things out with you, and I will do my best to host you from afar. It's a great room with a fantastic bed! I love this room. I empty the closet but keep some things in the bottom drawers...You'll have a lot of room to unpack clothes.
house_rules: Not many rules except for be conscientious and courteous. Cleanliness is golden; so I ask you to clean up after yourself in all shared spaces Leave shoes at the door :)
host_about: Culture and somewhat civil discourse are welcome. Foodie without the snob. Love meeting new people and playing host. Like to laugh, and tell a few jokes.  A few personal passions: ocean, travel, yoga, books, films and chocolate. Loyal friend, sister, daughter and proud auntie. I am a documentary filmmaker and I work from home - so I'll often be around to help out.

name: Huge Bedroom & Private Bath in House of Porches
summary: Your home away from home in a huge 160 square foot corner bedroom with its own bathroom in a charming 90 year old house in Jamaica Plain.  The bedroom is a mix of original hardwood floors, persian-style rug, an antique loveseat and desk and a brand new bed and bedside table.  The house is located near several restaurants and convenient to the orange line T and the 39 bus to NEU/Longwood/downtown.  Walk to the Pond, lounge on the decks, and enjoy the shared living and dining room and kitchen.
space: We operate under Boston Short Term Rental Registration No. STR383391.
description: Your home away from home in a huge 160 square foot corner bedroom with its own bathroom in a charming 90 year old house in Jamaica Plain.  The bedroom is a mix of original hardwood floors, persian-style rug, an antique loveseat and desk and a brand new bed and bedside table.  The house is located near several restaurants and convenient to the orange line T and the 39 bus to NEU/Longwood/downtown.  Walk to the Pond, lounge on the decks, and enjoy the shared living and dining room and kitchen. We operate under Boston Short Term Rental Registration No. STR383391. Guests may use the kitchen, living room, and dining room and two porches off the 2nd story. We give guests their space, but we're happy to help with anything throughout your stay--you can text/call us, message us with the app, or just ask if we're around. JP is known as the greenest part of Boston and a neighborhood of no chains (except the Dunkin Donuts of course).  We're just a hop, skip and jump away from Jamaica Pond, a great
neighborhood_overview: JP is known as the greenest part of Boston and a neighborhood of no chains (except the Dunkin Donuts of course).  We're just a hop, skip and jump away from Jamaica Pond, a great place to walk or run, as well as a variety of local restaurants.
notes: We have two friendly cats.
transit: We're 0.6 miles from the Orange Line T which will take you downtown and 1-2 blocks from the 39 bus to Copley Square via Longwood Medical area and past Northeastern University.  Parking is free on the opposite side of the street.
access: Guests may use the kitchen, living room, and dining room and two porches off the 2nd story.
interaction: We give guests their space, but we're happy to help with anything throughout your stay--you can text/call us, message us with the app, or just ask if we're around.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
Justin and I met in DC and just got married and bought our house in JP.  We love the neighborhood--it's quiet and green but a short bus or t-ride downtown.  We have a huge guest room that we like to fill with friends when we can, but we thought it would be fun to host others when it's free.  

Lawyers by day, in our free time, we like to spend a lot of time outside--hiking, rock climbing, backpacking, and learning to garden.  And we're planning some crafty indoor projects for winter, like refinishing furniture.

We hope you'll enjoy staying with us.  JP has great restaurants, an easy commute downtown and some great green spaces to explore.

name: Cozy Private Garden Studio near the Heart of JP
summary: Best of both worlds: this airy and light, newly renovated private studio is set in a beautiful, secluded back yard/garden, yet it's an easy walk to all the cool shops, restaurants, and cultural activities of our diverse Jamaica Plain neighborhood, public transportation, and acres of green space. STARTING JULY 1, 2019 Massachusetts will charge a room OCCUPANCY TAX OF 5.7%. This tax has been included in the listed price
space: The studio is accessed down the garden path from our driveway. A wall of windows frames a beautiful view of the garden. We offer coffee and tea with milk and cream to go with homemade granola for approx three days.

STARTING JULY 1, 2019 Massachusetts will charge a room OCCUPANCY TAX OF 5.7%. This tax has been included in the listed price The studio is accessed down the garden path from our driveway. A wall of windows frames a beautiful view of the garden. We offer coffee and tea with milk and cream to go with homemade granola for approx three days. You have your own brick patio and shared access to the yard and garden. Free off-street parking available. We live upstairs and will do our best to be here to greet you and help you get settled. We're happy to chat and offer ideas about things to do and places to go, but we will also respect your privacy if you prefer to be on your own. Jamaica Plain is a vibra
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant, diverse neighborhood, with lots of great coffee shops, restaurants, and funky little stores. JP is also blessed with green space. We're surrounded by the Emerald Necklace, a string of parks designed by Fredrick Law Olmstead. This includes a gorgeous, free 280 acre arboretum just down the hill.
notes: We are on the top of a small hill that could be difficult for some people.  The path to the studio has ten shallow steps down from the driveway which you can see with in the photos. Sadly we cannot accommodate any pets due to allergy and health concerns of all guests.
transit: The Jamaica Street stop on the 39 Bus is two blocks away. The Forest Hills Stop of the subway is a 10-15 minute walk, Hubway (bike-sharing) and Zipcar are also within a 10-minute walk. We have off-street parking if you need it, but driving isn't really an ideal way to get around Boston.
access: You have your own brick patio and shared access to the yard and garden. Free off-street parking available.
interaction: We live upstairs and will do our best to be here to greet you and help you get settled. We're happy to chat and offer ideas about things to do and places to go, but we will also respect your privacy if you prefer to be on your own.
house_rules: - No smoking on the property - indoors or out.  **For the comfort of all our guests we ask that people not use COLOGNE  or PERFUME in the studio to avoid problems for people with allergies. Mildly scented soap and shampoo are fine. We provide basic toiletries if you need them. Sadly we cannot accommodate ANY pets due to allergy and health concerns of all guests. Room only sleeps 2 adults. Please do not make reservations for friends or family. We honor the Air BnB policy about third party bookings and will exercise the right to turn away any guest who did not book for themselves.
host_about: Ann: Quilt artist, cyclist, beach and desert lover, school librarian, off-the-beaten track traveler... I'm also very fond of good beer and good ice cream. Esther: Woodworker and fabric crafter, intrepid nature photographer, excited to welcome people into our new space.

There’s nothing ordinary about Jamaica Plain, or “JP” as it’s called, a dynamic Boston neighborhood located southwest of downtown. The commercial district, along Centre and South streets, reflects Jamaica Plain’s eclectic community of artists, writers, musicians, activists, young families, and indie-business owners. Fine dining and casual restaurants serve foods of Cub
neighborhood_overview: There’s nothing ordinary about Jamaica Plain, or “JP” as it’s called, a dynamic Boston neighborhood located southwest of downtown. The commercial district, along Centre and South streets, reflects Jamaica Plain’s eclectic community of artists, writers, musicians, activists, young families, and indie-business owners. Fine dining and casual restaurants serve foods of Cuba, Scotland, India, Lebanon, Cambodia, Japan, and other international fare. Boutiques sell everything from kitchen gadgets to funky vintage attire to one-of-a-kind artisan crafts. To experience a retro-hippie vibe, stop by the Centre Street Cafe, a neighborhood institution that served locally sourced food before it was fashionable. Locals stand in line for brunch that features organic eggs, sourdough French toast, and crispy raised waffles with fresh fruit and real maple syrup. Caramelo Clothing Co. sells an eclectic collection of men’s wear, including classic and trendy jeans, ties, wallets, belts, sweaters, grooming acc
notes: From Logan airport to my place: Take blue line @ airport———transfer to Orange line at State———7 stops to Jackson Square———Walk 3 mins to 2 Wyman Pl,Boston,MA 02130 From Back Bay Station to my place: Take orange line at Back Bay———4 stops to Jackson Square——— Walk 3 mins to 2 Wyman Pl, Boston, MA 02130 Security camera in the hallway for safety purpose.
transit: Orange line T (Jackson Square) right around the corner 10 mins to Back Bay, Newbury st, Copley Square, 20 mins to Quincy Market, Downtown, Chinatown 30 mins to Harvard Square  Uber is also a great way to get around since Boston is a small city.
access: everywhere in Unit 1 and backyard.

name: Cozy quiet private room on T line in Jamaica Plain
summary: Located across 20th Century  Italian Non-Denominational cemetery. One of Boston's most diverse happening neighborhoods. Once described as the "Eden of America", JP evolved after the civil War from a series of large farms to one of the country's first streetcar suburbs. It includes a key part of the city's famed Emerald Necklace Conservancy, a seven mile series of contiguous parks Nearby attractions include but not limited: Jamaica Pond  Arnold Arboretum  Forest Hills Cemetery Franklin Park Zoo

Steps to Centre Street's shops and restaurants, Jamaica Pond and the Emerald Necklace, and the T. The perfect location for a quiet retreat or a quick commute to downtown Boston, Longwood Medical Area, colleges and universities, the MFA, theater district and more.
space: This fully-furnished, private unit is on the 2nd and 3rd floor of our two-family home. One bedroom has two twin XL beds that can be combined upon request into a single King-sized bed. The second bedroom has a queen bed. Private bathroom with claw-foot tub/shower. Eat-in kitchen/living room with TV, cable, Apple TV and DVD player.

Light-filled, airy, and modern, each comes fully equipped with professional grade kitchens, spacious bathrooms, oversized windows, sleek finishes, and wood flooring. From Fenway Park, to the Institute of Contemporary Arts, The Faneuil Hall Marketplace, and the magnificent Trinity church. Also, do not miss a wonderful shopping experience on Boston’s famous Newbury Street. This is the central location for all major shopping stores, boutiques and art galleries. Major Attractions: •	Fenway Park- 1.7mi  •	Faneuil Hall Marketplace (a.k.a Quincy Market)- 5.6 mi •	New England Aquarium- 5.5 mi •	Boston Opera House- 3.7 mi •	Trinity Church- 3.1 mi •	Museum of Science- 4.5 mi •	ICA Museum- 4.7 mi •	Bunker Hill Monument- 5.2 mi Restaurants: •	Brookline Family Restaurant- 0.6 mi o	Unpretentious storefront dishes out hearty portions of Turkish & Mediterranean eats •	La Morra- 0.5 mi o	Busy, cozy restaurant serving homemade pasta & Tuscan-style wood-grilled entrees in a compact space •	Brigham Circle- 0.6 mi o	A mix of standard Chinese dishes, from chop suey to kung pao chicken, with weekday lunch deals
notes: Unit Amenities •	Fully furnished – bedding, table linens, dinnerware, flatware, glassware, bathroom accessories and towels, basic kitchen electronics, and basic cleaning supplies •	Oversized windows  •	Dishwasher •	Fully equipped, chef-style kitchen with modern cabinetry, Silestone quartz countertops, and top-of-the-line appliances •	Wood flooring  •	Spacious bathrooms with spacious vanities, chrome fixtures, tile flooring •	Front loading washer/dryer •	Digital cable TV, local phone service, and wireless internet included •	Complimentary Welcome Package featuring local area information, toiletries, and everyday home necessities
transit: The property is conveniently located about 10 minutes from General Edward Lawrence Logan International Airport. Boston is America’s Walking City so public transportation is also easily accessible – just a short walk to Chinatown, Boylston, and Downtown Crossing T-stops, as well as South Station. Transportation/Taxi: •	The T Light Rail and Buses- Metro- Riverway- 0.2 mi •	Enterprise Rent-A-Car- 2.1 mi Airports: •	Boston International Airport-6.6 mi

name: Cozy Private Room, steps to gorgeous Jamaica Pond!
summary: Steps to the scenic Jamaica Pond and the vibrant Centre street, our apartment is in the heart of Jamaica Plain. Restaurants, bars, shopping, and public transportation are within walking distance. Our place was built in late 1800s and retains many characteristics. Either for a brief stay or an extended visit, this place offers amenities for a home away from home. Come visit Boston and feel cozy at our home. We welcome visitors from every corner of world and we are also LGBT friendly!
space: The apartment is on 2nd floor with one flight of stairs. The bedroom is a private room with two doors leading to both kitchen and a hallway. One of us always gets up early to make coffee, so feel free to grab some for yourself!
description: Steps to the scenic Jamaica Pond and the vibrant Centre street, our apartment is in the heart of Jamaica Plain. Restaurants, bars, shopping, and public transportation are within walking distance. Our place was built in late 1800s and retains many characteristics. Either for a brief stay or an extended visit, this place offers amenities for a home away from home. Come visit Boston and feel cozy at our home. We welcome visitors from every corner of world and we are also LGBT friendly! The apartment is on 2nd floor with one flight of stairs. The bedroom is a private room with two doors leading to both kitchen and a hallway. One of us always gets up early to make coffee, so feel free to grab some for yourself! The apartment is a 3-bedroom unit with one bedroom designated for guests. We share the bathroom, we can work out the schedule for showering and such. Kitchen is open for use, with a dedicated area in refrigerator for your use. Feel free to ask us if you need to use something.  Wifi i
neighborhood_overview: We're literally steps to everything! Jamaica Plain is a vibrant and diverse area of Boston. Steps to the pond for a 1.5 mile walk around, take a brief hike in the Arboretum (about 15 minute walk from the apt), explore the Emerald Necklace trails, or window-shop on Centre street, there are plenty of options for scenic routes. Great cafes, restaurants, ice cream shops, and more, within few blocks.
notes: We have an elderly dog that is polite, friendly, and usually sleeps most of the day. A dog walker comes by once a day during the week, around 11am-12pm. Also, this is an old building in a city, which means there will be some noises at varying times during day/night. There is a property rule: no excessive noises after 10pm, so that guarantees a decent night's sleep!
transit: Uber, Lyft, and et al are pretty cheap, considering the distance between our place to everywhere in Boston. Bus #39 (which will take you to Copley Square and downtown) is by our street on Centre Street. Stony Brook Orange T stop is about 7-minute walk. The metro takes you to downtown and beyond. Airport is about 50 minutes to an hour via public transportation, or up to 30 minutes via car. There are on-street parking, and it can be full at times, but there are always spaces available a block or two away.
access: The apartment is a 3-bedroom unit with one bedroom designated for guests. We share the bathroom, we can work out the schedule for showering and such. Kitchen is open for use, with a dedicated area in refrigerator for your use. Feel free to ask us if you need to use something.  Wifi is always accessible and super fast! There is also a beautiful outdoor courtyard which can be accessed by the back stairs or going around between buildings.
interaction: Your hosts, Andrew and Megan, are working professionals with varying schedule throughout the week.  We are usually up and out early in the morning and come back in the afternoon or evening. We have a dog and she sleeps most of the time. We're always by our phones so if you need anything, text us!
house_rules: Quiet time after 9pm. No guests.
host_about: I live to read, eat, travel, learn, and laugh. Everything else is optional :)

name: Private Room in Heart of JP-View of Skyline

name: Washington 201 | 2BR 2BA | Doyle's Pub
summary: Huge new 2 bed / 2 full bath unit in Jamaica Plain with outdoor area!  Walk to gorgeous Jamaica Pond and the bustling street life on Centre Street, and only 5 min to Subway!  The Washington 201 is a new property that features a washer/dryer, full kitchen including dishwasher, disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans, and Central Air/Heat.   Private Paid Parking available.  Family and business friendly building and unit!
space: The building is just 4 blocks to the Green St. Subway on the Orange Line as well as the Franklin Park Zoo.  Unit can provide a dedicated parking spot in building parking lot. Building has an elevator and building entrance is on street level (no stoop). Large Jamaica Plain Apartment, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, in-unit washer/dryer, central air/heating on Washington St. Full kitchen includes microwave, dishwasher, stove,  disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans.  Unit is brand new for 2018 and private paid parking available. Units also include a huge wifi streaming 50" HDTV with free broadband wifi!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a diverse, tight-knit neighborhood with serene Green spaces. Trails loop around Jamaica Pond and through the vast Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University, both links in the Emerald Necklace chain of parks. Family-owned restaurants, indie shops and snug bars dot Centre Street. Latin American eateries are clustered around Hyde Square. Forest Hills Cemetery, noted for its landscaping, dates from 1848. Walk to Jamaica Pond for a beautiful view where you can rent a boat, go on a run, enjoy local musicians (not buskers), or sit and have a picnic. Minutes to the night life on Centre St., a quaint small town downtown feeling where you can find bars, coffee, ice cream, lunch/dinner, groceries and more!
notes: NA
transit: By subway Orange Line: The Jackson Square, Stony Brook, Green St., and Forest Hills stops are all located in Jamaica Plain. Each stop takes you to a fairly different part of the neighborhood. The Jackson Square stop, for example, is set in a section of the neighborhood that is both commercial and residential while the Stony Brook stop is set in an almost exclusively residential section of JP. The Green Street stop is the closest to the section of Centre St. considered to be "downtown" JP. Only 4 blocks to the Green Street Station of the OrangeLine. By bus The 39 Bus follows the same route at the E branch of the Green Line, but continues beyond Heath Street (where the "E" Line ends), up South Huntington Avenue, up Centre Street through "downtown" JP, and ends at Forest Hills. Only 6 blocks to Forest Hills T Station. By bicycle The Southwest Corridor Park, which begins at Back Bay Station, stretches to Forest Hills and includes one of the best bike paths in the city. The bike path runs a

host_about:
Lance R. Swank, Principal

His units offer comfortable and luxurious appointments to compliment the style of the building, whether a newly constructed condo or a historic Brownstone. Visitors to Boston seeking a furnished apartment without the corporate, hotel-room-like feel of most furnished rentals will find themselves more at home in Lance’s spaces.

Lance is the President of LSBM Management, LLC and holds an MBA degree from of the F.W. Olin Graduate School of Business at Babson College. He lives and invests in the City of Boston.

Large Jamaica Plain Apartment, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, in-unit washer/dryer, zoned central air/heating on Washington St. walkable to the Centre Street Nightlife area. Full kitchen includes microwave, dishwasher, stove,  disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans.  Unit is brand new for 2018 and private paid parking available. Unit also includes a huge wifi streaming 50" HDTV and free broadband wifi!
description: Huge new 2 bed / 2 full bath unit in Jamaica Plain with outdoor area! Walk to gorgeous Jamaica Pond and the bustling street life on Centre Street, and only 5 min to Subway! The Washington 301 is a new unit that features a washer/dryer, full kitchen including dishwasher, disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans, and Central Air/Heat. Private Paid Parking available. Family and business friendly building and unit! The building is just 4 blocks to the Green St. Subway on the Orange Line as well as the Franklin Park Zoo.  Unit has a dedicated parking spot in building parking lot (available at an additional fee). Building has an elevator and building entrance is on street level (no stoop). Large Jamaica Plain Apartment, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, in-unit washer/dryer, zoned central air/heating on Washington St. walkable to the Centre Street Nightlife area. Full kitchen includes microwave, dishwasher, stove,  disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans.  Unit is brand new for 2018 and private paid p
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a diverse, tight-knit neighborhood with serene Green spaces. Trails loop around Jamaica Pond and through the vast Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University, both links in the Emerald Necklace chain of parks. Family-owned restaurants, indie shops and snug bars dot Centre Street. Latin American eateries are clustered around Hyde Square. Forest Hills Cemetery, noted for its landscaping, dates from 1848. Walk to Jamaica Pond for a beautiful view where you can rent a boat, go on a run, enjoy local musicians (not buskers), or sit and have a picnic. Minutes to the street life on Centre St., a quaint small town downtown feeling where you can find bars, coffee, ice cream, lunch/dinner, groceries and more!
notes: NA
transit: By subway Orange Line: The Jackson Square, Stony Brook, Green St., and Forest Hills stops are all located in Jamaica Plain. Each stop takes you to a fairly different part of the neighborhood. The Jackson Square stop, for example, is set in a section of the neighborhood that is both commercial and residential while the Stony Brook stop is set in an almost exclusively residential section of JP. The Green Street stop is the closest to the section of Centre St. considered to be "downtown" JP. Unit is 4 blocks to the Green Street Station of the OrangeLine. By bus The 39 Bus follows the same route at the E branch of the Green Line, but continues beyond Heath Street (where the "E" Line ends), up South Huntington Avenue, up Centre Street through "downtown" JP, and ends at Forest Hills. Unit is 6 blocks to Forest Hills T Station. By bicycle The Southwest Corridor Park, which begins at Back Bay Station, stretches to Forest Hills and includes one of the best bike paths in the city. The bike path
access: Full apartment access in a secured and quiet brick building.  A true sanctuary in the big city!

host_about:
Lance R. Swank, Principal

His units offer comfortable and luxurious appointments to compliment the style of the building, whether a newly constructed condo or a historic Brownstone. Visitors to Boston seeking a furnished apartment without the corporate, hotel-room-like feel of most furnished rentals will find themselves more at home in Lance’s spaces.

Lance is the President of LSBM Management, LLC and holds an MBA degree from of the F.W. Olin Graduate School of Business at Babson College. He lives and invests in the City of Boston.

name: Sun filled modern clean master suite & bath
summary: Sun filled modern master suite, newly renovated with hardwood floors, oversized bathroom in a great location in Jamaica Plain (JP), a neighborhood in Boston. Convenient location to nearby shops and restaurants, and easy transportation to downtown Boston.  We're long time JP residents, recent Airbnb hosts with over 49 five star reviews.  Perfect for romantic getaways, adventures, extra room for holiday family visits or for your business trip. Unpack, unwind and enjoy Boston for the holidays!
space: Light, airy and calming clean space. The master suite studio is in a two family house on the third floor. We provide for every need from the queen size bed, walk in closet and a mini fridge, Keurig, microwave, AC and in unit W/D, towels and linen, and high speed wireless Internet.  The sofa coverts to a twin sized-futon and there’s a 55inch 4K TV so you can relax, sit back and watch Netflix or Amazon Prime - you would think you're in a high end boutique hotel.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain (JP) is a cool, hip, eclectic and diverse gem, only 10 mins by train to downtown Boston. There's tons of good eats from fine dining to solid cheap finds on Centre Street, as well as cool shops and boutiques.  Our JP favorites - easy walks from your stay on South and Centre Streets Food and treats -Fiores Bakery (and sandwiches) -Cafe Nero  -The Real Deal (sandwiches and pizza) -JP Seafood (sushi) -Noodle Barn -Casa Verde Mexican -Grass Fed (burgers) -Monumental Cupcakes (apple cider donuts!) -JP Licks Ice Cream Higher End Dining -Vee Vee (new American) -Centre Street Cafe (Italian) -Ten Tables (new American) Odds & ends -Happy Family grocery on South Street (beer/wine and convenience store) -Jeanie Johnston bar on South St.  -Blanchard's Liquor on Centre St.  -CVS pharmacy on Centre St. We love all the green space, and the Arboretum is only a 5 mins away. There’s also Franklin Park, JP Pond, fun shops and dining on Centre Street, Sam Adam Brewery.  Easy walk to public tra
notes: NA
transit: Easy walk from Forest Hills T stop off the Orange line, less than half mile away. Also accessible from Copley/Back Bay area with #39 bus couple blocks away.  Street parking on Jamaica Street and nearby streets. No resident permit required!
access: NA
interaction: We love JP and live 5 mins walk away. We’re available for questions or recommendations, and want you to maximize your stay!
house_rules: No shoes in the master suite please. Helps keep it clean for you and other guests. Shelves and bench available on the second floor entryway
host_about:
2 Running enthusiasts from Boston with our little bundle of joy, Sophia, looking to be safely ensconced in a cozy, quiet rental, suitable for experiencing all the finer things the world has to offer. 

From morning runs to 7pm dinners, we keep a respectable schedule, void of late night noise and messy bathrooms. 

We love 
The beach
Sunny days
Cooking
Cribbage

Sailing
Swimming
Cooking :-)
Eating great food!
Coffee 
Gardening
The list goes on. 

You won't be disappointed. We are amazing guests and renters. 

Cheers
Chris, Jin and Sophia

neighborhood_overview: Directly across from the Arnold Arboretum is a living museum of plants, and the growing season offers the perfect time to explore its meaning and diversity. From opportunities to learn about important topics in classes and lectures to informal gatherings in the landscape.  Just a 2 blocks away many people enjoy walking or running on the 1.5 mile path around the pond. Street parking can be found on Perkins Street , on the pond's west side.  A natural "kettle" depression formed by glacial action, the pond itself covers about 68-acres, and has an average depth of 25 feet; it is 53 feet deep near the center. Fishing is allowed with a Massachusetts fishing license. The pond is stocked each year by the Massachusetts Division of Fisheries and Wildlife .  Sailboats, rowboats, and kayaks can be rented at the Jamaica Pond Boat House, which is administered by the Courageous Sailing Center .  Also near by is Franklin Park, about 2 miles away  it is a  527-acre (2.13 km2) parkland in the Jamaica Pl
notes: This is NOT a child proof house. Please no children PLEASE NO pets
transit: Steps to the bus line #38.  You can walk (about 10 minutes) or take the bus to the orange line Forest Hills. This is the first stop so you will always get a seat and runs about every 6 minutes.

name: Bright City Apt. in hip Jamaica Plain!  Sleeps 6
summary: Steps off Centre St in the heart of Jamaica Plain is this spacious and cheerful second floor 2+ bedroom/1 bathroom; updated and fully stocked kitchen, wifi, Roku, side yard, family-friend lovely apartment.  Walkable/bikeable neighborhood, and access to the 39 Bus and Orange line Stonybrook station. Short ride to Longwood Medical, Hospitals, Universities, Copley Square, the Freedom Trail, Fanueil Hall, Harvard, BU, Boston Common, Museums, Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park Zoo, New England Aquarium.
space: Updated kitchen with stainless steel appliances, maple cabinets and granite counter-tops.  Bathroom with unique features, lots of storage and tub/shower.  Family friendly apartment with children's books, toys, high chair, stroller and pack and play.  Two ample bedrooms with one king and one queen bed, multiple closets and dressers in both rooms.  Large and comfortable living room/dinning room, and separate study with desk and couch that converts to two twin beds, perfect for children or additional guests.  AC window units and fans available for the summer months.  Lovely side yard through the back door of the apartment (and down one flight) with seating in the appropriate seasons.

Large and comfortable living room/dinning room, and separate study with desk and couch that converts to two twin beds, perfect for children or additio
neighborhood_overview: Central location, easy commute to downtown Boston.  There are a lot of restaurants, coffee shops, parks and playgrounds right near by. Easy to get to and from walking, biking, public transportation or driving.
notes: You will have downstairs neighbors that you might hear on occasion but they do not have any access to the apartment.  There is a shared entrance. There is no central air in the unit, just AC units and fans.
transit: 39 Bus, Orange Line to Stonybrook Station. Having a car is not necessary, but if you bring one you can usually park on the street with ease, and it is helpful for day trips.
access: The entire apartment is on the 2nd floor to which you will have complete access and privacy.
interaction: You will have the place to yourself and I do not live on site, but if you need anything I can be easily reached and live nearby.
house_rules: 1. Please do not smoke anywhere in the apartment or hallways.  There is place for cigarette disposal on the front porch, so if you must smoke, please do so outside. 2. Please be respectful of the downstairs neighbors - we ask you to engage in quiet hours from 11pm until 7am.  3. Please ensure the thermostat on the living room wall is not turned up upon your departure. 4. Please do not leave behind any perishable food in the refrigerator at the end of your stay. 5. There is a laundry basket in the closet in the bedroom with the king bed, please place used towels in the basket upon your departure. Please do not hesitate to ask any questions or contact us for anything you might need during your visit.  Thank you and we hope you enjoy your stay!
host_about: I'm a Boston native who enjoys traveling and hosting. I like to be outside as much as possible and seek out adventures together with my family.

name: Cozy 1BR by Forest Hill Station in Jamaica Plain
summary: Nice private room in a 2b1b condo with IKEA queen bed with brand new desk, chair, and shelf. Brand new carpet and hardwood floors. Kitchen updated very modernly with all stainless steel appliances, gleaming granite counter tops with a dishwasher. The bathroom has natural stone tiles with waterfall shower head!  Just 1 block from Forest Hills Station (Orange Line) and fast commute downtown. Your host, Kai,  lives in another room and he is a researcher in Harvard Medical School with a PhD degree.
space: NA
description: Nice private room in a 2b1b condo with IKEA queen bed with brand new desk, chair, and shelf. Brand new carpet and hardwood floors. Kitchen updated very modernly with all stainless steel appliances, gleaming granite counter tops with a dishwasher. The bathroom has natural stone tiles with waterfall shower head!  Just 1 block from Forest Hills Station (Orange Line) and fast commute downtown. Your host, Kai,  lives in another room and he is a researcher in Harvard Medical School with a PhD degree. kitchen, bathroom, living room are all accessible Just 1 block from Forest Hills Station (Orange Line) and fast commute downtown: 10 mins to Northeastern University and Ruggles station where you can take the LMA shuttle, 15 mins to Back bay and 20 mins to Chinatown.  You can also jump on the 39 bus to Longwood Medical Area (20 mins), Museum of Fine Arts and Hynes Convention Center (30 mins). The bus run every 15 mins until midnight which is very convenient. Steps to walking and jogging trails as
neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: You will have two keys, one for the front porch. Another for both front door and rear door in the kitchen. When you leave, just leave the keys on the desk and then you are all set. If you lost the keys during your stay, you have to pay an extra $20 for the inconvenience and risk it might cause.
transit: Just 1 block from Forest Hills Station (Orange Line) and fast commute downtown: 10 mins to Northeastern University and Ruggles station where you can take the LMA shuttle, 15 mins to Back bay and 20 mins to Chinatown.  You can also jump on the 39 bus to Longwood Medical Area (20 mins), Museum of Fine Arts and Hynes Convention Center (30 mins). The bus run every 15 mins until midnight which is very convenient. Steps to walking and jogging trails as well as the conservation area including the Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University and Jamaica Pond. You are also connected to Whole Foods market, Stop & Shop, Seven-Eleven, CVS and different kinds of restaurants and bars in Jamaica neighborhood within 10 mins’ commute.
access: kitchen, bathroom, living room are all accessible

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Private Suite Near Jamaica Pond, sleeps 4!
summary: Private suite located away from the hustle and bustle of the city but close to everything!    This is an ideal place for a group of friends or a family that wants private accommodations.  The suite is spacious, modern, and includes parking for one vehicle.  We are friendly folks and welcome people from all backgrounds... sorry no smokers or pets though.
space: The suite features a private entrance, a bedroom, a living room, a bathroom, and a breakfast bar area.  The suite can accommodate four guests sharing two queen beds - one via a futon in the bedroom and one via a pullout sofa in the living room.  Included are the following... basic toiletries, high speed internet, cable TV, and complimentary coffee and tea.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very quiet with a suburban feel.  Short drive to downtown Boston, Longwood medical area, and local colleges and universities.   You can also get around by public transportation but it takes 20 minutes to walk to the local train station, so we recommend bringing a car.  For nature lovers... we are within walking distance of Jamaica Pond and Arnold Arboretum.

access: Since the suite is self contained guests will only have access to the suite area. We are not setup for someone that wants to cook a full meal.  There are no laundry facilities available. We have a wonderful back yard that we share with guests.  The backyard has a gas grill and a fire-pit and ample seating for groups of all sizes.
interaction: My family and I have hectic schedules so there may not be much time for personal interaction.  The suite has a separate entrance with a keypad lock so guests can come and go as they please.  Good communication is important so we are available via text to answer questions.

host_about:
Hello!

I am a certified music therapist working in the Boston area.  I work primarily with older adults with dementia.  I love my job and am so happy to have a career that helps to spread the joy of music.  I play in an elecro-pop band and also have a solo folk project.  A few of my favorite artists are Bjork, Coco Rosie, Joanna Newsom, Grimes, and Erykah Badu.  I enjoy being involved in the local art and music scene.  I also love to spend time reading, cooking, hiking, going to the beach and painting clothes.  My three favorite places I have traveled to are Morocco, Thailand and Nepal.  I love to smile, and I love meeting new people.  :-)

name: Luxe All New 4BR 2 Bath Duplex ★ A/C ★ Near Subway
summary: Our spacious and newly renovated 4 bedroom, 2 bathroom duplex can easily accommodate up to 10 people. Filled with natural light and featuring high ceilings, luxurious memory foam mattresses, and stocked with all the comforts of home, our place is ideal for groups and families looking for an upscale and comfortable Boston experience. Located steps from shops, restaurants, and the subway, our location is perfect for enjoying the trendy JP neighborhood while having quick access to the city center.
space: Our condo is about an 8 minute walk through a gorgeous residential neighborhood to the subway station. From there, it is a quick 10-15 ride into downtown Boston. The property is also minutes from Northeastern, Boston University, Boston College, Wentworth, Fenway Park, Copley Square, Back Bay, South End, Brookline, and so much more! This spacious unit has four bedrooms with a total of 9 beds, and is the 2nd and 3rd floor of a two-unit house. The first floor features a stunning kitchen, contemporary living room,  two brand new full bathrooms, and two bedrooms.  Bedroom 1 has a queen size bed, and Bedroom 2 has a bunkbed, the bottom of which is a full size bed and the top is a twin size bed. Upstairs features two unique bedrooms, with slanted ceilings and a turret, showcasing the house's victorian-era architecture. Bedroom 3 has a full size bed and a twin size bed. Bedroom 4 is a two-room connected suite, featuring two twin size beds in one portion of the room and a third twin size bed in

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain, or JP as the locals refer to it, is a wonderful neighborhood of Boston. It is quiet, scenic, and peaceful with wonderful local coffee shops, bars, and restaurants, and is also very close to the city center (about 3 miles).
notes: No parties or events. Check-in is anytime after 3:00pm and check-out is no later than 11:00am. We have to firmly keep to these times as our housekeepers require ample time to prepare for your arrival. If you have arrangements that require a check-in or check-out outside of these times, please contact us and we will do our best to accommodate you. Payment is due at the time of booking. Airbnb retains a separate security deposit in escrow which is fully refundable. If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, please click my profile picture at the top of this listing and then click the "contact host" button to send an email directly to us.
transit: We are a short walk to the Green Street T stop on the Orange line in beautiful Jamaica Plain. There are also public buses that can take you all over the city, as well as taxis, Uber, and Lyft rides always located nearby.
access: The entire apartment is for your group's enjoyment. Please note that there is one other condo in this building, which is located below this unit. Keys will be left in a lock box at the front door for your easy access anytime day or night.
interaction: You will have complete privacy during your stay.  With that being said, we are just a quick call or text away if you need anything.
house_rules: - NO PARTIES OR EVENTS - You will have neighbors living below the unit on the first floor, so you must be respectful of noise. NO LOUD NOISES AFTER 10 PM - No smoking, candles, or open flames of any kind. - The rear staircase (behind the kitchen) is to be used ONLY in emergencies. - The unit does not have access to any outdoor space on the property. - FREE PARKING is on public street only, we do not have a private off-street parking spot available. Parking on street is very easy.
host_about: Long Island native, moved to Boston for school and never left! I live in JP and love the area. I can't wait to share my space with you!

summary: Enormous new 3 bed / 2 full bath unit in Jamaica Plain with outdoor area! Walk to gorgeous Jamaica Pond and the bustling street life on Centre Street, and only 5 min to Subway! The Washington 2 is a new property that features a washer/dryer, full kitchen including dishwasher, disposal, coffee maker and pots and pans, and Central Air/Heat. Private Paid Parking available. Family and business friendly building and unit!
space: The building is just 4 blocks to the Green St. Subway on the Orange Line as well as the Franklin Park Zoo.  Unit can provide a dedicated parking spot in building parking lot. Large Jamaica Plain Apartment, 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom, in-unit washer/dryer, zoned central air/heating on Washington St. walkable to the streetlife on Centre Street. neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a diverse, tight-knit neighborhood with serene Green spaces. Trails loop around Jamaica Pond and through the vast Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University, both links in the Emerald Necklace chain of parks. Family-owned restaurants, indie shops and snug bars dot Centre Street. Latin American eateries are clustered around Hyde Square. Forest Hills Cemetery, noted for its landscaping, dates from 1848. Walk to Jamaica Pond for a beautiful view where you can rent a boat, go on a run, enjoy local musicians (not buskers), or sit and have a picnic. Minutes to the night life on Centre St., a quaint small town downtown feeling where you can find bars, coffee, ice cream, lunch/dinner, groceries and more!
notes: NA
transit: By subway Orange Line: The Jackson Square, Stony Brook, Green St., and Forest Hills stops are all located in Jamaica Plain. Each stop takes you to a fairly different part of the neighborhood. The Jackson Square stop, for example, is set in a section of the neighborhood that is both commercial and residential while the Stony Brook stop is set in an almost exclusively residential section of JP. The Green Street stop is the closest to the section of Centre St. considered to be "downtown" JP. Unit is 4 blocks to the Green Street Station of the OrangeLine. By bus The 39 Bus follows the same route at the E branch of the Green Line, but continues beyond Heath Street (where the "E" Line ends), up South Huntington Avenue, up Centre Street through "downtown" JP, and ends at Forest Hills. Unit is 6 blocks to Forest Hills T Station. By bicycle The Southwest Corridor Park, which begins at Back Bay Station, stretches to Forest Hills and includes one of the best bike paths in the city. The bike path
access: Full apartment access in a secured and quiet brick building.  A true sanctuary in the big city!
