host_about:
Lance R. Swank, Principal

His units offer comfortable and luxurious appointments to compliment the style of the building, whether a newly constructed condo or a historic Brownstone. Visitors to Boston seeking a furnished apartment without the corporate, hotel-room-like feel of most furnished rentals will find themselves more at home in Lance’s spaces.

Lance is the President of LSBM Management, LLC and holds an MBA degree from of the F.W. Olin Graduate School of Business at Babson College. He lives and invests in the City of Boston.

notes: Dog friendly with a $100 one time cleaning fee. We don’t want the next guest to be bothered by any dog hair or puppy slobber. NO Television.  High Speed internet included - don't forget your laptop if you want to watch TV. With enough notice, I can schedule a cleaner during your stay for an additional charge of $60. Lock out fee of $100. Early or late check in fee of $50. IMPORTANT to leave keys in the lockbox where you found them at the end of your stay.
transit: Street parking. When parking your car, keep an eye out for signs that mention street cleaning and resident parking.  You shouldn't have a problem if you pay attention to the signs.  Usually doesn't take more than 2 minutes to find a space.  Often times I find a spot right on Chestnut Ave in front of the home.
access: All of it!
interaction: I’m available if anyone needs me in regards to help with the condo. Otherwise I’ll leave you alone to enjoy yourself!
house_rules: Please treat this home like your own.
host_about:
The owners of this special house are two couples who are best friends. 

We love using our barnhouse when it’s not booked.  We often times have a few friends out to the Berks, when available, for browsing local shops, skiing, hiking, biking and relaxing by the fireplace or firepit. It’s a fun space to share with others!

We all live full time in Boston and have an amazing management team that supports this special home with us. They take care of the cleaning, rubbish and landscaping while we are in Boston. 

Please don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions!

Originally a summertime resort destination for Bostonians, Jamaica Plain (JP) is a classic streetcar suburb of Boston. Located southwest of Downtown Boston, JP was annexed by the City in 1874. Jamaica Plain has consistently been an important center for residential life, arts, and commerce for the City of Boston.  JP's residential streets, filled with iconic triple-decker houses in imaginati
neighborhood_overview: Originally a summertime resort destination for Bostonians, Jamaica Plain (JP) is a classic streetcar suburb of Boston. Located southwest of Downtown Boston, JP was annexed by the City in 1874. Jamaica Plain has consistently been an important center for residential life, arts, and commerce for the City of Boston.  JP's residential streets, filled with iconic triple-decker houses in imaginative colors, are home to a multi-faceted population. A real jewel of JP is 68-acre Jamaica Pond. It is popular with local residents for fishing, sailing, and running along its 1.5 mile shore path.  The 265-acre Arnold Arboretum, designed by Frederick Law Olmsted, offers a botanical oasis in the heart of the city.  Jamaica Plain is easily accessible by the Southwest Corridor, MBTA trains, and buses. The main transit hub for the area is Forest Hill Station. Since the eighteenth century, Centre Street has been a major retail street for the community in Jamaica Plain. JP's diversity of residents is reflect
notes: NA
transit: Super convenient to transportation: 39 bus that goes to Back Bay, Stony Brook Station on the Orange Line.  Jamaica Plain center is just around the bend.

host_about:
Hello! I'm Myla, the founding member of a vegetarian coop house in Jamaica Plain, a lovely neighborhood of Boston. Our house is a 2 minute walk from the Orange Line (Forest Hills Station) and our neighborhood is walking distance from the Harvard Arboretum, Forest Hills Cemetery, Jamaica Pond, and plenty of restaurants, local retail shops, and bars. There's nice running and walking locations nearby including the Arboretum, Forest Hills Cemetery (has some famous graves!) and Franklin Park, plus Jamaica Pons is just over a mile walk/run. 

I work from home for a dance non-profit, so am usually around to let in guests, deal with any house issues, or show you around!

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: comfortable and cozy
summary: Five minutes walking distance to subway station. A newly renovated 2 family victorian home which is located in a very diverse neighborhood where you can Walk to cafes, restaurants and parks. Neighborhood is a bike friendly and very close to Zip car. The Room is located on the lower level with a second and convenient access/ exit. The room is very clean, comfortable and modern. share bath and kitchen with another person who works long hours..The kitchen and bathroom is on the same floor level.
space: There is a patio on the garden level which guest can use. There are 7 steps from the street level to the front of the house. 14 steps from main level to the lower level. 7 steps on the rear egress from lower level to the patio area in the rear of the house.
description: Five minutes walking distance to subway station. There is a patio in the back of the house with a couple of tables and chairs that are designated for the first floor apartment, where they can smoke or grill if they want to. I’m very flexible to meet my guest or give full privacy if that’s wha
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a very diverse neighborhood with many different great venues from cafes and casual/ formal / ethnic / vegan / fast casual and Samuel Adams brewery within 10 to 15 min walking distance.  People enjoy the proximity to downtown in a very bike friendly neighborhood. (15 min by bike or 12 min by train. Franklin Park / Zoo is two blocks away and many other  parks within 20 min walking distance such as the famous Arnold Arboretum Park of Harvard university.
notes: The apartment is a walk up unit. Main level and lower level. There are two cats that have free range on the main level only. They are not allowed in the lower level where the room is located.
transit: Jamaica plain has many options to get to downtown Boston by bus, bike, subway or by car approx 15 min away.   A convenient Zip car Lot just around the corner. Street parking is also available with no resident sticker restrictions.
access: There is a patio in the back of the house with a couple of tables and chairs that are designated for the first floor apartment, where they can smoke or grill if they want to.
interaction: I’m very flexible to meet my guest or give full privacy if that’s what they want. I will be available for any questions or concerns my guest may have.

name: ☀️Summer!  Rare find. Longwood, Fenway
summary: Free Street Parking Near orange and green line subway and bus lines to downtown Charming one bedroom apartment sleeps 4  Quality linens & towels  Fully applianced kitchen Cable TV and high speed WiFi washer/dryer in building for your use Charm! 19th century home surrounded by lush gardens   Easy commute to Universities, downtown Boston and Longwood Medical Center. 15 minutes by car to Fenway park  When you request to book, please make sure your profile is complete with a photo and your ID.
space: Large Victorian windows splash this cute, romantic apartment with morning sun. Centrally located in the cool, hip & "green" Boston neighborhood of Jamaica Plain, you'll enjoy a chic artist's decor in your freshly architect updated, decorator painted, furnished & styled home with super freshly buffed & varnished gleaming shining inlaid antique oak floors & beautifully furnished apartment with a glam casual summer cottage feel!  Avoid the hustle of the busy downtown in this lovely apartment that so many guests adore because it simply brings a smile to their face!     "Loved the artist's stylish decor with a mix of original artworks & unexpected visually interesting touches!" - is a quote that we hear so often!    On a winding, victorian tree lined street with a sweet little park at the top! There is ample street parking and the orange line subway stop “Stonybrook”  (the "T")  is an 8 minute walk. We offer window AC units to keep you cool during the warmer months, and you're 1/2 block awa
description: Free Street Parking Near orange and green line subway and bus lines to downtown Charming one bedroom apartment sleeps 4  Quality linens & towels  Fully applianced kitchen Cable TV and high speed WiFi washer/dryer in building for your use Charm! 19th century home surrounded by lush gardens   Easy commute to Universities, downtown Boston and Longwood Medical Center. 15 minutes by car to Fenway park  When you request to book, please make sure your profile is complete with a photo and your ID. Large Victorian windows splash this cute, romantic apartment with morning sun. Centrally located in the cool, hip & "green" Boston neighborhood of Jamaica Plain, you'll enjoy a chic artist's decor in your freshly architect updated, decorator painted, furnished & styled home with super freshly buffed & varnished gleaming shining inlaid antique oak floors & beautifully furnished apartment with a glam casual summer cottage feel!  Avoid the hustle of the busy downtown in this lovely apartment that so man
neighborhood_overview: Oodles of charm and an approachable, cheerful neighborhood vibe. JP is a medley of many inspiring cultures and gorgeous natural amenities.  From Olmsted's enchanted Emerald Necklace with its 19th century walking & biking paths to Harvard's 265 Acre arboretum and the enormous Franklin Park and its restored zoo, you can spend days immersed in forests, gardens, intimate meandering paths and wide open vast green spaces as if you have stepped back in time to a slower quieter agrarian time. Stroll back into urbane vibe influenced by the pondside mansions built in the Victorian era to the Edwardian period by Boston's early wealthy merchants and  explore the adjacent multi-family homes built for later musicians, artists and brewery workers that are now becoming homes to young families, biotech entrepreneurs and a variety of caring professionals who work in the medical support home care, non-profit and social justice communities.  The rich mosaic of antique architecture and conserved green spac
notes: When booking please tell us about yourselves and what brings you to the area. Please finish your profile by visiting www.airbnb.com/verify and follow the steps until you get the "verified" icon. Please make sure you have uploaded a clear profile photo of yourself.  This is charming apartment house is in a lovely family neighborhood. If you plan to be up late, have guests over, or plan to frequently come and go, please be quiet. After 10:00 simply have quiet conversations, low volume TV as you consider that others in the lovely house are sound asleep for work and busy touring schedules in the morning.  Also, simply be sure to hold the main entry door so that is closes quietly, otherwise it slams quite loudly and rattles 3 bedrooms.  On occasion, an antique house needs routine maintenance, landscaping equipment or a repair, so there could be noise from a service professional. Please read more in our rules listed below. KEYS ! Lost keys ! The house has a sophisticated ‘total security’ loc
transit: Although the area can easily be seen by foot or by bike, we are also a quick 8 minute walk to the Stony Brook T stop off the orange line subway and also walkable to many bus lines as well.
access: Guests will have full access to the one bedroom apartment including an eat in kitchen, living room and bathroom. The apartment is stocked with chef's cooking supplies, coffee maker, bean grinder, European 'instant boil' tea kettle, essential toiletries and any necessary towels and linens. Iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for use. Queen size bed in the bedroom, queen size sofa bed in the living room.
interaction: I live in the building so may say hello if I see you. My co-hosts Drew and Liesl will be your main contacts. They are always available through the Airbnb app and by cell phone at night for emergencies. They are great at giving local directions and suggestions on things to do in the area.
house_rules: Babies / Children: well behaved, quiet children are welcome This is a quiet, small apartment house of working professionals.  Quiet hours are 9pm - 8am. Owner lives upstairs, ensuring your quiet, peaceful enjoyment.  home 24/7. Since many of the long term residents in this home are doctors or nurses in the  Please carry your luggage up the stairs instead of dragging it as there is a bedroom right below the staircase!  -Leave the apartment as you found it.  -Please respect us and our neighbors by not having any additional guests without host approval.  -No parties. -Smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside, including the front and back gardens.  -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the house without host approval. Cleaning: The apartment is cleaned by our professional cleaning crew before and after your stay but not during your stay. Guests are expected to wash any dishes, pots and pans used, run the dishwasher if needed, pick up and dispose of trash le
host_about: I'm a pragmatic creative I'd say.  I am both a recognized artist as well as an entrepreneur with an MBA from Duke.  In addition to managing a beautifully restored victorian apartment house , I have a promotional products business.  I love to travel to interesting places that are either beautiful and relaxing and / or steeped in  a rich mosaic of history.

name: Entire Home in JP! Perfect for families!
summary: Our home is very new for Boston - built in 2011. The first level is open concept with plenty of space for cooking, eating, watching tv and hanging out! There is a master upstairs with a master bath, as well as a room with a bunk bed and another with a crib. There is a second queen bed in the finished basement, where there is also a half bath. We are steps from the Forest Hills train station (Orange Line, Commuter Rail, and busses), we have garage parking, and the house is set up for kids!
space: NA
description: Our home is very new for Boston - built in 2011. The first level is open concept with plenty of space for cooking, eating, watching tv and hanging out! There is a master upstairs with a master bath, as well as a room with a bunk bed and another with a crib. There is a second queen bed in the finished basement, where there is also a half bath. We are steps from the Forest Hills train station (Orange Line, Commuter Rail, and busses), we have garage parking, and the house is set up for kids! We are steps from Forest Hills Cemetery, which is really more of a park than a cemetery. It is a gorgeous place for a walk on a nice day! We are also within walking distance to the Arnold Arboretum and a 5 minute drive to the Franklin Park Zoo!  There are shops and restaurants at the bottom of our street (2 minute walk). The train (Orange Line and Commuter Rail) is right at the base of our street, and there are plenty of busses, Ubers, taxis and Lyfts in the area. The garage will also be available if
neighborhood_overview: We are steps from Forest Hills Cemetery, which is really more of a park than a cemetery. It is a gorgeous place for a walk on a nice day! We are also within walking distance to the Arnold Arboretum and a 5 minute drive to the Franklin Park Zoo!  There are shops and restaurants at the bottom of our street (2 minute walk).
notes: NA
transit: The train (Orange Line and Commuter Rail) is right at the base of our street, and there are plenty of busses, Ubers, taxis and Lyfts in the area. The garage will also be available if you decide to drive.

space: Easy access to the Longwood Medical Center, Museums of Fine Arts, Boston Freedom Trail, Symphony Hall and more. A quick 10 min. walk to the Orange Line via Green Street or Forest Hills MBTA station, numerous bus lines, and dedicated bike paths.  Ideal for two couples or a family traveling with friends or other adults due to the bedroom layout. The main floor features the living room, dining room, kitchen with deck access, full bath, playroom, and one bedroom with a double bed. The upstairs level features 3 bedrooms (one queen and 3 twin beds) and a full bath.  Note: there are stairs to enter the main floor, and stairs leading to the upper floor with 3 of the 4 bedrooms. Not suitable for children under 4 without prior discussion of layout.

neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by parks on all sides, Jamaica Plain is filled with easy access to green spaces.  A bike commuters and runner dream. Tree-lined car-free corridors from the neighborhood take you past the Jamaica Pond or parallel the train lines straight to Fenway park, downtown Boston, or the Charles River.  June - September, the historic colonial house just down the street offers Thursday evening food truck picnics on the lawn and for families we are located near several playgrounds for every age.  Festivals, live music, and community events held all across the neighborhood within walking distance all summer long. We'll happily alert you to what is going on in your home-away-from-home during your stay here.  From breweries to restaurants to boutique shops, Jamaica Plain loves locally owned businesses. We're happy to direct you to our favorite haunts run by our neighbors.
notes: This home occupies the upper two floors of a 3 floor 2-unit building. There is a private entrance for your unit. Please be respectful of your neighbors downstairs.  This home includes stairs on each and every level.
transit: Walking distance to both the Green Street and Forest Hills MBTA Stations and numerous bus lines.  Hubway bike rack located just down the street and dedicated bike corridors along the park systems and parallel the railway lines. Off-street parking readily available nearby.
access: You enter our home via a private front entrance, and will have access to the full split-level unit, backyard, patio, and deck. We will have one storage room on the main floor that will be locked.  Self check-in.
interaction: This is our home. We live here. If you are here, we are not on site. We will be available 24/7 by email, text, and phone to personally answer any questions and to support you in your stay.
house_rules: Please respect our home and our neighborhood.
host_about: When we travel we like to have an anchor where we can prepare a meal, orient ourselves in the midst of new surroundings, and attach our memories to a home site. We like to think we're the kind of guest we would want in our own home. Respectful and responsible. Just trying to keep things simple and make some memories in the midst of the crush that can be modern life.

name: Large Airy Home in Ideal Jamaica Plain Location
summary: Looking for a sunny, spacious home  for you and your family to vacation with easy access to all of Boston? Here it is. Our spacious 3 bedroom 1 bathroom fully equipped home is situated in a prime location  in Jamaica Plain/Hyde Square.  We are the bottom unit of a two-family home. The entire apartment has been renovated in the last year and retains much of the original detail including crown molding, hardwood floors throughout, and lots of natural light.
space: Our home includes a living room, den, dining room, kitchen, bath, 3 bedrooms, and back deck. You will sleep well in whichever room you choose. The master bedroom has a queen bed. The downstairs bedroom has a full size bed with a pullout twin trundle. The upstairs bedroom has a crib. The living room couch is a pull out with a full size bed. Request in advance if you would like to use a pack-n-play crib or blow up mattress. We  have two children under 3 years old and our home is kid friendly. There is your own washer and dryer in the basement.

neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location. Our home is walking distance to the Orange Line T Station (.4 Miles) with access to all of Boston and walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, bars, shops grocery stores, the beautiful JP Pond, parks, the Southwest Corridor, Franklin Park Zoo, and the Arnold Arboretum.  Grocery Stores The closest big chain grocery story is Wholefoods (.4 miles).  City Feed & Supply on Boylston Street (.1 miles) and City Feed & Supply on Centre Street (.7 miles) are our local grocery stores.   City Feed offers organic groceries, specialty coffees, cafe fare, plus artisanal goods in a cool space.  (Our favorite City Feed sandwiches are the VLT and Farmer’s Lunch.).  Please let us know if you are searching for a particular type of store or restaurant and we will gladly point you in the right direction Libraries Our favorite Boston libraries include Connolly Library (.3 miles), the Jamaica Plain Branch of the Boston Public Library (1.0 miles) and Central Library in Cople

There are a number of bus lines that are walking distance. Access to bike rentals is also walking distance. You can walk distance to cafes, restaurants, bars, and shops. Ride sharing like Uber and Lyft are readily available

name: FAMILY FRIENDLY,  park adjacent, spacious JP home
summary: Beautiful, FAMILY FRIENDLY! park adjacent home in Jamaica Plain's Parkside Neighborhood.  10 min walk to Green Street Orange Line Station or the Brewery Complex.  Be downtown, door to door in 30 mins! City of Boston short term rental reg# STR385754
space: Welcome to our spacious park side home in beautiful and walkable Jamaica Plain.  This is our home that we live in full time and make available when we are out of town.  We have a dog as well as two small children.  There are 4 bedrooms in the house that are available to you, each room has an in-window air conditioner.  Even though we will be out of town, you can reach us by text for advice on all the wonderful spots Boston has to offer.  We live in an amazing walkable and bikable neighborhood, happy to give you suggestions on must-do activities!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of Boston's more lively neighborhoods and you will find that just about everything you need for your stay is within walking distance or a short T ride away.  We live at the top of a hill, and within a 10 min walk you will find small grocery stores, coffee/ cafe, the Sam Adams Brewery tour and many, many parks and playgrounds.  Within 25 min walk from the house are tons of restaurants, Whole Foods, CVS, etc...
notes: Some additional house rules: 1) we don't wear shoes in the house, so bring some house slippers or go barefoot! 4) there is absolutely no smoking or vaping of any kind.  Or lighting any sort of candles.   5) Certain areas of the house are off limits (like the basement apart from laundry), we can talk more in detail when you arrive. 6) we ask that you only eat in the kitchen or on the porch.  Please respect this request.
transit: Parking is never hard to find on our street (the Park Lane side, no parking on Walnut Avenue), and is free.  You also can easily walk or use a bike share bike, or take the train.
access: You have access to the main house, you do not have access to a 2nd floor apartment that is reached by the stairwell off the back entrance.  Please do not bother our renter or knock on the closed door on the 2nd floor landing.   You can use laundry in the basement, but that is the only basement area you can be in.  The basement is reached through the white door off the mudroom.
interaction: We can offer as much or as little suggestions as you like on things to do in Boston.  we are only a phone call/ text away.
house_rules: - no shoes in house - People not associated with booking not allowed on premises  -make sure the doors are locked when you come and go, do not leave doors unlocked.
host_about:
We are a married couple in our mid 30's with a young family that includes a slowing down, but still lively 9 year old Australian Cattle Dog.  The Misses works in transportation planning and managing our little family and the Mr. works with ROBOTS!  We both LOVE LOVE LOVE cities and all the excitement they provide.  In our spare time we do lots of cooking, gardening, crafting and competitive/ recreational bike riding.  

When we stay at AirBNB places we make sure to be great guest!  That is, we are respectful of privacy, are in touch if we are going to be arriving late, etc... and make sure to keep the places where we stay as tidy as when we arrived. 

We look forward to meeting you as either a guest in our home, or a guest in yours!

name: Cozy Room on Cul de Sac
summary: The apartment is cozy, comfortable, fully furished and stylishly decorated. The house is situated at the end of a quiet cul de sac and has a well kept front yard garden and fenced in back yard patio with chairs, fire pit and barbecue.
space: The apartment is on the first floor (up 7 steps to the front porch entrance) and is spacious and comfortably furnished. The room for rent has a new queen size mattress that is firm. Fresh bedding is provided and the room will be clean and the bed will be made up with fresh linens for you. There will be fresh flowers and bottled water on the night stand. I'm a florist for a living so not having flowers would be unforgivable. There is a desk and chair an empty closet with hangers and an empty chest of drawers for your personal belongings. The room overlooks a quiet side yard that is mostly unused. The bathroom is shared (with me). It is small but clean. I do have a dog named Wilma. She's is absolutely quiet and friendly and goes to work with me everyday.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a fun part of town with a great pond, cemetery and the Arnold Arboretum for walks. There are lots of good restaurants, several good coffee shops, thrift stores, yoga studios, and it is also located near "the latin quarter" where you can find nice little mom and pop shops that  provide products from carribean countries  and there is the city's best Cuban Restaurant "El Oriental. There is a Whole Foods and a Stop and Shop in JP as well so if you want to buy groceries, there are options. Cultural amenities: The Museum Of Fine Arts, Isabella Stuart Gardner Museum, Boston Symphony, Beacon Hill, Seaport, Cambridge, Harvard, The Longwood Medical Area,  Bars and clubs are all easily reachable by nearby public transportation options.
notes: I am located on a Cul de Sac and parking is mostly residential from 8:00 and until 6:00pm.  there are two visitor parking spots across the house and available most all the time during the day.  After 6:00pm its ok to park anywhere. there is also free street parking at the end of the street. Please let me know if you need assistance with parking issues .
transit: The Forest Hills T Station is 5 minutes walk from the apartment. Forest Hills is a major hub and you can easily reach almost any part of the Boston area quite easily from there. The Orange Line connects with all other lines and gives you access to the entire city and most of the Boston Metropolitan area. The Orange also integrates with commuter lines and bus lines. There are also multiple "Blue Bike" bike sharing stations in Jamaica Plain and bike paths that bring you easily into all areas of the city and surrounding towns. Needless to say, you'll be well connected to everything.
access: Use the kitchen freely just clean up after yourself...wash your dishes, clean your spills. The kitchen has an easy-use Nespresso coffee machine, the coffee is good, plentiful and free. Use the living room, television, back yard patio, fire pit and barbecue. You might need to buy charcoal and lighter but the area is available and comfortable. Basic civility and decent manners are much appreciated. You can also use the washer and dryer and there is an iron and ironing board. So, if you need to spruce up your wardrobe for a night out, I got you covered.
interaction: I own my own business and work a lot so I am rarely home. I get up and out very early and usually return around 7 in the evening. The dog goes to work with me so you will have the house completely to yourself in the morning.

name: Charming and cozy private bedroom in Artist House
summary: Colorful and fun artist's home with a charming private bedroom and access to your own bathroom in the Jamaica Plain/Egleston Square neighborhood in Boston.  The 1850's era private house is about an 8-10 minute walk to the train station (orange line to Stonybrook), walking distance to great cafes, restaurants and glorious Franklin Park. There is a luscious garden out back with a patio, hammock, grill, flowers, and croquet set! Very accessible to downtown Boston and the various Boston Colleges.
space: Unique, colorful and funky artist's home has bright colors, eclectic designs, and handmade touches. Make a big drawing on the giant chalkboard outside your room! Get some dog therapy and hang out with our sweet pup Ariel.
description: Colorful and fun artist's home with a charming private bedroom and access to your own bathroom in the Jamaica Plain/Egleston Square neighborhood in Boston.  The 1850's era private house is about an 8-10 minute walk to the train station (orange line to Stonybrook), walking distance to great cafes, restaurants and glorious Franklin Park. There is a luscious garden out back with a patio, hammock, grill, flowers, and croquet set! Very accessible to downtown Boston and the various Boston Colleges. Unique, colorful and funky artist's home has bright colors, eclectic designs, and handmade touches. Make a big drawing on the giant chalkboard outside your room! Get some dog therapy and hang out with our sweet pup Ariel. Guests can have minimal kitchen access (microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker or teapot). Also, access to the living room, dining room kitchen area, and back garden. The second and third floors are private. Oh! and we have parking for one car! We are happy to give suggestions on
neighborhood_overview: "JP is home to a diverse group, ranging from young families and professionals to artists and activists. Most folks congregate around Centre Street, the neighborhood’s main thoroughfare and hub of activity. It counts an eclectic mix of independently owned shops and restaurants, from the dairy delicacies at J.P. Licks to the thrifted treasures waiting to be discovered at Boomerangs. If plentiful public parks, hipster haunts, and colorful old Victorians sound up your alley, then JP might be your next move."--from a recent 2018 Boston Magazine article  This is a pretty decent summary. Some people compare it to a mini-Brooklyn vibe, definitely queer-friendly, artist oriented and very green. Lots of biking and great walks all around.
notes: We have a very well-mannered puppy named Ariel (cattle dog mix) who lives with us and will definitely want to greet you. The upstairs part of the house is off limits, but you can hang out and enjoy the 1st floor and there is plenty of space. This is a living breathing artist's house! You can check out our work here: (Website hidden by Airbnb) We are animators, and makers of cut-paper collages, silkscreens, papier mache sculpture and we teach in the area. Please note that the bed is a futon mattress (so firmer than a regular mattress) and currently there is an air conditioner in the window to make you more comfortable in the heat! There is also a ceiling fan, if you would prefer that. The bedroom fits two comfortably, approx. 10' x 12' and the bathroom is small but has a tub and everything else you need--also, it has pink walls! You are welcome to hang in the public spaces if you need to stretch out.  We hope you enjoy your stay!
transit: We are about an 8-10 minute walk to the "T" as Boston folks call it--the Train Station at Stonybrook off the Orange Line. It's about a 20 min. subway ride to the North End, 15 min. to Chinatown. And a 25-30 min. car ride to the airport (you can also do public transport from the airport via train which takes around 45 min. to an hour). We are also very close to the Southwest Bike Corridor--which is a nice way to get around. Also, the house has room for one parking spot on a private lot to the left of the house.
access: Guests can have minimal kitchen access (microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker or teapot). Also, access to the living room, dining room kitchen area, and back garden. The second and third floors are private. Oh! and we have parking for one car!
interaction: We are happy to give suggestions on restaurants, coffee shops, and generally things to do in the Boston area. If it feels nice we can share some wine or coffee in the garden ;)

summary: Room in beautiful apartment in Boston (Jamaica plain), a few steps from Jamaica pond. The apartment has a spacious living room, clean kitchen and bathroom, a fireplace and a porch.
space: The apartment is close to Jamaica pond, and local businesses (Whole foods, Stop& Shop, CVS, 7-11; bars and restaurants are within 5-minute walking distance). Distance to bus stop is 4 minutes walk and to subway is 7-10 minutes.
description: Room in beautiful apartment in Boston (Jamaica plain), a few steps from Jamaica pond. The apartment has a spacious living room, clean kitchen and bathroom, a fireplace and a porch. The apartment is close to Jamaica pond, and local businesses (Whole foods, Stop& Shop, CVS, 7-11; bars and restaurants are within 5-minute walking distance). Distance to bus stop is 4 minutes walk and to subway is 7-10 minutes. Living room, washer/dryer, porch, kitchen and bathroom. I am usually busy with my research but I do like to interact/socialize and I can provide useful tips about local touristic attractions. Jamaica pond, Emerald necklace parks, JP Licks, Whole Foods, bars and restaurants. Free parking. Bus 39 takes you directly to downtown Boston (20-minute ride). There are three subway stops (Stony Brook and Jackson square on the Orange line; and Heath Street on the Green-E line), all within 7-10 minutes walking distance.

name: Bright, luxe, modern 3/2.5 JP townhome + roofdeck!
summary: Bright, modern, spacious townhouse in center of JP, just a short Orange line ride to downtown Boston! 3 bedrooms (2 with beds, 1 set up as office with sofabed), 2 living rooms (1 with queen sleeper), plus giant roof deck with natural gas grill and table for 6+!  Walking distance to wonderful restaurants and cafes, plus the Arboretum, Jamaica Pond, and Corridor Park! Garage parking (+EV charging) for 1 car (or 2 VERY small ones), + free street parking.  New listing of experienced host!
space: Come enjoy our 3-story, 3-bedroom, with-garage townhome - it has plenty of room to enjoy for the whole family or many friends! Our place has cozy, warm, modern furnishings and top of the line finishings, including a marble-tiled master bath with his & hers showerheads in a large glass shower. In the warm months, the roofdeck is a delight; in the winter, there's a huge gas-powered indoor fire place that turns on with the click of a button. Very "smart" home, with Nest thermostats, Hue lights, keypad entry, and an EV (Tesla) charger in the garage.  To give you an idea of the space: The first floor is accessed from the sidewalk or via the attached garage and has a small living room/den with a full TV and stereo sound set up, as well as a queen sofabed. On the second floor, you'll find a large open-plan living area, with a fireplaced living room, dining table for 6 (8 if you squeeze), half bathroom, and bright white kitchen with 3-seater island, stainless appliances, Nespresso or drip coff

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a lovely, vibrant neighborhood within Boston city limits that’s easy to access via the Orange T line, by car, or by lyft/uber/taxi. Lots of cute restaurants and shops, plus some of the most beautiful parks in Massachusetts! Very walkable, or drivable if you prefer. Absolutely spend some time at the Arboretum and the Pond!
notes: Again, can’t stress this enough: this is not a dedicated Airbnb rental - it’s our actual home that we rent when we’re away. So please set your expectations that while we try to make guests as comfortable as possible, it’s not a hotel and we expect guests to respect our space as they would their own. Thanks!
transit: Choose your own adventure. We own a car for my husband’s commute to work, but otherwise we walk, take the T, or I often bike. For visitors looking to explore downtown Boston, it’s probably best to leave your car at the house and take the Orange T line into downtown. Around JP, we’d recommend walking or driving if you’re not feeling up to it or the weather is bad. To other out-of Boston neighborhoods, like Brookline, driving or biking is best.
access: Full use of townhouse, private roof deck, and garage. Some closets will remain locked for private storage. All toiletries out and about in bathrooms are for guest use, but please do not open bathroom cabinets.
interaction: Check in/ out is easy and on your own. We’re available by phone or email to handle any issues or concerns! We rent our place out when we’re on vacation, so we’ll be super responsive but likely won’t be able to meet you in person. Thanks!
house_rules: This is our actual home, not a dedicated rental, so please be as respectful as if you were in your own house! Also we have a mini poodle who’s hypoallergenic/ no-shed, but if you’re terribly allergic to dogs it’s possible you might have trouble.
host_about:
I'm currently a management consultant with experience in the private, non-profit, and public sectors. 

I love to travel, get lost in conversation, and learn about pretty much anything. I'm originally from Austin, TX (78704 is not just a zipcode; it's a way of life!), went to college in NYC, and served as a US Peace Corps Volunteer in Morocco for two years.

"The Happy Market" is a minute walk where produce, groceries, wines, liquors, and even a full deli are easily accessible.
notes: House is 120 years, a bit creaky in places, a few sticky windows. Decor and structure more shabby chic than hotel minimal. Bathroom has skylight and clawfoot tub with shower.  Rooms are attic style with sloped ceilings.  Shower enclosure is sloped and may not be ideal for the very tall. Small room has mini kitchen with fridge/microwave/convection oven and coffee maker (no sink in small room but dishes can be washed in bathroom sink.) The unit is currently accessible by the  Second floor via unlocked door as a fire safety precaution (accessible second egress) yet valuables can be locked in the small room (kitchenette).

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the trendy, hip Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston. Our apartment abuts Franklin Park, is minutes to miles of hiking and biking at the Arboretum, is a short 10 minute walk to Sam Adam's Brewery and is close by to all the trendy restaurants and cafes Jamaica Plain has to offer.
notes: This is also my person apartment so please be as respectful as possible! A family lives upstairs and will keep their eyes on who is coming in and out so please respect our home and house rules.  When booking please tell us about yourselves and what brings you to Boston. Feel free to share social media accounts with us and verify you offline ID by going to www.airbnb.com/verify We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 3PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! A quick note about taxes. Beginning July 1st 2019, the city of Boston will collect city and state taxes on short term rentals. We don't have the exact rate yet but it will likely be about 15% to 17.4
transit: You are in walking distance to the Green Street subway stop off the orange line and local busses. Travel on the orange line and arrive to Back Bay station in 12 minutes. Chinatown, and Downtown in 20 minutes. Go a few extra stops to The Garden to see The Celtics and Bruins play or taste the Italian food in the historic North End.
access: Guests will have full access to the apartment including the kitchen, true dining room with seating for 6, living room and bathroom. The apartment is stocked with essential toiletries and any necessary towels and linens. Iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for use.
interaction: I am always available by telephone in case of emergencies. We are great at giving local directions, suggestions on things to do in the area, and even have given guided tours of the North End, Freedom Trail and more.
house_rules: More information I have put a lot of time and effort into giving you a well furnished home with anything you could need, with this in mind, please respect my space by using the apartment for intending living purposes only and abide to the following:  -Leave the home as you found it -Limit noise at all times; quiet hours begin at 9pm -No guests may enter the apartment unless approved by me first.  -No filming  -Smoking of any kind in the apartment and within 50 feet of the outside is not allowed.  -lighting candles is strictly prohibited -The backyard is for the owners' and their family who live upstairs. They respectfully ask that you do not use the outside space  -No pets
host_about:
Hi my name is Drew; I am a hospitality professional with a passion for eating, cooking, travelling and meeting new people. It brings me great pleasure to host guests in home around Boston through Airbnb. I'm great at showing guests a great and welcoming time while they visit this great City. 

If you're moving to Massachusetts, I'd love to help you find a new home to rent or own. Why not stay in one of our South End Hospitality's Airbnb properties while I show you some options? 

If you'd like to see my other listings please message me and I look forward to you staying with me.

Accessible by subway, bus, greenway bike path.
space: Front door opens to large, bright living room furnished from west elm and RH (including an incredibly sleep-able leather couch). Vintage staircase leads to the large open landing, set up as a play area and home to new washing machine and dryer. Full bathroom with over-sized shower and a separate soaking tub.  2 good sized bedrooms (each w/ queens) and a half bedroom with a crib and changing table (1+ week stays have option to request single bed instead of a crib). The dining room on the 1st floor has french doors that open to a large deck and small, fenced yard.  The kitchen is fully equipped with all the pans, flatware and plates you could want.  Home is extremely comfortable but not at all fancy so you can relax as if you live here. Its offers an authentic Boston experience in one of the most eclectic, celebrated, and accessible neighborhoods in this fine city.  Living space is approximately 1750 square feet. July 2018: Please be advised the exterior of the house is scheduled to be p
description: Warm, welcoming older, single family home on a quiet street in sought after Jamaica Plain (JP) neighborhood of Boston, w/ 2 parking spaces + small fenced yard - everything you need to enjoy all the best Boston has to offer, comfortably. Sunny, open w/ breezy over sized deck on top of a hill.  Walk to great restaurants, wholefoods + stop & shop, and iconic Jamaica Pond.  1.5 miles from Harvard Arboretum, close to Fenway park, hospitals, universities. Accessible by subway, bus, greenway bike path. Front door opens to large, bright living room furnished from west elm and RH (including an incredibly sleep-able leather couch). Vintage staircase leads to the large open landing, set up as a play area and home to new washing machine and dryer. Full bathroom with over-sized shower and a separate soaking tub.  2 good sized bedrooms (each w/ queens) and a half bedroom with a crib and changing table (1+ week stays have option to request single bed instead of a crib). The dining room on the 1st flo
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain (JP) is a wonderfully diverse neighborhood that runs along part of Boston's Emerald Necklace. Full of cafes, restaurants, bakeries, shops, playgrounds and breweries (Sam Adams and Turtle Swamp), JP is a friendly neighborhood home to people of all different backgrounds and ethnicity.  Restaurants offering a multitude of cuisines call JP home, including Italian, Indian, Ethopian, Sushi, Tapas, Dominican and Cuban restaurants. Families with young kids, artists, young professionals, college students, baby boomers, and everyone in between reside in JP, creating a vibrant, engaged community. JPs relaxed vibe gives everyone who lives or visits here the feeling of belonging.  Close to museums, hospitals, fenway park, Boston University, Northeastern, Boston College.  JP is bursting with history. Jamaica Pond which is a 10 minute walk from the house was designed by Fredrick Law Olmstead who designed NYC's central park.   In the 1600s the wealthiest families in Boston kept "country
notes: House is a great hotel alternative for wedding accommodations, college graduations, convention centers, or a casual and convenient home base for adventures in and around Boston. Caregivers of those receiving extended inpatient care at Boston Children's Hospital, Brigham and Womens, Dana Farber and Beth Israel will find this home a welcome change from an overpriced hotel room. House is professionally cleaned before each booking. Clean bed linens and towels are provided. Double stroller, car seat and booster seat for car available upon request at no extra cost.   Bedrooms have window unit ACs. The living room and kitchen have ceiling fans. There are large windows in each room of the house.  Guests with limited mobility please note:  the house is on top of a steep hill. If you have questions or concerns, please contact owners who are happy to provide additional details and don't forget there are 2 parking spots and tons of Lyfts and Ubers. Front entrance has 3 steps get in.
transit: 2 off street parking spaces #41 bus stop is a 3 min walk, #39 bus is a 5 minute walk   Stony Brook train station on the MBTA Orange line is 5 min walk. The orange line is incredibly convenient. It runs through Boston's Symphony and Back Bay neighborhoods and also stops at Tufts Medical Center, Chinatown, Downtown Crossing, Fanuiel Hall (haymarket stop), TD Garden, the north end (north station stop), Charlestown/Bunker Hill and more.  15 - 20 minutes to Boston Logan Airport by car.
access: Guests have full and exclusive use of the home, deck, yard, and parking spots.
interaction: Owners are local and typically meet guests to provide a quick tour, answer questions and offer additional details on the home and neighborhood.  Following that owners are always available by phone/email but respect the privacy of guests.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Mom to 2 kids and an adorable mutt working to help fight hunger by day and wandering through beautiful Jamaica Plain with my hubby in the evening.  Also, finding times to steal a nap as often as I possibly can.

name: In-Law apartment-walking distance to Longwood Area
summary: The in-law apartment is in the basement of our single family home in Jamaica Plain.  Jamaica Plain is a lovely neighborhood in the City of Boston.  Public transportation is close by.  If you like to walk, you can walk to the Longwood Medical Area (20 minutes), Fenway Park, Museum of Fine Arts and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum (40 minutes).  The apartment is perfect for business travelers, tourists and students.  You can come and go through a private entrance and there is parking.
space: The in-law apartment is in the basement of our single family home in Jamaica Plain.  Everything is brand new as we just did the renovation in 2018.  The apartment has a private entrance which is entered through our side yard.  The space is a studio style apartment with a full kitchen fully stocked, a full private bath, and plenty of storage.  The bed is a queen-sized sofa bed that has no bars or springs and is very comfortable.  The room is bright and clean and everything is new.

notes: We think, and according to the reviews of our guests, that our in-law apartment is a perfect Airbnb space.  We would love to accommodate business travelers and since we are so close to the Longwood Medical Area, it is perfect for students.  Jamaica Plain is a wonderful neighborhood.  Whole Foods and CVS are a couple of blocks away and there are several great restaurants walking distance.  When we get home, we rarely use our car to get around -- everything is within walking distance.  We love our home and care for it well.  In the warmer months we have an absolutely beautiful garden that you are welcome to enjoy.

access: The in-law apartment has a private entrance and is fully self-sufficient with a full kitchen and bath (shower only, no tub).
interaction: The in-law apartment is in the basement of our single family home.  We are generally home when guests are here, but you will also be able to come and go without our availability.  We would communicate with you if we won't be here during your stay and provide you with contact information in case you do need anything.
house_rules: - I have 3 cats (that are not allowed in the apartment) so if you are allergic this probably isn't the best choice. - There is a lovely patio and garden right outside of the private entrance.  You are welcome to enjoy the lower patio.
host_about: I am so looking forward to hosting you in my home!  I love being home, but also travel frequently for both business and pleasure.  As a seasoned traveler, I know what I need and love in a lodging.  I will do my best to bring that experience to you.  Adventure travel is my favorite, and I have been to many incredible destinations -- Antarctica, Galapagos Islands, Safaris in Zambia, Botswana and Namibia -- are highlights.  I've worked and lived for 1 year in Lusaka, Zambia.  I also love travelling to US cities to visit family -  Cincinnati, Pittsburgh, Omaha - all great to visit because of the friends and family that live there.  But there is no place like home, and I love coming home every time!

name: Welcoming Eco-Friendly Historic Home #1
summary: Come stay in our 19th Century Italianate style home in Jamaica Plain's historic Sumner Hill neighborhood.  Walk into the first floor hallway and be welcomed by a beautiful oval stair that sweeps you up to the living spaces on the 2nd floor and bedrooms on the 3rd Floor.  Enjoy spectacular light and casual comfort of our home. See separate AirBnB listing if you need an extra bedroom.  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/27261969
space: Our house is a part of Jamaica Plain's history, with distinctive exterior architecture and comfortable interior spaces.  Enjoy the privacy of your 3rd floor bedroom and shared living spaces on the 2nd floor.  There is plenty of room to spread out!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant, diverse neighborhood with easy access to downtown Boston and airport by subway.  Many dining options within walking distance and nearby parks provide the opportunity to experience Boston's famed Emerald Necklace, the series of parks that ring the city core.
notes: The bedroom is comfortable and generously sized with blackout shades on both windows.  The bathroom on 3rd floor is small, with shower.      Our house is a natural home where we only use non-toxic, un-scented, ecologically safe cleaning products and all laundry is air dried in order to reduce fossil fuels consumption. In order to help transition to a low-carbon future we buy wind generated electricity from a local nonprofit. We are happy to offer organic coffee or tea for breakfast.
transit: 5 minute walk to Green Street Station on the Orange Line, 2 minute walk to bus that goes direct to Copley Square. On street parking available  within short walk.
access: Our kitchen is available for light food preparation and food storage for food that guests have brought with them.  Please contact us directly with any questions.
interaction: NA
house_rules: We ask that you leave your shoes on the first floor. Please no eating in the bedrooms.  Guests are welcome to use the tables in the kitchen or dining room.
host_about: Architect, artist and Jamaica Plain resident for the past 30 years.  My wife, Marie-Laure and I have created a beautiful, comfortable home where our 3 children grew up.  We enjoy community based activities, gardening and traveling to visit new places.

name: 2 Private Rooms in Shared, Spacious JP home
summary: We make two guest rooms available in our beautiful, FAMILY FRIENDLY! spacious park adjacent home in Jamaica Plain's Parkside Neighborhood.  Please note that we share our space while we are home.  The house is a 10 min walk to Green Street Orange Line Station or the Brewery Complex.  Be downtown, door to door in 30 mins! City of Boston short term reg# STR385754
space: Welcome to our spacious park side home in beautiful and walkable Jamaica Plain.  Our home/ family is 2 kids under 6 and a lively Australian Cattle Dog, Nico.  Your rooms are located on the third floor, and are both air conditioned. Our home is in an amazing walkable and bikable neighborhood, happy to give you suggestions on must-do activities!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is one of Boston's more lively neighborhoods and you will find that just about everything you need for your stay is within walking distance or a short T ride away.  We live at the top of a hill, and within a 10 min walk you will find small grocery stores, coffee/ cafe, the Sam Adams Brewery tour and many, many parks and playgrounds.  Within 25 min walk from the house are tons of restaurants, Whole Foods, CVS, etc...
notes: Some additional house rules: 1) we don't wear shoes in the house, so bring some house slippers if you like. 2) if you book while we are here, during the week, we are early risers at 6/6:30am to get kids ready for school.  But with your door closed on the 3rd floor, this shouldn't be too much of a disturbance.  The kitchen is on the first floor, so we get dressed and then get down stairs.  At night, please keep noise to a minimum after 8pm when kids are in bed.  3) from roughly 1pm-3pm is nap time, so we ask that you keep noise/ music to a minimum during that time.   4) there is absolutely no smoking or vaping of any kind.  Or lighting any sort of candles.   5) Certain areas of the house are off limits (like the basement apart from laundry), we can talk more in detail when you arrive. 6) we ask that you only eat in the kitchen or on the porch.  Please respect this request.
transit: Parking is never hard to find on our street (the Park Lane side, no parking on Walnut Avenue), and is free.  You also can easily walk or use a bike share bike, or take the train.
access: Apart from your 3rd floor room(s), you have access to the kitchen (around our family's schedule), living room, laundry in the basement (also around our schedule), a private bathroom on the 2nd floor and the spacious, front porch/ patio/ yard.
interaction: We can offer as much or as little suggestions as you like on things to do in Boston.  This is your time and we are happy to share our home with you, but we also respect that you might like some time to decompress.  And during the week, with small kids, we are up early and out of the house getting kids to school, then in the evenings we are focused on getting kids dinner and in bed.
house_rules: - no shoes in house - People not associated with booking not allowed on premises  -make sure the doors are locked when you come and go, do not leave doors unlocked.
host_about:
We are a married couple in our mid 30's with a young family that includes a slowing down, but still lively 9 year old Australian Cattle Dog.  The Misses works in transportation planning and managing our little family and the Mr. works with ROBOTS!  We both LOVE LOVE LOVE cities and all the excitement they provide.  In our spare time we do lots of cooking, gardening, crafting and competitive/ recreational bike riding.  

When we stay at AirBNB places we make sure to be great guest!  That is, we are respectful of privacy, are in touch if we are going to be arriving late, etc... and make sure to keep the places where we stay as tidy as when we arrived. 

We look forward to meeting you as either a guest in our home, or a guest in yours!

name: Sun filled private room in spacious Boston home.
summary: We are located in Boston's Vibrant and eclectic Jamaica Plain Neighborhood. Our home is within walking distance of Jamaica Pond and JP's acclaimed Centre Street shops and restaurants. We are a short 7 - 10 minute walk to the Orange Line Stony book T stop or the Green Line E train Heath St. stop. The house is located on the 39 bus route which is an extension on the Green Line T to Forest Hills. We are in the heart of JP and all it has to offer but a quick 15 minute train ride to downtown Boston.
space: The bedroom is located in a large 2 Family home occupying the entire 2nd floor. The bedroom also features 2 doors that give you easy access to the bathroom and hallway to enter and exit without passing through the residence.

neighborhood_overview: We are right in the heart of Jamaica Plain!! Jamaica Plain (JP) as we locals call it is one of Boston's most fun and outgoing neighborhoods. JP in recent years has become wildly popular because of it's arts, culture, sense of community and amazing green spaces such as Jamaica Pond, Franklin Park and the Arnold Arboretum. JP is also well know for its dining and entertainment scene. Local favorites include the Sam Adams Brewery and the new Turtle Swamp Brewery. Hit up Bella Luna and the Milky Way cafe to dance the night away and have some great food and drinks. If you like a quieter atmosphere check out The Heaven or the Brendan Behan pub. Catch a Thursday night movie on the lawn at the Loring Greenough house or relax by Jamaica Pond. Whatever your pace enjoy your stay in JP.
notes: NA
transit: Orange Line Stony Brook T stop 7 minute walk  39 Bus - stops out front in both directions  Green Line E Train - 10 minute walk  On Street - Non-permitted parking STREET CLEANING: *** Street cleaning EVERY Monday from 8 am - 12 pm on our side of S. Huntington *** Street cleaning EVERY Wednesday from 8 am - 12 pm on the opposite side of S. Huntington *** Street Cleaning EVERY (see signs for details) Wednesday on Halifax street from 12  pm - 4 pm.  Let us know if you have any questions! They do ticket and tow so just be vigilant and all will be OK!!
access: Guests have limited access to the kitchen for light meal preparation and basic food storage. Cooking is permitted with our permission, please check with us first and be sure to clean up after yourself.  There is a huge range of options for dining out in Jamaica Plain, please feel free to ask us anytime for suggestions. Bathroom is shared with us, it is the only bathroom in the residence so please be respectful. Thee bathroom is fully stocked with Plenty of bath towels and toiletries should you have forgotten something at home.
interaction: We also live here and work in and around JP. We are avid sailors so often on Boston Harbor. However, if you do not see us please feel free to contact us we are very responsive and friendly but also respect your space.
house_rules: All guests should do their dishes and clean up after themselves.  Kitchen use is only permitted to heat food or store a few things in the refrigerator. Major meal preparation is not permitted. There are a number of restaurants in the area that we are happy to recommend.  Coffee, tea and continental breakfast is provided for guests. Guests are welcome to make their own coffee or tea.  Pets require prior approval from Host!  Muddy shoes/ boots should be removed before entering the house.

summary: Enjoy a beautiful contemporary residence with picturesque park views near Fenway Park. Upscale amenities throughout include, fully equipped kitchens, open floor plans, oversized windows, spacious walk-in closets, as well as a  pool, fitness center, and clubhouse for your entertainment.

summary: Enjoy a beautiful contemporary residence with picturesque park views near Fenway Park. Upscale amenities throughout include, fully equipped kitchens, open floor plans, oversized windows, spacious walk-in closets, as well as a  pool, fitness center, and clubhouse for your entertainment.
space: 1 Bed, 1 Bath, Sleeps 3 Experience Luxury living in the heart of Boston in these premium residences that will provide you with an uplifting lifestyle and comfortable stay. name: Charming JP Apartment
summary: Our charming apartment has everything you need! In the heart of Jamaica Plain, our apartment is surrounded by the Emerald Necklace, Arnold Arboretum, Franklin Park and Jamaica Pond. It is the perfect place if you want to visit, shop, dine, and explore Boston. Easy access to the orange line which takes you directly to downtown Boston. You will not find another apartment of this quality at this price in Boston.
space: - Complete kitchen set-up with beautiful island  - HD TV w/ cable including Netflix and other features in living room and master bedroom  - Large porch with table and chairs perfect for catching beautiful sunsets  - Washer and Dryer in unit

host_about:
Hi Fellow Travelers!
 
I am Joanna, a current candidate in a Master’s program in Sustainable International Development at Brandeis! As a student in an international program, I truly value traveling in addition to music and other hobbies involving exploring the world. I believe Airbnb is a great platform for anyone who wants to travel and enjoys visiting different places and cultures! 
 
I've lived in Spain, grew up in North Carolina, and now consider myself a Bostonian. My home in South Boston is very comfortable and right next the beach where I enjoy jogging in the mornings! I would like to share my place while I'm Airbnbing since I believe my home will bring happiness and a true Boston experience :) 
 
When I'm not traveling or studying, I enjoy nonfiction books such as "A New Earth Awakening" By Eckhart Tolle or simply relaxing at the beach near Castle Island. 
 
As a host, I will do my best to provide you with a very comfortable stay in my home and provide with the very best tips for visiting Boston. As a guest, I will respect your home and truly appreciate the space given to me.

name: Boston condo located in an urban oasis
summary: Private room in a spacious 2-BR apartment in a great location!  Short walk to 4 different metro lines and the #39 bus.  Only 20 min. by bus to Back Bay Boston; 10 min. to Longwood Medical Area Hospitals, Harvard Med. School, & Harvard School of Public Health.  Located cross the street from the beautiful Emerald Necklace park and Jamaica Pond. Your host is a fellow traveller, adventurer, & foodie!
space: Spacious 2BR apartment in a great location: close to Longwood Medical Area, 20 min to Back Bay and downtown Boston.  Multiple public transportation options that will take you to anywhere in the city.  A beautiful and safe neighborhood to walk around in; Emerald Necklace park is right across the street! This is a shared apartment space.  By reserving this private room, you are NOT reserving the entire apartment.  Expect clean towels, ironing board and iron, usual toiletries, WIFI internet, fresh linens, etc.
description: Private room in a spacious 2-BR apartment in a great location!  Short walk to 4 different metro lines and the #39 bus.  Only 20 min. by bus to Back Bay Boston; 10 min. to Longwood Medical Area Hospitals, Harvard Med. School, & Harvard School of Public Health.  Located cross the street from the beautiful Emerald Necklace park and Jamaica Pond. Your host is a fellow traveller, adventurer, & foodie! Spacious 2BR apartment in a great location: close to Longwood Medical Area, 20 min to Back Bay and downtown Boston.  Multiple public transportation options that will take you to anywhere in the city.  A beautiful and safe neighborhood to walk around in; Emerald Necklace park is right across the street! This is a shared apartment space.  By reserving this private room, you are NOT reserving the entire apartment.  Expect clean towels, ironing board and iron, usual toiletries, WIFI internet, fresh linens, etc. You will have access to your private room (of course) as well as all amenities and area
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is an awesome eclectic/artsy and diverse neighborhood.  Not only is it close to the city center, but it also has wonderful green space all around (Emerald Necklace, Jamaica Pond, and Arnold Arboretum).  Feel free to walk around and explore the neighborhood!
notes: NA
transit: #39 bus (to/from Back Bay Station) is 1 block away on the corner of Bynner St. & S. Huntington Ave.  The MBTA Green E-Line is <10min walk away.  Green D-Line and Orange Line are 15min walk away.  Parking is easy and free on nearby streets.  Uber & Lyft are readily available. Please feel free to contact me and ask questions about anything you wish. I am always open to helping newcomers to the area get familiar with the surroundings!
access: You will have access to your private room (of course) as well as all amenities and areas such as bathroom, kitchen, dining room, living room.  The other bedroom is off-limits, obviously.  You also have access to coin-operated laundry in the basement. You'll be able to use the stove, dishwasher, and refrigerator as you so desire!  You are also welcome to use any dishes, silverware, cups, cooking pots, etc.  Just please clean up after yourself! For groceries, there is a natural food supermarket (Whole Foods) a few blocks away. For long-term residents, please discard your garbage and recyclables in the appropriate big bins in the basement (black bins for trash, blue bins for recyclables).
interaction: Up to you!  If you'd like, I will be glad to show you around (especially where to eat!) and hang out!
house_rules: Please be respectable, try to keep the place clean (no wearing shoes in the house, please!), and no parties. No smoking!  I only ask that you treat my home as you would treat your own! When leaving the apartment, please always lock both locks on the door. Please shut off all lights, air conditioner, TV, etc. before you leave. Please take your shoes off inside the apartment.
host_about: Hey there!  I'm an avid traveller and an adventure seeker.  I have a 2-bedroom condo in Boston that I'm renting out w/ AirBnB as well as using AirBnB in my various travels.  I enjoy meeting and talking to fellow travelers, hosts, and whomever I come across during my adventures!

summary: Enjoy a beautiful contemporary residence with picturesque park views near Fenway Park. Upscale amenities throughout include, fully equipped kitchens, open floor plans, oversized windows, spacious walk-in closets, as well as a  pool, fitness center, and clubhouse for your entertainment.
space: Experience Luxury living in the heart of Boston in these premium residences that will provide you with an uplifting lifestyle and comfortable stay. With a contemporary design throughout, this high-rise has cutting-edge finishes and amenities throughout including: remarkable views of Olmstead Park, private courtyard with stunning landscaping, and an elevated amenity deck with swimming pool, fireplace & BBQ grills. This spectacular location is home to many major attractions.

name: Charming Boston Townhouse
summary: Amy and Thomas have been living in Boston for over five years now, but they both love to travel and do so often. They take pride in their comfortable home and are happy to share it with you!
space: Perfect for families and friends looking to explore Boston and surrounding areas. Our home was built in Dec. 2015 with an open layout and a modern yet homey feel. Every room has large windows with lots of light coming in throughout the day. Our place is situated in a residential, quiet neighborhood, but only a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus to the T (train), where you can take a 15-20 minute train ride to downtown Boston. It's also a five minute car ride from the beautiful Harvard Arnold Arboretum and about ten minutes from Jamaica pond.  Kitchen: fridge/freezer, dishwasher, microwave, oven, toaster, Nespresso machine, blender, cooking and eating utensils, etc. Three upstairs bedrooms: one with a king bed and attached bathroom, one with a queen bed, and one with a double bed set up (pullout couch).  Bathrooms: one half bath downstairs, two full baths upstairs.  Outdoor space: gas fire place outside with couch and chairs, and a bistro table.  Parking: one parking space available within

notes: No kids, no pets
transit: Train, bus, uber, car
access: Orange line (T)
interaction: Very responsive via the Airbnb app and by phone. We are also never too far away in case of an emergency.
house_rules: We expect that you will be respectful of our neighbors and keep quiet when outside, especially at night. We have a shared yard, and although there is a 6' fence separating our yard from our neighbors, we do not want any noise complaints given that they have an infant. Follow the instructions provided on the app in terms of cleaning, we do not charge a cleaning fee upfront, however we will charge a fee of $50-$100 if the instructions/rules are not followed. We expect to find our place in the same conditions we left it with you. It is our primary home and we hope you’ll treat our place the same way you do with yours.

name: ★Hidden Gem 6BR w/3.5BA★ Close to Transportation
summary: Welcome to our home in Boston’s Jamaica Plain!  Jamaica Plain is one of Boston’s newest trend setting areas! Known for its mom and pop shops and fantastic restaurants. Our home is newly renovated with access to local transportation, a grocery store and a Dunkin Donuts around the corner for that TRUE Boston experience! A perfect place for your large group or Family, bring them all! Our home has on-site parking and an in-unit washer/dryer included! Enjoy your stay! ♥Miya
space: We are so excited to host you and your group! Our newly renovated home offers all you will need for the perfect Boston stay. The first-floor plays host to multiple bedrooms, that are all spacious and provide an abundance of room for rest.  On our Second floor, is where you will find our open-air kitchen, living and dining room.  All beautifully renovated and perfect to host the dinner parties of your dreams, fully equip with cooking essentials, pots, pans, utensils, and dishware! This floor also contains the perfect master suit, to retreat to and refresh after your adventures around the city.  Some Extra Features: Wifi, Netflix(no cable) , central A/C & heating, fresh towels, in-unit washer & dryer, 2 car drive way and free street parking! We are located 5 minutes from public transportation that will take you downtown into historic Boston. Locally you will find coffee shops, restaurants and a grocery plaza just down the street.  3 Miles from Fenway Park and 4 miles to Downtown. Boston

name: Bright and Cozy Private Bedroom in Jamaica Plain
summary: Private bedroom available in my cozy and bright home in Jamaica Plain!  My two bedroom condo is located on a quiet street in JP.  It's walking distance to public transportation (both bus and subway), to awesome local shops and restaurants, to Jamaica Pond, to Franklin Park and even to great breweries.  My house is a comfortable place to read a book, to cook a meal or to use as a home base while you are exploring Boston.
space: I live on the second floor of a three story building.  My condo has two bedrooms, a brand new bathroom, a great kitchen in which to cook and a spacious living room that's designed for relaxing.  There is A/C in the living room and in the bedrooms, WiFi and laundry in the basement.
description: Private bedroom available in my cozy and bright home in Jamaica Plain!  My two bedroom condo is located on a quiet street in JP.  It's walking distance to public transportation (both bus and subway), to awesome local shops and restaurants, to Jamaica Pond, to Franklin Park and even to great breweries.  My house is a comfortable place to read a book, to cook a meal or to use as a home base while you are exploring Boston. I live on the second floor of a three story building.  My condo has two bedrooms, a brand new bathroom, a great kitchen in which to cook and a spacious living room that's designed for relaxing.  There is A/C in the living room and in the bedrooms, WiFi and laundry in the basement. You will be able to use every room except for my bedroom.  You can also use either of my two decks!  The front deck is a great place to have morning coffee or to watch the sun set. I want to make sure you feel welcome and have the space to enjoy your visit to Boston.  I am very willing to help

notes: -There will always be cereal, oatmeal, coffee and tea for breakfast. -Check in and out time is super flexible- just let me know your travel plans in advance and we can make something work! -There is street parking if you are driving- you don't need any special sticker or permit

interaction: I want to make sure you feel welcome and have the space to enjoy your visit to Boston.  I am very willing to help answer questions (via text or call) and provide recommendations to some of my favorite places in the city.  Depending on my schedule, we may cross paths often or we may hardly see each other at all!  I am a social person who loves both cooking and craft beer, so feel free to join in for a meal and a drink... or go out and enjoy Boston!

name: Boston's Best Neighborhood: JP Private Room & Bath
summary: Private bed and bath in Boston's coolest neighborhoods, JP.  Easy access to the 39 Bus route, the Green “E” Line (Heath St) or Orange Line (Stonybrook) MBTA make this location a great launch point to all of Boston’s colleges, Longwood Medical area, shopping, business and other Boston tourist destinations. Nearby find Whole Foods, great restaurants, CVS and more within a 5 minute walk.  Quiet JP street one block off of Emerald Necklace trails and ponds.  Hosted by David and Lisa.
space: Off-street entrance on your own floor through mudroom to a private room with full bathroom.  Central air and heat. neighborhood_overview: Directly across from the Arnold Arboretum is a living museum of plants, and the growing season offers the perfect time to explore its meaning and diversity. From opportunities to learn about important topics in classes and lectures to informal gatherings in the landscape.  Just a 2 blocks away many people enjoy walking or running on the 1.5 mile path around the pond. Street parking can be found on Perkins Street , on the pond's west side.  A natural "kettle" depression formed by glacial action, the pond itself covers about 68-acres, and has an average depth of 25 feet; it is 53 feet deep near the center. Fishing is allowed with a Massachusetts fishing license. The pond is stocked each year by the Massachusetts Division of Fisheries and Wildlife .  Sailboats, rowboats, and kayaks can be rented at the Jamaica Pond Boat House, which is administered by the Courageous Sailing Center .  Also near by is Franklin Park, about 2 miles away  it is a  527-acre (2.13 km2) parkland in the Jamaica Pl
notes: This is NOT a child proof house. Please no children
transit: Steps to the bus line #38.  You can walk (about 10 minutes) or take the bus to the orange line Forest Hills. This is the first stop so you will always get a seat and runs about every 6 minutes.

name: Leafy & Tranquil, Artist house. Easy access Boston
summary: Call it home! (Minimum stay is flexible; please message me.) Enjoy this spacious two-bedroom apartment on a tranquil side street of Jamaica Plain. Apartment is furnished and has full kitchen. Two blocks to the Southwest Corridor where you'll find bike and running trails and the T transit. Discover the charms of Jamaica Plain: its locally-owned businesses, small breweries, cute coffee shops, art studios, and lots of nice outdoor space for recreation and relaxation.
space: Apartment has many original turn-of-the-century details, but is fully updated. Three zone central AC keeps you in control of your comfort. Granite countertops in kitchen and bath, hardwood floors. Laundry is available for your personal use, free of charge.
