Home to many artists as well as professionals in the medical and academic fields, Jamaica Plain is a community-oriented neighborhood of Boston with an exceptional amount of green space so close to the heart of the ci
neighborhood_overview: Home to many artists as well as professionals in the medical and academic fields, Jamaica Plain is a community-oriented neighborhood of Boston with an exceptional amount of green space so close to the heart of the city. We support local small businesses, we look out for each other, and we are proud to be JP!  Here's a summary of what you can walk to: 2 blocks to Southwest Corridor Park with bike and running trails <5 minutes walk to Sam Adams brewery complex (Ula Café, Bella Luna restaurant, Mike's Gym) 5 minutes walk to Exodus Bagels, Evergreen Eatery (excellent vegan and omnivore breakfast and lunch) 10 minutes walk to central JP: post office, JP Licks ice cream, FOMU, many wonderful restaurants 10 minutes walk to Forest Hills restaurants (Brassica, Dogwood Café, two Indian restaurants) 10 minutes walk to Franklin Park, Boston's largest park, designed by Olmsted in 1875, contiguous to the Emerald Necklace which includes Jamaica Pond, Forest Hills Cemetery and the Arnold Arboretum 2 b
notes: I am a professional musician, and you may hear sounds of music. Ask me in advance if you have any concerns about this!  And I can tell you where to hear good music in Boston :)
transit: 5 minutes walk to the T (rapid transit into Boston, direct to Back Bay Station, connection to Cambridge) Frequent buses on Washington St and Centre St Parking on the street is free
access: Back yard and deck are shared with host and other guests.
interaction: NA
house_rules: No overnight guests permitted unless you have explicitly cleared them with host. Exceeding the number of registered guests in your reservation may result in forfeiting your security deposit.  In the interest of a clean and hygienic home, we are shoe-free indoors. Thank you for your cooperation. No suitcases may be placed on beds or other furniture. Luggage racks are provided for your convenience. For the sake of safety, no candles or incense are to be burned in the home. Do not double-lock the back doors to the house (use bottom locks only!). You may double lock the front door.
host_about: I live in Boston and sometimes live in New York City and Rio de Janeiro. I'm originally from England. I am a professional musician and I teach at Berklee College of Music. I love Brazilian music, nature, food (I'm a vegetarian), reading, bicycling and swimming.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain "JP" is a funky neighborhood with a lot of locally owned restaurants and shops.  There are a lot of artists, coffee houses, tasty restaurants, gourmet bagels, tacquerias and fancy iced cream. The Jamaica Pond is a beautiful place for a walk or to go sailing.  The Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University has an internationally known collection of plants form all over the world.  It is part of the "Emerald Necklace."
notes: There is a lockbox at the rear door for your convenience. The front door is only to be used if there is an emergency. *** Recently MA passed a new law requiring occupancy taxes be paid to the city and state on top of the rental amount.  You will be required to pay this tax on top of your rental.  The amount is 17%.  At this time, Airbnb has not yet set up the process to collect these taxes through it's system. You can either pay this amount through Airbnb as a special request payment or you can pay it by check upon your arrival.  Please confirm which method of payment you prefer.  Thank you, Anne
transit: There are buses that run along Washington Street and the Orange Green Street Train line is nearby.
access: Private guest entrance is at the rear of the property. They will have access to all of the apartment except the front bedroom.  Guests have exclusive use of the rest of the apartment and they are welcome to use the yard.  Parking is available for $50 extra.
interaction: I'm available as needed.  I run a sculpture school nearby.
house_rules: NA
host_about: I manage a number of furnished units around Boston and Brookline with my business partner Joseph Morrissey.  I am a Realtor with Unlimited Sotheby's  and do sales/rentals in the greater Boston market.  I also manage a sculpture school/studio with my husband, sculptor Morris Norvin.  Stonybrook Fine Arts, is located in the Boston neighborhood Jamaica Plain across the street from the famous Sam Adams Brewery.  We offer a variety of one day workshops on our calendar including welding, jewelry and metal casting.   Longer classes are available and meet one time each week including the options above as well as mold making, live figure modeling and foundry.  Custom workshops are available for small groups, birthday parties, bachelorette parties, make your own wedding bands, create an engagement ring and team building.  We are happy to arrange a tour of Sam Adams after a daytime workshop not occurring on Sunday.  Contact us for more details to set up your custom event!

name: JPApt in Victorian home w/Japanese inspired garden
summary: Emerald Necklace Arboretum-side JP Victorian/3rd floor apt w/ Japanese garden & soaking tub. Quiet, cozy & relaxing. 742 sq ft w/ large living-dining room, full kitchen, bath and bedroom. Steps from the Arnold Arboretum, 2 blocks to the Forest Hills MBTA/Commuter Rail Station. 1 mile to Jamaica Pond & 0.6 miles to Jamaica Plain's Centre Street business & restaurant district.
space: Spacious yet Cozy - High on a Hill Open living room/dining space extends the full 35 ft 3rd floor width.  Dining table seats 4 for meals you may prepare in the fully equipped separate kitchen.  The arm chair in the front facing dormer is a perfect reading spot looking out over the tree tops. Your viewing pleasure includes a 49" HD TV w/ VerizonFIOS cable access. FireTV includes access to Netflix, AmazonPrime and HBO or use the DVD to watch one of the more than 200 movies we have stocked in your video library. Relax in the extra long Victorian claw foot bath or shower. Catch up on your email: set up your lap top at the antique Governor Winthrop desk.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain Features: Locals call Jamaica Plain “JP.” The historic streetcar suburb, settled in 1630, has become one of Boston’s most dynamic & desirable neighborhoods. Greenery, walking & biking paths in abundance. Frederick Olmsted's Emerald Necklace park system is over seven miles long from end to end. Four of its seven parks are within JP and are noted below. Jamaica Pond is the largest body of fresh water in Boston with seasonal rowing, sailing and fishing and a beautiful year round 1.5 mile walking path. You might extend your walk to Olmsted Park & Leverett Pond, a fine example of Olmsted’s skill combining landscape, water, and structure into his designs. Islands were created to provide both visual interest and waterfowl breeding area. At the Arnold Arboretum, view over 3800 different types of trees and plants in their living collection spread over 281 acres. Enjoy the zoo at Franklin Park or play a round of golf at the William J. Devine Golf Course where the youth Bobby Jones
notes: Smoking permitted only outdoors/backyard - 4/20 friendly.  If you are visiting with a young child, we can provide a baby gate for the kitchen stairway.
transit: Public Transportation: The MBTA Forest Hills Station is just at the bottom of the hill. Orange Line trains are available every 4 - 15 minutes & only take 15 minutes to reach Boston's Backbay. 16 bus lines also originate here. Parking: we have one driveway spot available for our guests at the rear of the home. Most parking here is resident sticker only. Ample free parking in the front of the house except for 2 days seasonal street cleaning each month - note the signs. Proximity: In Boston you are never far from higher education. Boston College, BU, Northeastern, Berklee College of Music, New England Conservatory and Simmons are all quite near our JP location; as are world class hospitals: Brigham & Womens, Childrens, Faulkner and Beth Israel.
access: Guests have use of the apartment on the entire 3rd floor. There is a day bed in the living room. Coordinate w/ hosts for use of laundry, grill, backyard lounging/dining or to use the teak Japanese soaking tub set within JP's only residence bamboo grove.
interaction: The apartment is on the 3rd floor of our Victorian home. We live on the 1st & 2nd floors so are likely available if needed by our guests. We are glad to interact socially or not, whatever your choice may be. We have lived in the area for 30+ years and can offer many activity or food suggestions anytime.
house_rules: No Candles Quiet Hours: Our quiet time is between the hours of 11PM and 7am - per Boston Municipal Code. Smoking/Drug Policy: There is no smoking allowed within the confines of the home nor near doorways or open windows. You may smoke in the backyard or outside on the sidewalk. Within the backyard we are 4/20 friendly. Your Guests & Social Gatherings: Overnight accommodation is only for you the Airbnb guest(s) – only those approved in advance through the booking process. We are perfectly happy having up to 4 people visit you in the apartment. For larger gatherings, we'd be happy to recommend other places to spend time with your family and friends.  Parties of any kind are not allowed in the apartment.

name: Beautiful 2 bdr apartment in Jamaica Plain
summary: My place is a cozy 2bd apt in JP. 5min from Green Street MBTA station/Orange Line and 25min from Downtown/Chinatown. Everything you'd want to do is within walking distance, plenty of restaurants and places like the Sam Adams Brewery, Ula Cafe, the Southwest Corridor, Franklin Park Golf Course, Arnold Arboretum. You might like to walk around Jamaica Pond. Forest Hills cemetery isn't too far away as well. It’s one of the early "garden" type cemeteries and has interesting monuments. Come and enjoy!

name: Bed, Bath and Beyond in Jamaica Plain
summary: PLEASE NOTE:  ALL REVIEWS SINCE JULY (WHEN I MOVED HERE) APPLY TO THIS ROOM. An urban oasis in hip JP!  A bright and graceful room on a quiet residential street in a beautiful neighborhood near many parks and green spaces, cafes and restaurants. Conveniently located just a 5 minute walk to the Forest Hills T stop, and 20 minute train ride downtown; 10 minute commute to the animal hospital and 20 minutes to the Longwood medical area.  A free parking space is available next to the house.
space: You'll sleep on a queen sized bed with a luxuriously thick and firm mattress. All linens are provided. Laundry facilities are in the apartment. Three infinitely charming cats may be available for cuddling. :-) PLEASE NOTE:  If you wish to book the room for any period after January 1st, 2019, I would very much appreciate if you would first contact me rather than making a reservation via "Instant Book."  This feature does not allow hosts any discretion in deactivating it for particular dates  and, as a school teacher, I have holidays when I might be away and could therefore not host.   In particular, PLEASE DO NOT RESERVE THE ROOM FOR THE MARATHON 2019 without first checking with me.  With many thanks for your consideration!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a culturally diverse neighborhood within Boston located in the ring of the "Emerald Necklace."  Rich in parks and ponds, there is also a wealth of cafes and restaurants from which to choose.  Hip and friendly, green and safe, with charming tree-shaded streets and 100-300 year old homes, and easy access to downtown, it's one of Boston's most popular places to live and visit, bike and run.
notes: Breakfast foods are provided -- tea/coffee, yogurt, cereal, nuts and fruit. I'm a passionate vegetarian cook, so I may happily and spontaneously offer you something to eat, or share dinner with you, or you may ask for a meal for an additional modest fee. I have a substantial library of guidebooks to Boston and the surrounding area, so no need to schlep yours along. I don't specify a check-in/check-out time, as travelers' needs vary; I always try my best to accommodate their wishes.   "Check-in time" is when your room will be ready for you, but you are welcome to arrive early or late as you need to; you can always just collect your key, leave your belongings, and enjoy the city until your room is prepared for you. "Check-out time" gives me the chance to prepare the room for the next guest.  It doesn't matter when you leave the apartment, but does matter when you leave your room -- please respect the time I ask, as I respect your desire to leave your luggage in the apartment so that you
transit: The Forest Hills metro station is a five minute walk away. There's a free parking space next to the house. A bike is available for you to use!
access: You're very welcome to use the kitchen for cooking; while it's smaller than many American kitchens, it is very well stocked and I'm happy to share it together with spices, oils, vinegar, etc The front deck is a lovely space for reading and watching the neighborhood's dogs pass below.
interaction: I'll be very glad to help when and where I can --  to offer advice, make a cuppa tea, chat about one thing or another, to shepherd you to one place or another; at the same time, I am very respectful of people's privacy.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
Welcome!

I moved to Boston nine years ago after having lived for more than 30 years in three different countries on as many continents.  I have a passion for travelling  and, since my migration to Boston, have so enjoyed the experience of hosting other travelers through Airbnb (in addition to a non-paying website.)  I love that people from vastly different corners of the world and its multiple paths  arrive on my doorstep; I also love being of service, and sharing my resources (including my cats. :-)

I'm an educator, artist, (vegetarian) cook, polyglot, nature-lover, film aficionado, social-justice activist, and mother to three enchanting fur-people.  I try my modest best to live with care, consciousness and compassion.  My nest is my castle and, whether you're here on holiday, or for a work gig,  I would hope that it's a kind of "home away from home" for you.

"Check-in time" is when your room will be ready for you, but you are welcome to arrive early or late as you need to; you can always just collect your key, leave
transit: The Forest Hills metro station is a five minute walk away. There's a free parking space next to the house. A bike is available for you to use!
access: You're very welcome to use the kitchen for cooking; while it's smaller than many American kitchens, it is very well stocked and I'm happy to share it together with spices, oils, vinegar, etc The front deck is a lovely space for reading and watching the neighborhood's dogs pass below.
interaction: I'll be very glad to help when and where I can --  to offer advice, make a cuppa tea, chat about one thing or another, to shepherd you to one place or another; at the same time, I am very respectful of people's privacy.
house_rules: - Please show consideration of neighbors and other residents of the apartment by speaking and moving about quietly between 10:00 PM-8:00 AM. - Please remove shoes at the front door -- you can keep them in the foyer or your room. - In consideration of the environment and other residents, please limit bathroom time to ten minutes in the early mornings and evenings.  (Your thoughtful use of hot water is also appreciated, as it is heated by oil and thus expensive.)
host_about:
Welcome!

I moved to Boston nine years ago after having lived for more than 30 years in three different countries on as many continents.  I have a passion for travelling  and, since my migration to Boston, have so enjoyed the experience of hosting other travelers through Airbnb (in addition to a non-paying website.)  I love that people from vastly different corners of the world and its multiple paths  arrive on my doorstep; I also love being of service, and sharing my resources (including my cats. :-)

I'm an educator, artist, (vegetarian) cook, polyglot, nature-lover, film aficionado, social-justice activist, and mother to three enchanting fur-people.  I try my modest best to live with care, consciousness and compassion.  My nest is my castle and, whether you're here on holiday, or for a work gig,  I would hope that it's a kind of "home away from home" for you.

We know that you will enjoy our central location and our warm family. Our guests will have a private bedroom with an additional sofa bed in the living room and a full private bath. neighborhood_overview: We have great restaurants and local shops. We are very close to the Jamaica Plain Pond and the Arnold Arboretum. We encourage our guests to get to know our amazing neighborhood. We are close to the Longwood medical area and have hosted a number of international medical students as well as families of patients getting care.
notes: Ray speaks Mandarin and Cantonese. Sometimes our sixteen year old may help some guests check in when we are unavailable. Zara our is year old is always looking for a playmate and is very willing to share her toys.
transit: We are a short 15 minute walk from either Green Street Station or Forest Hill Station. Shopping at Back Bay Station about another 12 minute ride from Green Street station at rush hour and about 20 minutes during off hours. The walk to the Green Street Station is mostly residential and quiet. When carrying luggage you will likely want to take an Uber.
access: In addition to a modern kitchen, guest have access to a shared washer and drawer. In addition there is a fire pit and grill in the garden in the rear of the house. Enjoy a glass of wine by the fire or grill and enjoy our furnished deck.
interaction: We are a married gay couple with three kids. They are 20, 16, & 6. We enjoy traveling and getting to know people and their cultures from around the world. We have hosted many students over the years who were studying in Boston and started hosting with Airbnb in July of 2016. We traveled to Hong Kong and Taipei in April and stayed at two great Airbnbs. Last winter we traveled to Tulum and found a very cool Airbnb in the jungle. We just returned from spending Thanksgiving in Sao Paulo.  We are also hoping to take a trip this summer to Italy to visit friends.
house_rules: - The apartment is located within our private residence. We enjoy getting to know our guests and ensuring that they are comfortable.

name: Comfy room 15-min from Downtown Boston
summary: Comfy room in quiet neighborhood, 2.8 miles/4.5 km from downtown Boston
space: Perfect accommodations if you're traveling for work or to sightsee around Boston.  Room on first floor of 1915 two-family house. 3-4 steps to entrance.  See below for details about the great accessibility to downtown Boston! Must be dog lovers!!!! Small dogs, 10 pounds, will be on premises! They are extremely friendly and affectionate, but they will want your attention, so people with animal allergies or who don't want to pet pups should not book!  Check in/out is flexible! Come and go ANYTIME! The dogs are very pet-friendly (dogs & cats), so you are welcome to bring a pet if we discuss it in advance and it is approved. A $20 cleaning fee will be assessed for 4-legged guests. (This listing has no cleaning fee) Dunkin Donuts, Stop N Shop grocery store/pharmacy, Whole Foods, and several restaurants are in walking distance. Works great as a crash pad if you’re out and about in Boston, but if you want to spend time at the house, you’ll have use of a full kitchen, front porch, Netflix, etc.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a popular and sought-after neighborhood of Boston. The peaceful parks and paths of the Emerald Necklace are a 15min walk away, and glistening Jamaica Pond (with a wonderful 1.7 mile loop for walking or jogging) is just under a 20min walk. There are many playgrounds in walking distance (5min or less!) if you are traveling with children. Dunkin Donuts, Stop N Shop grocery store/pharmacy, Whole Foods, a nail salon, a library, and several restaurants are in walking distance. If you do bring a pet, you are welcome to employ my dogwalker or use Tails JP or Fancy Schmancy doggie daycares nearby. Downtown JP or JP Centre is a 5min drive, 20-25min walk, or short bus ride away, with cute shops for a bit of walking around and shopping and many phenomenal restaurants.
notes: NA
transit: Free street parking, MBTA bus & train accessible  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  90- Walker's Paradise  76- Excellent Transit 84- Very Bikeable - Free street parking right outside the home - 8 minute walk to Jackson Sq on MBTA orange line (Bus access to 41, 39, plus all buses leaving Jackson) - 11 minute walk to Heath St on MBTA green line - 10 minute Lyft/Uber to most of downtown on evenings/weekend; 20-30 minutes in rush hour depending on location. - FROM LOGAN AIRPORT: 20 minute drive/Lyft/Uber or 45 minutes on public transit. I can provide you a CharlieCard, which will reduce your public transit rides by $1 per round trip!
access: You'll have your own room (which can sleep 1-3), which is right next to a shared bathroom (which is rarely used, we’ve had no issue with bathroom waits!).   - Full kitchen, coffeemaker, kettle (coffee & tea provided); access to all cookware, utensils, spices, etc. - Comfortable dining space (table & chairs) in kitchen or living room - Free washer/dryer in basement - Fenced-in backyard with back patio, or enjoy the front porch - Living room with 7-foot billiards or ping-pong table (Let me know in advance if you prefer one or the other!) - Fridge, pantry, and closet space available for short or long-term storage
interaction: The dogs are almost always on site, so it’s likely you'll have to say hello and goodbye to them. I'm around intermittently and will only chat if you want too. I do sometimes come home late (11pm-12am) and the dogs bark when I walk in. It’s been no problem for guest so far, but if you’re an extremely light sleeper it might not be the best fit.
house_rules: - There are 3 small dogs on premises, so guests with allergies should not book. The dogs will never enter your room, but it would be difficult to never interact with them!  - Pets welcome but **we must discuss first** to make sure their personalities are compatible.  - Kids are welcome (unless they are afraid of dogs!). The room works well for two adults traveling with 1 child. If other accommodations are needed we should plan in advance.  - Vaping allowed indoors, smoking allowed outdoors only—on porch and in backyard. - As it says in next section, there is potential for noise—barking from my or neighbors dogs. None of my guests have mentioned it’s an issue, but if you have misophonia or something then maybe it’s not the best fit haha.
host_about:
I love food, dogs, nature & yoga. I love Airbnb- couldn't travel without it!! When I travel I like to only have 1-2 things in mind and mostly plan the trip as I go. 

I'm new to hosting but love helping people get to see Boston without spending too much money!!

name: Private room/bath in Jamaica Plain near HMS
summary: Charming yet spacious, luxurious yet affordable.
space: The room: At 10x14 this is no tiny bedroom! Set in the back of the apartment, you’re shielded from sounds of the street and have direct views to the ivy covered stone walls and lush foliage in the backyard. The mattress is Beautyrest, the sheets are premium, the WiFi is fast, and there’s plenty of room in the closet.  The apartment: The 2 bed, 2 bath apartment is (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) sq ft which is huge by city standards. The bathroom is all yours and is stocked with anything you might forget to pack! The kitchen is a joy to cook in with tons of counter space, every gadget you could ask for, and abundance of coffee and tea options. The living room has a 65” HDMI TV with Hulu and Netflix at your disposal and there’s (Hidden by Airbnb) Mini’s throughout the house ready to play any music you want on demand or set an alarm or tell you the weather forecast!  The location: It really is a dream location, I’m so happy living here! The Orange (Jackson Square) and Green (Heath Street)

neighborhood_overview: JP is such a special and vibrant part of the city, I feel really lucky to live here. There’s a ton of great food and drinks (happy to recommend), as well as yoga studios, farmers markets, community centers, art studios, parks, bike paths, and yes, of course “The Pond”! It’s a super diverse, chill, charming, and safe corner of Boston committed to keeping things local and top quality.
notes: NA
transit: Free parking on Centre Street right out front. The 39 bus stop is out front as well. Blue Bike dock is right at my doorstep! The Orange and Green line are each a ten minute walk away.  If you’re driving, it’s about 10 minutes to HMS/Longwood, and 25 minutes to Cambridge/Harvard.
access: The back bedroom and main bathroom are all yours! Make yourself at home in the kitchen and living room as well.
interaction: I live here and work in Cambridge so it’s likely I’ll be home in my room some evenings but I’m also often out or gone overnight so it depends! But in general I like to give guests their physical space while being super available by phone/text/email!
house_rules: NA
host_about:
PhD student in Education at Harvard (researching how to better support the well-being of K-12 public school teachers). 

Currently in the process of getting divorced and trying to hold down my beloved apartment while I finish school. 

I look forward to sharing my home and everything Jamaica Plain has to offer with you!

name: Classic Bostonian Arboretum Condo
summary: Charming 2 level,  5 room- 2 bedroom -1 bath condominium with private entry in a two family  in the Forest Hills/Arboretum neighborhood of Jamaica Plain.... steps to a major public transportation hub in Boston (Forest Hills MBTA station Orange line)  and right next door to Harvard's Arnold Arboretum which is a wonderful place to explore and take your morning run/walk.
space: This 2 bedroom condo has a private entrance so you can come and go easily.  Located in a prime location of Jamaica Plain for public transportation and access to the Arboretum.  You'll feel at home in this renovated home.  First floor:  has foyer, adjoining living room and dining room, an eat-in-kitchen which has everything you need, the first floor bedroom and a classic renovated tiled bath, 2nd floor stairs between bedroom and bath and lead to the 2nd bedroom. The living room has a smart t.v. you are welcome to watch Netflix or Hulu, no use of the wood stove is permitted. There are plenty of games on the shelves and books to read.
description: Charming 2 level,  5 room- 2 bedroom -1 bath condominium with private entry in a two family  in the Forest Hills/Arboretum neighborhood of Jamaica Plain.... steps to a major public transportation hub in Boston (Forest Hills MBTA station Orange line)  and right next door to Harvard's Arnold Arboretum which is a wonderful place to explore and take your morning run/walk. This 2 bedroom condo has a private entrance so you can come and go easily.  Located in a prime location of Jamaica Plain for public transportation and access to the Arboretum.  You'll feel at home in this renovated home.  First floor:  has foyer, adjoining living room and dining room, an eat-in-kitchen which has everything you need, the first floor bedroom and a classic renovated tiled bath, 2nd floor stairs between bedroom and bath and lead to the 2nd bedroom. The living room has a smart t.v. you are welcome to watch Netflix or Hulu, no use of the wood stove is permitted. There are plenty of games on the shelves and book
neighborhood_overview: Located on the Arboretum side of Forest Hills Station the end of the Orange line of the MBTA. You can be in downtown Boston in 20 minutes.  On the other side of the station you will find several restaurants that we enjoy:  Tiki Masala, Dogwood and Brasica (which has a cafe durning the day). We are 1/2 mile from the Monument neighborhood of  Jamaica Plain.  The Arboretum has access 1 block from our condo.
notes: we have 1 car parking if needed - please let us know.
transit: major hub MBTA is right next door, there is a cab stand as well - very easy to get here and be in downtown Boston in 20 minutes or less.  Cafes restaurants and parks surround you. step out the door, take a left and then a right and go a block and enter the Arboretum through the Blackwell footpath (be careful crossing the road from that portion into the main part of the Arboretum) - near the beech trees and the bubbling brook of Busey Brook.
access: you have the place to yourself. We do close off the basement and one of our bedrooms as well as a few closets. The rest is for you to use:  living room has a smart t.v. with Netflix available and Hulu,  please don't use wood stove.
interaction: We are reachable by cell phone with text or email.
house_rules: - please take shoes off at the door
host_about: We are rooted in community and love to travel and land in the heart of the places we visit. Airbnb creates an opportunity to live in real places surrounded by real people. We have stayed in Airbnbs from a stone built apartment near the cathedral in Old Quebec City to a converted garage in Memphis, Tennessee. We love hiking, walking and sightseeing... dancing, hearing music, and exploring local art. we Love walking around cities and getting to know the local hangouts.  We Appreciate good clean style that is warm and inviting.  We appreciate green design and environmentally sustainable systems. As guests we are very respectful of things and treat the world and people the way We would want to be treated. As hosts we want you to find respite in your surroundings while you get to know Boston.

name: Comfortable and Convenient 1 Bed Apartment in JP
summary: Come enjoy the best of what Jamaica Plain offers. This cute comfortable apartment has everything you need to enjoy the bean! The apartment is located right off of Washington street with access to a bus stop outside the apartment. A short walk is the Forrest Hills station on the orange line which can take you just about anywhere. Within a mile are plenty of restaurants and bars that JP locals frequent that don't disappoint. Not sure what to do? Reach out to me and I'll give a few suggestions.

notes: Forrest Hills Orange Line is 5 minute walk from apartment.

name: Jamaica Plain Spacious 3 Room Apartment w/prvtbath
summary: First floor Apartment in a house built in 1869 to house the brewers in what is now Sam Adam's Brewery.  The brewery is about a five minute walk from the house. I have provided some  snacks and beverages in the kitchen. The kitchen is fully stocked with spices ,dishes,pots,pans etc. The private bath is a shower no bathtub...the heat is forced air. The     a/c is in window unit... the entry is a coded smartlock...there is no yard or garden unfortunately but the place is roomy at least...
space: Amazing location in Jamaica Plain - 2 min walk to orange line (Stony Brook), it is very convenient to downtown ,Longwood Medical Area,Fenway Park,Grocer seconds from door. House built in 1869. Super sweet neighborhood in Boston. Whole Foods, Stop and Shop, Restaurants, (Cuban,Cambodian, Italian ,Indian, Americana minutes away! Chinatown, The North End, Museums and every entertainment Boston has to offer a short subway train ride away!

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is located basically in the center of Boston.  The Orange Subway Line runs through it. Also the Purple Line Commuter Rail . The hilly  streets are lined with large multi-family houses. Conveniently there are a few grocers nearby . Whole Foods 8 min walk ,Stop and Shop  15 walk, City Feed and Supply 1  min walk.     The area is loaded with restaurants, grocers,bakeries, places to work out,parks,theaters,liquor stores and friendly people .  You would feel safe walking the streets around here for sure
notes: Airbnb is currently working in getting the address to this listing fixed. The house is a duplex. Hence the 9-11 adress. The listing is for 11 Dresden Street
transit: On foot , bike,skate ,hover board,subway,bus commuter line...The Orange subway line is 1 min from the front door. The station there is Stony Brook ...There are bus stops minutes from the house as well
access: Guest have access to the apartment on the first floor which has a private bath
interaction: I'm available to give directions or make suggestions and am easily reached as I live upstairs in the house...
house_rules: Basically leave it like you found it. If you use the kitchen ,clean up after yourselves. Do the dishes please ,thank you. Take trash and recycling out to provided recepticles . NO loud noise between 10pm to 10am. Be sure to completely shut the front door of the house upon leaving. Do not go upstairs . The agreement is only for the first floor  apartment.
host_about:
Life has been and continues to be an interesting endeavor. Growing up in South Florida and having lived in Düsseldorf,Germany,Rabat,Morocco,Mystic Connecticut, Minneapolis,Minnesota,Portland,Oregon,Sacramento,California,New York, New York,Boston,Massachusetts among other places I have noticed a few things. Persuing a career in music brought me to the Northeast. I really enjoy the cultural offerings a place like Boston has to offer. The intellectual community surrounding the colleges. The artists, musicians,museums,concert halls,night clubs,etc have a way of making me want to stick around here. Not to mention the medical community ,hospitals ,researching (Website hidden by Airbnb) a beautiful place to live too. So close to the Ski areas. I love snowboarding myself. Business wise it's not lacking either. I have always had a travel bug and can appreciate it in others my recent trips were Chiapas, Mexico and Yerevan, Armeni (Website hidden by Airbnb) As a host I like to be sure the place meets high   standards  of cleanliness. This is my home but I hardly ever cook here ...You should  Expect some modicum of privacy from me  in the kitchen in other words.Boston has been good to me and if I had a life motto it would be " What kind of idiot freezes Ted William's head anyway?";p
 As a guest I'm low impact. I'll leave the place like it was when I  found it...I don't mind being sociable on the way in or out...

neighborhood_overview: Luxurious and stylish, this newly renovated apartment centrally located in cool Jamaica Plain is minutes from downtown Boston. Easy access to the bustle of the busy city but on a tree lined street. There is ample street parking on our street and the T (subway) is an 8 minute walk away.  City buses pick up on the corner. Jamaica Plain (JP)  itself has a lot to offer with a Whole Foods five minutes walk and many cafes and restaurants in walking distance.
notes: ! Lost keys ! The house has a sophisticated ‘total security’ lock & key system that requires a custom cut key by our professional locksmith. If a key is not returned to the lockbox, cutting a new replacement key requires a special locksmith service that can exceed $100.  Simply remember to return your key to the lockbox upon departure. Thanks so much.  WHAT IS INCLUDED IN THE ‘CLEANING FEE’ AND WHAT IS NOT?  A small point of clarity regarding the ‘cleaning’ service. The term should be ‘turnover services’ that focuses on hospitality services such as professionally laundered linens & towels and replenishing necessities such as toilet paper, soaps & shampoos very quickly, 7 days a week, in the short period in between guests. While the professional team also provides bathroom cleaning and fresh  ‘surface wipe down’ services, the team does not pick up ‘ unreasonable trash & debris’  and does not wash dishes. Prior to leaving, guests are fully expected to clean all dishes, pots & pans and ru
transit: Free street parking for your car. Right on the orange subway line,  the house is closest to the  'Stony Brook' station and is an 8 minute walk. City buses pick up on the corner, 2 blocks away. The  #39 bus takes you to the Harvard Medical School’s Longwood hospitals that are about 2 miles away. Or it’s a quick LYFT or UBER ride of 10 minutes. Many places of interest are in walking distance.
access: NA
interaction: If our paths cross, terrific, otherwise, we'll leave you to your privacy. I live in the building & love saying hello if I see you. Especially in the warm weather I’m often sitting in the garden. My co-hosts Drew and Liesl will be your main contacts. They are always available through the Airbnb message thread and by cell phone for emergencies. They are great at giving local directions and suggestions on things to do in the area as well as answering any questions about the apartment.

host_about: I'm a pragmatic creative I'd say.  I am both a recognized artist as well as an entrepreneur with an MBA from Duke.  In addition to managing a beautifully restored victorian apartment house , I have a promotional products business.  I love to travel to interesting places that are either beautiful and relaxing and / or steeped in  a rich mosaic of history.

name: Gem of the Emerald Necklace
summary: Peaceful, inspiring two bedroom condo in an elegant renovated historical mansion on Franklin Park.   3/4 acre woodland wild-flower garden/arboretum with two ponds and riots of birds in back yard; a private arboretum.  Two bedrooms, two bathrooms two working fireplaces, two story atrium, hugh open area that includes spacious kitchen, dining room, living room and photography studio that can accommodate 60 people.
space: NA
description: Peaceful, inspiring two bedroom condo in an elegant renovated historical mansion on Franklin Park.   3/4 acre woodland wild-flower garden/arboretum with two ponds and riots of birds in back yard; a private arboretum.  Two bedrooms, two bathrooms two working fireplaces, two story atrium, hugh open area that includes spacious kitchen, dining room, living room and photography studio that can accommodate 60 people. The entire space would be yours. I'll be away. The place would be all yours. I'm available via (Hidden by Airbnb) or FaceTime  whenever needed. You are 20 minutes t-ride from downtown boston but would be living in a country setting. My garden was designed by award winning landscape architect Thomas Benjamin. Franklin Park is just across the street. It is known as the gem of Olmstead's "emerald necklace." You can see how compelling the location is on (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps. You can use my bike. Green street stop on the orange subway line is a ten minute walk. You must rent it fo

notes: You must rent it for a minimum of 3 months.

host_about: I'm a retired photographer, still an economic justice and environmental activist. Was a wilderness mountain climber. Now I'm an ocean cruising adventurer. Practicing Buddhist, believe personal growth and transformation never stops.

name: Doggone Adorable Digs!
summary: Doggone adorable bedroom in a newly renovated condo, just steps from the Green Street T stop in beautiful Jamaica Plain! Great for solo travelers or couples-- just fifteen minutes from downtown, yet hidden in a quiet tree-filled cul-de-sac. Free off-street parking provided. Shared bathroom with friendly, respectful hosts. We're hoping to make your stay as comfortable as possible!
space: The bedroom has a full size bed, nightstand, and desk.  There is air conditioning in summer and our "dollhouse" condo is so cozy and warm in winter.  There is a full bathroom down the hall shared with hosts. BRAND NEW living room and kitchen are common areas that are shared.
description: Doggone adorable bedroom in a newly renovated condo, just steps from the Green Street T stop in beautiful Jamaica Plain! Great for solo travelers or couples-- just fifteen minutes from downtown, yet hidden in a quiet tree-filled cul-de-sac. Free off-street parking provided. Shared bathroom with friendly, respectful hosts. We're hoping to make your stay as comfortable as possible! The bedroom has a full size bed, nightstand, and desk.  There is air conditioning in summer and our "dollhouse" condo is so cozy and warm in winter.  There is a full bathroom down the hall shared with hosts. BRAND NEW living room and kitchen are common areas that are shared. Please use the AirBnb app to communicate with us. Jamaica Plain is the most special neighborhood in Boston (unbiased opinion :D) The room is located Parkside-- a wonderful neighborhood with cafes, restos, shops, and even a splash park, all within a five minute walk from Boston's largest park-- Franklin Park, home of multiple hiking trails,
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is the most special neighborhood in Boston (unbiased opinion :D) The room is located Parkside-- a wonderful neighborhood with cafes, restos, shops, and even a splash park, all within a five minute walk from Boston's largest park-- Franklin Park, home of multiple hiking trails, zoo, and public golf course!
notes: NA

name: JP Waffle House with Bed & Breakfast in Kitchen
summary: Looking to fill in the master bedroom with kind guests that communicate  and can leave me a great 5 star ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ review if you love the experience here in Boston. The Airbnb master bedroom is sunny ☀️ and full of light. I always give all my Airbnb guests all 5 st⭐️rs no matter. Jamaica Plain of Boston has many restaurants  and pubs . Turtle Swamp Brewery is a 15 second walk since I live behind it and many tourists drink there. The Orange  line train  is the most fastest train above all colors.
space: guests can use the kitchen.  It’s a very new kitchen that has a counter top to eat or have drinks.  When using the stove. Turn on the air vent to vent out the smell of the food you are heating up or cooking please.  Guests can use the treadmill as long as you are only using running sneakers. (No boots, barefoot or sandals)  The living room which I call the lounge is for all Airbnb guests to hangout as well as watch tv on YouTube, Hulu and the tv has a built in internet app to explore for more information or watch free movies from different sources.   The guests may use the deck area to enjoy themselves sunlight, book reading, music playing but cannot smoke on the deck. You can drink on it.  Guests who are driving or renting a car may park on the driveway.  Please please do not eat greasy takeout food on the white comforter king size bed, no junk food and no drinks. It stains very easy if you are not careful.   Smoking outside only on the driveway pavement please and thank you!  I have

neighborhood_overview: I have photos of the areas and if I cannot upload them on here. I will send you the recent photos I’ve taken on May 13, 2019 and email them to you that I suggest you try
notes: Don’t be shy and hangout in the lounge if you see me. You don’t have to stay in you’re room only. I also do not mind finding a movie that is already out in the theaters for a month and you want to see it on  tv . I can use my keywords to find it on the internet 89% chance it’s free to watch or if you need a ride to buy groceries or you want to play music. Just be open
transit: You can take an Uber ride from Boston Logan airport to my address or take the free blue line airport shuttle bus to the train station blue line to State Street. Get off and switch over to the Orange line subway train platform inbound to Forest Hills. Once on the orange line to Forest Hills, get off Green Street and call me once you are there so I can assist you.
access: Living room area, kitchen, treadmill, deck area, refrigerator, bathrooms, driveway
interaction: I am laid off from work due to an injury so most of my time I rest, go to therapy. Eat vegan and go to the gym daily. On Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays I can bring a VIP guest to the gym. I workout for 2 hours only so if you were interested in going to the gym for free on those days. You can come with me and you can do whatever exercise you want and I will do mine.
house_rules: On rainy days. Please take off sneakers or shoes and carry them with you to your room No smoking on deck or stairs Smoking on pavement only outside  If you smoke. Bring your own ashtray for the window seal  Wash any dishes you use after you eat or before you eat  Do not toss any paper, cue tips or toilet paper in toilet  If you use the washer and dryer. Use your own soap You may use the stove or oven when I am in the house. Just ask me each time you want to cook food
host_about: my life's work is to develop greater consciousness, exploring the depths of my being and expanding out with the bright light of my highest self. i'm grounded in practices that help me to do this work, and am engaged in a lifelong journey of becoming a dynamic healer. cultivating present moment awareness is priceless, and the benefits are numerous and far-reaching.  i'm kind, generous, patient, loving, resourceful, resilient, grateful, intelligent and playful, amongst many other things...  these days i am a good steward of my mind and body, with a longing and promise to fill my soul's deepest wishes and desires. i call in the abundance that fuels this uncommon life, wishing for more people to know their inherent worth and follow their true path.

name: Bright & Spacious - Quick Walk to Metro
summary: This is a red-brick townhouse on a quiet street in the popular Jamaica Plain neighborhood just south of Mission Hill. The building is just off of Centre street, and conveniently located only a short walk from the Jackson Square T (metro) stop on the Orange line. Downtown Boston is a 10 minute train ride away. NOTE: This unit is professionally managed by Bedly, a furnished housing provider. Bedding, pillows, towels, & toiletries are NOT provided, so please plan accordingly.
space: This room is a part of Bedly, a furnished housing community. This space is professionally managed and the Bedly customer support team is available 7 days a week from 9am to 9pm. You will receive full contact information when your reservation is accepted. This is a co-living space and other Bedly residents currently live in other rooms in this unit. -Free Cleaning (2x Monthly) -Utilities Included -High-Speed WiFi -Customer Support Team All Bedly guests must complete and clear a background check online (free of charge) after their reservation is accepted. We will also collect your contact information so that we can keep you updated about important information regarding your Bedly living space.

name: 2 Cozy Private Bedroom Close Downtown Boston
summary: -Our guest house is located just 10 minutes from downtown Boston and the main tourist centers.  -We are only 3 min walk from the train station, the Green Line E, only 6 stops to Fenway Park. The Orange Jackson Square line is 5 minutes away, and at 7 stops you get Downtown crossing.  -Our Guest house has a great location, Many restaurants, grocery stores, bars just 2 min to 5 min walk.  -Street Parking Available. parking rental available upon request, within the property
space: Our Guest House has a Great Location, Stop and shop is located 2 minutes (Grocery & pharmacy store).  Many restaurants (Chinese Food, Pizzeria, Fast Food, Latin restaurant & american restaurants) are 2 A 4 min walking. Many of them offer delivery. Close Harvard Medical, Dental & Public Health schools, and 5min further to MassArt, the Fenway and the Museum of Fine Arts.  - 3.8 Miles to Downtown Boston  - 1.7 Miles to Fenway Park - 1.4 miles to Northeastern University - 1.7 Miles to Boston University - 1 Miles Harvard Medical  - 1 Miles Museum Art - 4 Miles Museum science - 2.4 Miles Copley Place - 4.3 Boston Convention and Exhibition Center

notes: Our checking is easy! SelfCheckin Our property has a smart lock, which allows the guest to check in at any time after 3 pm. Security: Likewise We can assure you that our property is safe. we have surveillance cameras in common areas in the property (corridors & Principal Door).
transit: -ARRIVAL FROM THE BOSTON LOGAN AIRPORT:  1.You need to take the Shutle that will take you to the Airport station (Blue Line) is Free.  *We recommend buying the 7-day Pass for Unlimited Use Train and Buses the costs $ 21.25. 2.You have to take the blue line train to Government Center (4 stops). 3. Change from the orange line to the green line "E" This train will take you to our property (15 stops) until you reach Heath Street Station.  4.You will walk 3 blocks and you will arrive to our House Guest.  -ARRIVAL BUS TERMINAL SOUTH STATION 1. Take the Red line in the direction of Park Street (2 stops). 2. Change from the Red Line to the Green "E" (14 stops) until you reach Heath Street Station. 4.You will walk 3 blocks and you will arrive to our House Guest
access: -Our guests have access to the two Shared bathrooms that are on the property (Second floor and third floor). -Our Guests have access to the Internet 24 hours a day
interaction: - For any concerns or questions Our Guests can contact us through the Airbnb platform or by call. -We also work with a safe taxi service. only at the request of the guest

name: Cozy Three Bedroom Apartment in Jamaica Plain
summary: Welcome to this cozy Three bedroom apartment in Jamaica Plain (Parking available 20 minutes walking away) The apartment is located 5-10 minutes walking to Jamacia pond and in the heart of Jamaica Plain walking distance from restaurants/shops/grocery stores on Centre St. The apartment just got furnished and is located on the second floor.  Please don't hesitate to contact us
space: The Apartment is on the second floor. The apartment is newly furnished and can host up to 6 guests. Important:  *** If you're not verified on Airbnb or have no reviews, we might ask for an identification upon arrival. ** * Pets are welcome for an additional fee and depending on the pet. Please message us first. If you make a reservation between Sept 21st and October 5th, please agree to the following:  *AC in the big bedroom will be little loud and might not be replaced in this period  * Fridge is working fine I'm planning to replace it so it might not be replaced in this period * Kitchen cabinets drawers are not in the best condition and I'm planning on renovating them so they might not be renovated in this Period.  If you make a reservation between October 15th and NOV 15th, please agree to the following:  * I'm planning on renovating the entire kitchen but it might not be renovated in this period of time so the reservation price will be cheaper in this period   NOTE: No construction

name: Beautiful Private Quarters on Centre and Green St.
summary: Come stay in your own bright and spacious private quarters within our classic, Jamaica Plain victorian home! (Private entrance and bathroom, too!) We're right on bustling Centre and Green Streets, but tucked away in a quiet, lush green alcove, with plenty of parking. Minutes from a bus stop, T station ("Green Street" stop on the Orange Line) Perfect for visitors or working professionals.  Accommodates up to 4 guests, but ideal for 2 people.
space: The private quarters is on our *2nd floor and consists of 1 living room area, 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom.  *This room is not wheel-chair accessible. PRIVATE LIVING ROOM The living room area is all yours and has: - TV linked to cable and Netflix - Microwave - Mini-fridge/freezer - Drip coffee-maker - Brita water filter (can be filled from potable bathroom sink water) - 4 mugs - 4 plates - 4 sets of utensils - Paper towels - Tea - Coffee - Sofa, which pulls out into a queen-sized bed. PRIVATE BATHROOM: The bathroom is also all yours and is stocked with: - Bath towels - Hand towels - Shampoos/conditioners - Soap - Lotion - First Aid Kit - Toilet Paper - Wet wipes - Disposable amenties (i.e., razors) PRIVATE BEDROOM: The bedroom is, of course, private and has: - Queen-size bed, sheets, duvet, and pillows - Dresser - Double-door closet - Book Shelf - Floor pillows - Electric massage chair (which is such a blessing after a long day of travel or work) SHARED HALLWAY: The hallway is a shared common

We're right on bustling Centre and Green Streets, but tucked away in a quiet, lush green alcove, with plenty of parking. Minutes from a bus stop, T station ("Green Street" stop on the Orange Line) Perfect for visitors or working professionals.  Accommodates up to 4 guests, but ideal for 2 people. PRIVATE LIVING ROOM The living room area is all yours and has: - TV linked to cable and Netflix - Microwave - Mini-fridge/freezer - Drip coffee-maker - Brita water filter (can be filled from potable bathroom sink water) - 4 mugs - 4 plates - 4 sets of utensils - Paper towels - Tea - Coffee - Sofa, which pulls out into a queen-sized bed. PRIVATE BATHROOM: The bathroom is also all yours and is stocked with: -
neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain is a vibrant neighborhood with coffee shops, restaurants, Dominican groceries, yoga studios, fitness centers, art galleries, etc. We're a 5-minute walk to Jamaica Pond, and 15 minute walk to Arnold Arboretum. GROCERY STORES: - City Feed mini organic grocery -- 2 min. walk - Whole Foods -- 12 min. walk - Happy Market -- 12 min. walk - Dominican Bodegas -- 15 min. walk - Stop & Shop -- 20 min. walk RESTAURANTS & BARS: - Little Dipper (diner food) -- 2 min. walk - Chilacates (tacos) -- 2 min. walk - Cafe Beirut (Lebanese) -- 2 min. walk - Galway House Pub (pub food) -- 5 min. walk - Soup Shack (Pan-asian soups) -- 7 min. walk - Tres Gatos (Upscale tapas) -- 10 min. walk - The Haven (Scottish pub food) -- 12 min walk - Brendan Beehan's Pub (pub food) -- 12 min. walk
notes: We have a dog named Blue. He's an 11 y/o Springer Spaniel. Very docile and obedient. A little hard of hearing. The door between the private quarters and our section is locked, and Blue will not enter your area.
transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: - 39 Bus (to Back Bay) -- 1 min. walk - Orange Line subway (Green St stop) -- 8 min. walk LANDMARKS: - 15 min. bus ride to Longwood Area (Harvard Medical School, Dana Farber, Brigham & Women's, Beth Israel) - 20 min. subway ride/bus ride to Back Bay and downtown Boston (Christian Science Center, Newbury St., The Pru)  - 40 min. subway ride to Cambridge (MIT and Harvard)
access: You'll have access to the deck, a mini living room (private for you), a private bathroom, and a private bedroom. You can have access to washer/dryer upon request only.
interaction: Safia is the mother of the family, and will be available during the day for questions and to help with any of your needs, and perhaps a bit of socialization, although she does work from home. During the evenings, we like our private family time, but will, of course, be available should you need anything or have any questions.  On occasion, we may invite you to join us downstairs for dinner.
house_rules: Quiet time from 10pm - 8am. Please try and leave shoes at the deck door (inside). We observe a shoes-off approach to the house.
host_about:
I'm a Pakistani girl who grew up in the U.S., bred in West Philly, and had been living in Italy for five years, now living in Boston.

I lived in rural Piedmont for 4.5 years and studied at The University of Gastronomic Sciences in Bra developing social and community projects with Slow Food related to food anthropology, and working as a line cook. I now live and work in Milan.

I speak English, Italian, and basic Urdu and basic Spanish.

I really enjoy staying with new people and hosting new people in my own home.

As a guest in peoples' homes, I tend to stick by a couple rules: 
1) Leave everything as I found it, or neater.
2) Be-friend my host. 
3) Leave a small thank you.

As a host to potential guests, I hope to encounter the same gestures in people.

name: Cozy Room - Quick Walk to Metro
summary: This is a red-brick townhouse on a quiet street in the popular Jamaica Plain neighborhood just south of Mission Hill. The building is just off of Centre street, and conveniently located only a short walk from the Jackson square T (metro) stop on the Orange line. Downtown Boston is a 10 minute train ride away. NOTE: This unit is professionally managed by Bedly, a furnished housing provider. Bedding, pillows, towels, & toiletries are NOT provided, so please plan accordingly.
space: This room is a part of Bedly, a furnished housing community. This space is professionally managed and the Bedly customer support team is available 7 days a week from 9am to 9pm. You will receive full contact information when your reservation is accepted. This is a co-living space and other Bedly residents currently live in other rooms in this unit. -Free Cleaning (2x Monthly) -Utilities Included -High-Speed WiFi -Customer Support Team All Bedly guests must complete and clear a background check online (free of charge) after their reservation is accepted. We will also collect your contact information so that we can keep you updated about important information regarding your Bedly living space.

name: Printing Press Loft
summary: Your stay is in a unique eclectic home – the former  Fandel Press, a local letterpress printing company founded in 1922. We bought the building in 2001 to create a unique loft-style home. Located within easy walking access to all Jamaica Plain has to offer and is a short subway ride to Chinatown, downtown Boston, or Cambridge.  The bedroom has a queen-size bed, bureau, bookcase filled with fun stuff, 100's of movies from all over the world in many languages. Watch films in the living room.
space: The 4k smart TV has a DVD player attached.  FIOS internet access and many premium channels, Amazon Prime, YouTube and Netflix (etc.) are all available. The table makes a great desk to get some work done. There’s also a Full-size futon bed that’s great for sitting or sleeping. The kitchenette includes a Keurig coffee maker, tea kettle, microwave, toaster oven and a small fridge.  But if you have the urge to cook a full meal, you’re welcome to use our kitchen with a little notice so we don’t bump into each other. There’s also a washer dryer available upon request.

neighborhood_overview: There’s a lot of great food, some very beautiful places to walk, and depending on the weekend, some very fun neighborhood activities.
notes: NA
transit: We're minutes from the subway: .5 miles to Forest Hills T stop – a 9-10 minute walk. .4 miles to Green Street T stop – a 9-10 minute walk Pretty good neighborhood market is a very easy walk right up the street, and JP center is only a quarter mile walk.
access: Guests have a private 2-step entrance to their 1st floor space. We'll send you the lock box code upon booking. Feel free to park in the driveway. There's a connecting door to the main part of our house which is almost always unlocked.
interaction: I'm as available as you need. If you prefer privacy it's yours. I'd enjoy sharing my knowledge of Boston's history and JP over coffee or other beverage in our yard.

name: Entire 2BR apt, free parking, close to city center
summary: Our place is a 3 rd floor condo with gorgeous angular walls, hardwood floors and lots of light. Each room has it's own unique characters and culminates in an eclectic,  living space.  Jamaica Plain is only a train ride away from Downtown Boston with a quick 8 min walk to the orange line. Close to the Longwood medical area,  so it is perfect for those needing access to Harvard Medical. 3 -5 minute walk to grocery and convenience stores. 8-10 min walk to Jamaica Pond and 12 min walk to the center.
space: Very accessible to both public transportation since the bus to Copley Square is only 5 min walk away.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is really great because it is close to the city and in walking distance to Jamaica Pond, The Greenway, Arnold Arboretum and The ForestHills Cemetery which area all worth losing yourself in, on any given day. Multiple coffee shops in the center, fun stores, yoga studios, dance studios, thrift shops, and a mix of unique stores and restaurants to explore and experience.
notes: NA
transit: Public Transportation is easily accessible, but if you are driving it is just as convenient, with both on-street parking and one parking space available for you to use. Lots of places to walk to because the neighborhood is very well rounded, and also affords bike paths and bikes for rent if that is something you would be interested in.

name: Sweet retreat in JP
summary: A lovely top floor retreat in the Forest Hill area of JP. We are located smack dab in the middle of Harvard's Arboretum, Franklin Park and Franklin Park Zoo, and the Forest Hills Cemetery. A very short walk (5 minutes) from the Forest Hills Orange line station and a mere 15 minute T ride from downtown Boston. It's an even shorter trip into the heart of JP and the wonderful breweries and restaurants it has to offer.
space: Two spacious bedrooms, a master bath with shower and tub, and a sitting room. Sleeps six. While there is no kitchen, we provide a mini fridge, microwave, dishes, and coffee and tea for your convenience.

name: Large room in B&B for up to 4 people, free bfast
summary: We offer a large room in our bed and breakfast with free breakfast, free parking and complimentary coffee, tea, granola bars, fruit, and baked goods all day.
space: The Perkins Inn is a 9 room bed and breakfast located in Hyde Square, Jamaica Plain, Boston, MA. This is a beautiful 120 year old Victorian home decorated authentically with a helpful host living on site.
description: We offer a large room in our bed and breakfast with free breakfast, free parking and complimentary coffee, tea, granola bars, fruit, and baked goods all day. The Perkins Inn is a 9 room bed and breakfast located in Hyde Square, Jamaica Plain, Boston, MA. This is a beautiful 120 year old Victorian home decorated authentically with a helpful host living on site. Guests can access the whole house including common rooms, shared kitchens, 3 shared bathrooms and parking. Great neighborhood! Whole Foods, CVS, 7/11, and lots of restaurants around. Close to Jamaica Pond and the Arnold Arboretum. On the 39 bus route and a 10 minute walk from Jackson Square Station (Orange Line) or Heath Street Station (Green Line). There is plenty of parking. We receive many international guests who congregate together in our lovely house, creating a social atmosphere with enjoyable conversation over communal meals in our dining room.

access: Guests can access the whole house including common rooms, shared kitchens, 3 shared bathrooms and parking.

host_about:
The Perkins Inn is a small B&B in Jamaica Plain, 3 miles from the city center of Boston. The neighborhood is full of many private cafes, bars and next to the Longwood medical center and primary hospitals in Boston.

We offer free snacks, coffee and tea all day and a fresh cooked breakfast daily with each room. 

We look forward to hosting you soon.

Hammock on a private deck. Workout bench and dumbells. Coined laundry in the basement $2.50/load. Clean and safe neighborhood with great neighbors.

name: The Wyman B&B, Small economical room
summary: Prefer the comfort of a country mansion but need quick access to the city? The Wyman Bed & Breakfast offers cozy boutique lodging in a classic colonial setting. And with a complimentary home-made breakfast, there's no better way to start your Boston vacation.  Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (15%) and nightly fee ($25) will be charged upon arrival.
space: Our spacious rooms allow tons of natural light and feature colonial design with handsome hardwood flooring. All rooms are non-smoking and air conditioned with complimentary Wi-Fi. Upgrades to suites with TVs and kitchenettes are available upon request.  Jamaica Plain is a unique Boston community with more of a small town vibe versus the city. The neighborhood features inviting Victorian architecture with Mom & Pop restaurants and shops. But if you only came to see the Red Sox at Fenway Park or explore Boston’s nightlife and culture, Bean Town is still just a quick Uber ride away. name: 3 Cozy Bedroom 1 Bathroom Apartment
summary: Jamaica Plain is one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Boston. This apartment is very close to the historical Jamaica Pond, Arnold Arboretum, Heath St and Jackson Square train stations providing easy access to Downtown Boston. This three-bedroom apartment and an additional smaller room is cozy and comfy for six people, nothing is shared. You will have full privacy.. You will love this neighborhood along with the kind neighbors
space: NA
description: Jamaica Plain is one of the most diverse neighborhoods in Boston. This apartment is very close to the historical Jamaica Pond, Arnold Arboretum, Heath St and Jackson Square train stations providing easy access to Downtown Boston. This three-bedroom apartment and an additional smaller room is cozy and comfy for six people, nothing is shared. You will have full privacy.. You will love this neighborhood along with the kind neighbors I will be available anytime. Please don't hesitate to contact me. Center St is our main strip filled with great food options. The Jamaica Pond is 10 min walk away with beautiful scenery of trees and while ducks. The sunset view is a must see. Public transportation is as close as 2 minutes away. You will have the option of the bus, and two different train lines that can take you downtown.

name: Stayloom's Trendy Glam Oasis | near T
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: A one-of-a-kind homage to the modern glam aesthetic, our thoughtfully designed 3 bedroom home is your ultimate Boston travel destination. With a custom chef's kitchen, gorgeous open concept living area, and a private porch, this is the ideal location for friends, families, and colleagues who expect the Best of Boston. - 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, sleeps 10 - Professional interior decor - Chef's kitchen comes fully stocked with pots, pans, and other essential cookware - Custom dining area - Big TV in living room has streaming services available, perfect for movie night - Extra rollaway available (single bed) - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain, known fondly to locals as "JP," is one of the hippest neighborhoods in Boston. The area is known for its amazing green spaces and culinary scene; take a 5 minute walk to the scenic Franklin Park arboretum, or pick up a taco from Chilacates. JP's close proximity to downtown Boston makes this the perfect place for guests who want to explore the city while enjoying the local flavor of this quintessential Bean Town neighborhood.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as New York, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $999 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: Catch an orange line train from Green Street (5-8 minute walk) and you'll be in downtown Boston in about 15 minutes. If you're exploring Centre Street, take the 39 Bus to Back Bay Station.  JP is also the most bike-friendly neighborhood in Boston; the Southwest Corridor Park stretches to Back Bay and is well worth the ride. Didn't bring your bike with you? Rent a Bluebike, Boston bicycle sharing program, for $10/day. The closest Bluebike station is 3 blocks away from our home. Should you choose to bring a car, please be advised there is only on-street parking available. We advise all our guests to observe street signs and street cleaning days to avoid getting a ticket.
access: The entire apartment is reserved for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here. Should the rare maintenance issue occur, our ground team is available to assist. Check in is keyless; no need to worry about lost keys!
house_rules: Quiet hours begin at 11pm per Boston's noise ordinance. Please keep noise to a minimum after 11pm. Guests who break the noise ordinance or get the police called to the home will be evicted without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include my new daughter, traveling with my family, and trying to beat the NYT crossword puzzle. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities: Boston and New York. I hope I have the chance to show you their amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Franklin
Stay Heirloom

Should you choose to bring a car, please be advised there is only on-street parking available. We advise all our guests to observe street signs and street cleaning days to avoid getting a ticket.

interaction: You will have complete privacy here. Should the rare maintenance issue occur, our ground team is available to assist. Check in is keyless; no need to worry about lost keys!
house_rules: Please respect Boston's noise ordinance of 11pm. Keep noise to a minimum after 11pm, weekdays and weekends. Violations of the noise ordinance may be subject to eviction without refund.  Any visit by the police is grounds for eviction without refund.

neighborhood_overview: Jamaica Plain, known fondly to locals as "JP," is one of the hippest neighborhoods in Boston. The area is known for its amazing green spaces and culinary scene; take a 5 minute walk to the scenic Franklin Park arboretum, or pick up a taco from Chilacates. JP's close proximity to downtown Boston makes this the perfect place for guests who want to explore the city while enjoying the local flavor of this quintessential Bean Town neighborhood.
notes: Damage deposit: $1399 (non-Airbnb reservations)
transit: Catch an orange line train from Green Street (5-8 minute walk) and you'll be in downtown Boston in about 15 minutes. If you're exploring Centre Street, take the 39 Bus to Back Bay Station.  JP is also the most bike-friendly neighborhood in Boston; the Southwest Corridor Park stretches to Back Bay and is well worth the ride. Didn't bring your bike with you? Rent a Bluebike, Boston bicycle sharing program, for $10/day. The closest Bluebike station is 3 blocks away from our home. Should you choose to bring a car, please be advised there is only on-street parking available. We advise all our guests to observe street signs and street cleaning days to avoid getting a ticket.
access: Two unique units are reserved for your exclusive use. The doors to each apartment are facing one another via a connecting hallway. The apartments are not otherwise interconnected.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here. Should the rare maintenance issue occur, our ground team is available to assist. Check in is keyless; no need to worry about lost keys!

name: Private Room with Rooftop Access- Near Subway!
summary: Unique apartment with PRIVATE rooftop terrace close to the subway! Very convenient location in central Jamaica Plain! All ethnicities & identities welcome. Everything easily accessible, NO car needed. Close to Jackson Square (Orange Line) and Heath St (Green Line). Whole Foods grocery store & multiple restaurants are a block away.  -$20 Uber / 7 miles from the airport. - Downtown Crossing Station is 7 stops from Jackson Square (our stop).  - The apartment has a bunch of stairs. No elevator.
space: My apartment is centrally located in the hippie/foodsie neighborhood of Jamaica Plain in Boston.  We have a large PRIVATE ROOFTOP that is only accessible via the apartment. There is a sofa and table available for you to have dinner under the stars. ✨✨ There are Ethiopian, Cuban, Chinese, and American restaurants a block over on Centre St.  I love the diversity of the neighborhood! ❤️  The grocery store, Whole Foods, is only two blocks away. In the summertime, there are music festivals a couple of blocks away. You can hear the music from the rooftop.  Want to go for a run? The Jamaica Pond is .6 miles away. ‍♀️‍♂️ Street parking is FREE and available around the apartment.

notes: NA
transit: You can walk everywhere around here. The subway is less than a mile away. There are also Hubway bikes that you can rent for the day. If you are interested in renting a car there is an app I use called Turo or a UHaul down the street.
access: NA
interaction: I live in the apartment so you will see me in passing. I try to stay out of the way unless you need something, I am happy to help!
house_rules: Be nice to the cat, Pickle.
host_about:
We are a mother & daughter team who enjoy hosting guests and making sure they feel at home during their stay. 

We have homes in Boston, Massachusetts and San Antonio, Texas. We enjoy incorporating our Latin culture throughout our homes so you will find both places decorated in a modern Mexican style. 

We are currently redecorating our Boston location to match our San Antonio location in our Frida theme. 

Thank you for your patience with this process. We hope you choose to stay with us during your visit to Boston or San Antonio. 

All the best,
Natalia & Roxanne Longoria :)

name: Quiet private room in Jamaica Plain
summary: Seeking a subletter for my room in Jamaica Plain for the month of August!  There are two other roommates (you'd be sharing a bathroom with one of them), but they'll be gone for much of the month. It will be mostly unfurnished by 8/1, but there will be a bed and mattress. Option to store a bunch of stuff, if you're moving from out of town to a place that becomes available on 9/1 and have a bunch of boxes. :-)
space: Renovated kitchen, back porch, central air, quiet street close to lots of fun shops, restaurants, whole foods. Washer and dryer free, in unit.
